loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Guapa está en el 1er. ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, cada una tiene un emprendimiento, o desean poder emprender uno, todo esto para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Pelagia se la distingue por su espíritu activista y emprendedor, cuenta con un comedor donde prepara higiénicamente comidas para todas las horas (desayuno, media mañana, almuerzo, merienda y cena). Cuenta con muchos clientes debido a su buena atención y amabilidad.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas y venderlas, como ser: verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas, panificados y otros insumos, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, y ayudar así a su familia.
texts.en:
The community bank Kuña Guapa is in its first women's committee loan cycle.  Each member has her own business or wants to start one, all in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

One of the members of this group is Pelagia who is known for her active spirit and enterprising attitude.  She has a diner where she prepares food hygienically at all hours of the day (breakfast, mid-morning, lunch, mid-afternoon, and dinner).  She has many customers because of her good customer service and kindness.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies to make and sell her food.  These include vegetables, meat, condiments, bread and other supplies, in order to continue sales and to help her family.

loans.use: To buy food supplies such as vegetables, meat, condiments, bread and other supplies.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen del Carmen está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, una zona alejada de la zona céntrica del país, pero que aún no tiene acceso a muchos medios, pero las integrantes luchan para poder crecer. 
La Sra. Maria es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas variadas, ella por medio de sus ventas tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y darles una vida digna y sin privaciones. Maria comenta que se unió al grupo para poder capacitarse e ir creciendo de esa forma con las capacitaciones que irá recibiendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropas, como ser remeras, camisas, pantalones, blusas, y otros, y de esa forma pode continuar con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante para poder seguir ayudando a su familia con su esfuerzo.
texts.en:
The community bank group known as Virgen del Carmen is in its first women's committee loan cycle.  It is located in the city of Concepción, an area which is remote from the central part of the country.  Despite the fact that it does not have much access to anything, the members all struggle to grow.

Maria is one of the members of the group and she sells a variety of clothing.  Through her activity she is able to help her family and give them a decent lifestyle which lacks for nothing.  She says she joined the group to get training and grow through her continued learning.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothing such as t-shirts, shirts, pants, blouses and other items so she can continue her sales activity.  She is grateful for the opportunity to grow and get ahead so she can continue supporting her family with her efforts.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell, such as t-shirts, shirts, pants, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima, 40 years old, lives with her one son in the village of Kandi, Murshidabad district, West Bengal. Since she has lost her husband, she started her business of making puffed rice at her home and also started an animal husbandry business. Her only son runs a small cycle shop in his locality.

Her small family survives on the income brought in by Purnima's business. She raises cows in her animal husbandry business and sells the milk to her neighborhood and local dairy shops. She also sells cow dung, which is widely used as farm manure in her locality. She also makes puffed rice and sells to the villagers. Purnima diligently saves a little amount and the rest is spent for her family's household expenses. But practically, she needs to save much more for future emergencies and to improve her family’s living standards.

So, Purnima plans to enhance her milk business by buying an extra cow. The extra milk will bring in an extra income per month, which would be a substantial amount at the end of the year. So she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a dairy cow.

She hopes it will be a key step towards her goal of earning more, saving better, and achieving the financial stability to provide a good future to her family.

She is grateful to her lenders' support.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Junta De Saneamiento Vallemi Group

texts.es:
La Junta de Saneamiento de Vallemi, es de la ciudad de Concepción, a través de esta junta de saneamiento lleva el servicio fundamental del agua a muchas personas de esa ciudad.
Esta junta empezó con solo unos cuantos usuarios, hoy ya muchas personas están accediendo a este servicio. Comenta que han podido crecer poco a poco, y que en vistas a mejorar su servicio piden este préstamo, para la compra de medidores de agua, para poder seguir modernizándose y mejorar el trabajo que hacen.
texts.en:
The Board of Health of Vallemi is in the city of Concepcion, and through this board passes the fundamental water service for many people in the city.

The board started with only four users but now there are many more people who subscribe to the services.  It has grown little by little, and in an effort to offer better services, it is requesting a loan.  This is to buy water meters to continue with its modernization and improve the work it is doing.

loans.use: To buy water meters.

loans.name: Manimala

texts.en:
Manimala is a married woman who hails from Kandi. She is 43 years old and lives with her husband and son in their own house at Saktipur in Kandi, the district of Murshidabad. She is running an animal husbandry business. Her husband runs a shop where he sells a variety of utensils. Her son is a student of grade 12.

To earn additional income for the family, Manimala started to practice livestock. She raises cows and sells milk to her neighbors and local villagers. Now she wants to enhance her business for better income and lifestyle. So Manimala is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase an additional dairy cow to fulfill the demand for milk in her region.

Having understood the market requirements, she hopes to make enough money to meet her high family expenses. She thinks that the loan will benefit her family with the financial capability to improve the lifestyle and enable her to provide better education to her son.

She is grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her existing milk supplying business.

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima is a 29-year-old rural housewife. She lives in a remote region of Kandi with her husband Dilip and two daughters. Both the daughters are students. She studied up to grade eight but the poor economic resources of her parents did not provide her with further education.

Purnima's husband runs a small grocery shop adjacent to their house, which is the only source of income for their family. He sells daily necessities like sugar, rice, flour, biscuits, bread, eggs, etc. and also some vegetables like potatoes, ladies finger, ginger, etc. Purnima also takes care of the shop. Now he is making good sales these days and has attained many regular clients. He wants to take advantage of this good fortune. He would like to stock his shop with a variety of grocery items to extend better service to his customers as well as to strengthen the family economy. To help her husband, Purnima applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner).

She wants to restock the store with more grocery items to fulfill the customers' demands so that they will retain and encourage more customers. She hopes it will generate more income and expand the business to make her dreams of giving a better education to her children come true.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of grocery items for her husband's grocery store.

loans.name: Mithu

texts.en:
Mithu is a 38-year-old woman from a rural village of Kandi in the district of Murshidabad in West Bengal. She is blessed with three daughters. One of her daughters is married and other two are students. Her husband is a mason by profession. His income is very inconsistent.

Mithu is a very active woman who wants to raise the financial status of her family. She has been raising dairy cows for five years. She sells milk in her neighborhood. For additional income, she also sells cattle by-products like cow dung to her customers who use it as manure in farming. Now she wants to increase her income by expanding her milk-selling business, as there is more demand for milk in the village and also in the nearby towns. So Mithu is planning to buy another cow. Thus, she is asking for a loan from BJS, a Kiva partner.

She feels that production of milk in a huge quantity will help her to earn extra income for leading a smooth life, and provide her daughters all sorts of educational help, which she was deprived of in her childhood.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for the expansion of her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Chumki

texts.en:
Chumki is an 18-year-old active married lady who lives in the small village of Kandi in West Bengal. She lives with her husband. Chumki studied up to grade nine.

The main source of income of Chumki's family is from a Toto rickshaw transportation service (Toto is like an auto rickshaw which is operated by battery). Her husband has been doing this work for two years. He is running the Toto in the towns nearest to Kandi. Toto is a very popular transport in a small town like Kandi. It is also very environmentally friendly as it is operated by battery and also safe for children and elderly people. Now the Toto needs some repairing and also needs to have the battery changed. But her husband does not have sufficient money to bear the repair cost.

Therefore Chumki wants to avail a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to bear the repair cost and buy a battery for the Toto rickshaw. After repairing the Toto rickshaw, they expect a good income. This will help her to generate extra income and she will be able to complete the construction of her semi-concrete house.

Chumki will be ever grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to repair and buy a battery for her Toto rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El trabaja como supervisor en una empresa de reciclaje, tiene 60 de edad su estado civil es casado. Hace meses sufrió un aparatoso accidente de carretera y se encuentra en silla de ruedas. Necesita una cirugía en el ojo derecho debido al desprendimiento de retina que sufrió durante el accidente, de no recibir atención corre el riesgo de perder su ojo.
texts.en: This gentleman works as a supervisor at a recycling company.  He is 60 years old and married.  Months ago he was in a serious accident and was confined to a wheelchair.  He needs surgery on his right eye due to a detached retina that he suffered during the accident.  If he does not receive attention for his condition, he is at risk of losing his eye.

loans.use: to pay for eye surgery.

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Twenty-five-year-old Lili is a rural woman from Kandi. She is a married woman and a mother of three young children (one son and two daughters). One of them goes to school and the others are preschoolers. Her husband is a small service man. This provides him with very little income, hardly enough for the family. He tries hard to raise all the household expenses but his income is too small for a family of five.

Now Lili is thinking of buying a new cycle rickshaw, which she plans to give on rent for an additional income. There are very few means of transport in the villages; rickshaws are in great demand in rural areas for transportation. Thus, Lili has sought a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a cycle rickshaw.

It will help her to earn more and in the long run take a step closer to a better future for their family and better education for her children. She aspires to construct a concrete house in the future for her family’s well being.

She is grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cycle rickshaw for renting to others

loans.name: Kuña Tekove Group

texts.es:
20 son las mujeres que integran este grupo llamado KUÑA TEKOVE está en su ciclo 1º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde desarrollan el trabajo en equipo y  se esfuerzan por mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
La Sra. Angela, es una  las integrantes del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas variadas que ella misma hace todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día. Angela es una mujer muy emprendedora que quiere salir adelante, es por ello que pone lo mejor de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante. 
Angela pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos variados para poder hacer comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir esforzándose para poder crecer y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
There are 20 women that make up the group named “Kuña Tekove”. They are participating in their first loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program so that they can work as a team. In addition, they are participating in the poverty elimination program so that they can strive to improve their living conditions.

Sra. Angela is a member of this group. She sells various dishes that she prepares herself. Every day she begins her work in the early morning hours. Angela is a very enterprising woman who wants to get ahead. For this reason, she is doing her best to grow and move forward.

Angela is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of various supplies for preparing her dishes such as vegetables, meat, condiments, greens, and other ingredients. This will allow her to continue striving so that she can grow and help her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, greens, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Marilina

texts.es:
Marilina es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, ella está estudiando para poder ser Técnico Superior en Fútbol.
Le gusta mucho el futbol, es por eso que decidió estudiar esta carrera, es una mujer muy emprendedora que lucha por poder salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Marilina is from the city of Carapeguá. She is studying to become a certified soccer trainer.

Marilina greatly enjoys soccer, which is why she decided to study for this degree. She is a very enterprising woman who strives to get ahead. Marilina is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the payment of her degree fees. This will allow her to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Edith

texts.fr: Agée de 44 ans, Edith est une femme mariée qui vit à Baguida. Ayant quatre enfants à charge, Edith est une revendeuse de médicaments traditionnel et moderne. Edith s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités de racines miraculeuses, de poudre rapide et des pommades médicalisées. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne vente, Edith va pouvoir aider son mari à prendre en charge les frais scolaire de leurs enfants dès cette rentrée scolaire.
texts.en: Aged 44 years, Edith is a married woman living in Baguida. With four children in her care, Edith is a reseller of traditional and modern medicines. Edith gets her supplies twice a month at the market and is requesting this loan to order units of miraculous roots, quick powder and medicated creams. With the profit margin resulting from a good sale, Edith will be able to help her husband take care of their children's school fees from this school year.

loans.use: to buy 17 units of quick powder, 20 units of miraculous roots and 8 units of medicated creams.

loans.name: Amassagou Group

texts.fr: Mariam est la femme qui a la corne du  bélier sur la photo. Mariam est une malienne, âgée de  55 ans, non alphabète, mariée et mère de 5 enfants,   âgée de10 ans  à 29 ans,  dont un  scolarisé. Son mari est cultivateur.	Mariam  fait de l’élevage ovin depuis 10 ans, Elle fait  recours au prêt  du  RMCR  dans le but d’acheter assez de moutons, les élever puis les revendre.  Elle achète ses moutons dans les différentes foires de sa localité, puis les revend dans  les  foires environnantes  et  souvent à domicile. Elle est souvent confrontée   à certaines difficultés (les méventes, approvisionnement en aliments bétails, les épidémies) mais relève le défis avec  son mari qui lui cherche toujours la solution. Mariam  souhaite  dans l’avenir avoir  un prêt plus élevé afin d’ accroitre  ses activités en achetant beaucoup  de  béliers  et gagner plus de profit, cela lui permettra  d’aider ses enfants à étudier,  pourvu d’avoir  des personnes instruites dans  sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariam is the woman holding the ram's horn on the photo. Mariam is Malian, 55 years old, illiterate, married and the mother of five children, aged 10 to 29 years, of whom one goes to school. Her husband is a farmer.

Mariam has been raising livestock for 10 years. She is requesting a RMCR loan with the objective of buying enough sheep, raising them then reselling them. She buys her sheep in the different fairs in her locality, then resells in the surrounding fairs and often from home. She is often confronted with certain difficulties (slumps in sales, purchasing livestock feed, epidemics) but faces these challenges with her husband who always looks for the solution.

Mariam hopes in the future to have a higher loan so as to increase her activities by buying many rams and earning more profit, this will allow her to help her children to study, so that there can be educated people in her family.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale.

loans.name: Afiwavi Enyonam

texts.fr: Agée de 31 ans, Afiwavi est une femme divorcée qui vit à Tonkoin avec un enfant à charge. Afiwavi est une meunière des condiments. Pour subvenir à la paye de ses charges d’exploitation, Afiwavi sollicite ce prêt pour en faire usage. Avec le gain qui en résultera de son activité, Afiwavi va pouvoir bien prendre en charge les dépenses de son enfant en lui payant les frais scolaire dès cette rentrée.
texts.en: Aged 31 years, Afiwavi is a divorced woman living in Tokoin with one child in her care. Afiwavi is a condiments miller. To meet the payment of her operating expenses, Afiwavi is requesting this loan for this use. With the gain which will result from her activity, Afiwavi will be able to handle her child's expenses by paying the school fees from this school year.

loans.use: payer les charges d'exploitation(frais d'électricité, du local, )

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: LA SEÑORA ES UNA PERSONA MAYOR DE EDAD QUE POR PROBLEMAS DE UNA ENFERMEDAD CRÓNICA QUE PADECE Y TAMBIÉN DEBIDO A SU EDAD PRESENTA PROBLEMAS DENTALES SERIOS, POR LO QUE LE URGE UN TRATAMIENTO PARA PODER REAFIRMAR SUS PIEZAS Y AS+I EVITAR DESGASTE POSTERIOR.
texts.en: This borrower is an older woman who suffers from chronic health problems.  Due to her age, she also has serious dental problems.  For this reason, she is in urgent need of treatment to strengthen her teeth and prevent them from eroding in the future.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Antoinette Léonce

texts.fr: Antoinette est une femme mariée dynamique qui vit à Tokoin avec ses deux enfants à charge. Antoinette est âgée de 42 ans et  s’active parfaitement  pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Antoinette est une revendeuse de pagnes qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Antoinette sollicite ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes en vue de bien vendre afin de répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Antoinette is a dynamic married woman living in Tokoin with her two children in her care. Antoinette is 42 years old and works perfectly to have a good financial situation. She is a traditional cloth (pagne) reseller who gets her supplies four times a month at the market.

To meet her objectives, Antoinette is requesting this loan to order pieces of pagne so as to make good sales and respond favourably to her clients' expectations. She will have a remarkable financial autonomy to help her children in their school education.

loans.use: to buy seven pieces of traditional cloth (pagne).

loans.name: Jatypeka Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama  Jatypeka es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ellas son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades, manifiestan que están conformes y sienten el apoyo del programa de comité de mujeres.
Una de las personas del grupo, que se destaca por su entusiasmo y positivismo es la Sra. Anselma, quien se dedica a la cocina y venta de comidas, es una mujer muy trabajadora que por medio de su trabajo lucha para poder ayudar a su familia para darles una mejor vida.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de utensilios de cocina, para poder seguir con su trabajo, y de esa forma seguir dando un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The Jatypeka group is located in the city of San Ignacio. They are united and supportive of each other. They work together on activities. They say that they agree with and feel the support of the women's committee program.

One of the people in the group, who stands out because of her enthusiasm and positive attitude, is Anselma. She cooks and sells food. She is a very hardworking woman who through her work fights to be able to help her family to give them a better life.

She is asking for this loan to buy cooking utensils to be able to continue with her job. This way, she can continue giving her customers a better service. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to improve every day.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils.

loans.name: Mujeres Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo MUJERES VENCEDORAS está en su ciclo 1º del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que tiene muchas expectativas de mejorar sus vidas a través de las capacitaciones que irán recibiendo a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza. 
 La Sra. Ruth, es una  las integrantes quien es una mujer muy trabajadora, que se esfuerza por su familia, ya que quiere darles una buena calidad de vida a través de su trabajo. Ruth se dedica a la venta de jugos naturales que ella hace y vende de manera ambulante.
La Sra. Ruth solicita de este préstamo para la compra de más frutas, para hacer sus jugos, y de ese modo aumentar sus ventas y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The MUJERES VENCEDORAS group is in its 1rst cycle of the women's committee program. It is a new group that has a lot of expectations of improving their lives through the trainings they will be getting through the poverty elimination program.

Ruth is one of the members. She is a very hardworking woman for her family. She wants to give them a good quality of life through her work. Ruth sells natural juices that she makes and sells as a street vendor.

Ruth is asking for this loan to buy more fruit to make her juices. This way, she will increase her sales and her income.

loans.use: to buy fruit to make juice to sell.

loans.name: Missiho  Gentille

texts.fr: Missiho est une femme célibataire âgée de 29 ans. Sans enfants, Missiho est une revendeuse de condiments résidant à Tokoin. Missiho achète ses marchandises trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Missiho sollicite ce prêt pour commander des paniers de tomates fraîches et de piment en vue de bien vendre et d’avoir un bénéfice pour aider sa famille à sortir de la misère.
texts.en: Missiho is a single woman aged 29 years old. With no children, Missiho is a condiment reseller living in Tokoin. Missiho buys her supplies three times a month at the market and resells from home and in the surrounding neighbourhoods. Missiho is requesting this loan to order baskets of fresh tomatoes and peppers so as to make good sales and earn a profit to help her family to escape poverty.

loans.use: to buy four baskets of fresh tomatoes and three baskets of peppers.

loans.name: Nueva Estrella Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, ellas están dentro de 9no. Ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, además ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando y esforzándose cada una para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
 La Sra. Elida, es una  las integrantes quien en su más reciente encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza mostró que ha ido mejorando mucho. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante y se esfuerza para poder dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 
Elida tiene una despensa y pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder surtir su negocio, con: verduras, frutas, bebidas, lácteos, panificados y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
There are 17 women who make up this group. They are in their 9th cycle of the women's committee program. In addition, they are in the poverty elimination program, each one fighting and striving to improve their and their loved one's living conditions.

Elida is one of the members, who in her most recent poverty elimination survey showed that she has improved a lot. She is a very hardworking person who wants to get ahead. She strives to give her family a better quality of life.

Elida has a store and she is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in buying materials to stock her business with vegetables, fruit, beverages, dairy products, baked goods and more. This way, she can continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, beverages, dairy products, baked goods and more to stock her store.

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima is a young entrepreneur who hails from Kandi. She is 21 years old and married. She is mother of a 2-year-old daughter. Her husband runs a small tea stall. His meager income is insufficient to cover the family's household expenses.

Purnima is a rural woman, and she is determined, strong, and hardworking. She rears cows and sells cow milk to her neighbors and local villagers. Thus, she helps the family financially.

As there is a huge demand for milk in the locality, she wants to enhance her business and improve her income for the benefit of her family by buying a dairy cow to produce more milk. For that she is asking for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

She hopes the additional milk will help her to sell more not only to satisfy her customers but to strengthen the family economy. She aspires to provide the best education to her daughter.

Purnima is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Irarani

texts.en:
Irarani is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of one daughter who is married. Irarani lives in her own small house at Kandi, a remote region in the district of Murshidabad, West Bengal.

Irarani's husband, Gopal, has a stationery shop and he sells different seasonal items like Rakhis, Diyas (oil lamp made of clay), kites, etc. from his shop. (A Rakhi is a cotton bracelet, typically bearing elaborate ornamentation, given at Raksha Bandhan by a girl or woman to a brother or someone she considers as one, who must then treat her as a sister.)

Irarani strives hard to improve the living standard of her family. Irarani helps her husband to sell cosmetics and other seasonal item from their stationery shop. By hard work, they have developed their business. But with the growing prices of household essential commodities, Irarani needs to further develop their business.

So Irarani applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS to buy Rakhi and other stationery items like cosmetic products in bulk. With this loan amount she will be able to meet the demands of her customers as well as earn more to strengthen the family economy for a better future.

She is grateful to her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy Rakhi and necessary stationery items in bulk for their stationery shop.

loans.name: Soma

texts.en:
Soma is an inhabitant of small village of Kandi under the district of Murshidabad. She is 25 years old and resides with her husband and only son. Her son studying in grade 2. Soma studied up to grade 9 and her husband read only up to grade 6.

Soma's husband, Rudradeb, is a photographer by profession and he has a photo shop in a nearby market area. His potential customers are his neighbors. There is a great demand for good photography and a good photographer in the locality. Each and every social event now needs a photographer to preserve the magical moments for future, and photography creates an immense expectation.

But good photography needs a good camera and due to lack of capital, they cannot expand their photography business.

Soma, who is a sensitive and intelligent lady, understands that the only way out is to avail some financial help through which she can expand their business and thereby they can earn more income. Thus she has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase a better camera for this business.

She is very much hopeful that this investment will fetch her more income to fulfill her dream of purchasing a shop in the near future for the photography business.

She thanks her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a better camera for her photography business.

loans.name: Sima

texts.en:
Sima is a rural woman of 27 years who hails from a remote village at Kandi in the district Murshidabad. She is married and a mother of two young daughters who are student of different grades.

Sima's husband, Debnarayan, has been running a rental business in which he gives musical items on rent such as microphones, speakers, etc. for various occasions like marriage ceremonies, birthday parties, festivals etc. The business is lucrative and has the potential of being a good source of income.

As the festive season is coming near, the couple wants to avail the opportunity and thus Sima is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase more musical equipment for her husband’s business.

She hopes this will enable her to meet the customers' demands and bring good earnings for the financial stability of her family. The increased income will help to run her daughters’ education costs and put savings aside to use in any future emergency.

Sima and her husband are thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment for her husband's rental business.

loans.name: Champarani

texts.en:
Champarani is a resident of small village of Kandi under the district of Murshidabad, West Bengal. She is a 45-year-old unmarried lady who resides with her brother. Champarani studied up to grade 7.

Though Champarani lives with her brother, she has to make some money for her own livelihood. So she started her own business of washer making, which is profitable.

There is a great demand for washers in the locality and to make a good quality of washer she needs some small plate made with iron and tin. To purchase this iron and tin plate requires some good amount of money and due to lack of capital, she cannot expand her washer-making business.

Champarani understands that the only way out is to avail some financial help through which she can expand her business and thereby she can earn more income. Thus she has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase some iron and tin plate for making washers easily.

She is very much hopeful that this investment will raise her income to fulfill her dream of purchasing her own house in the near future and also secure her future by earning and saving more money.

She thanks her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase iron and tin plate for her washer-making business.

loans.name: El Arenal Group

texts.es:
Existe una comunidad mexiquense pequeña y tranquila la cual es habitada por personas muy alegres y trabajadoras. Gran parte de su población se dedica a la cultivo de maíz y al comercio de cualquier tipo de artículos como plásticos, fibras, mochilas, artículos ornamentales, etc. Algunos viajan hasta otros estados de la república en donde pasan meses enteros para poder vender toda su mercancía, sin embargo la nostalgia por su familia y comunidad hace que regresen de inmediato una vez terminada su labor.
   Verónica es una persona muy alegre, integrante del grupo El Arenal quien ha formado una familia con tres niños los cuales se encuentran estudiando la secundaria y  la primaria. Vero, como le dicen en su comunidad, junto con su esposo Librado comenzaron con la venta de diversos artículos, por ejemplo, Vero normalmente vende mochilas y bolsos mientras su esposo hace lo propio con accesorios para celular. De igual modo, entre los dos ofrecen ropa para la temporada de frio, banderas nacionales en septiembre, adornos navideños para fin de año y mercancía referente al día de muertos en noviembre. “Las ventas son buenas, el punto es encontrar las temporadas oportunas; los productos con los que obtenemos más ganancias son los de celular porque la venta es constante” comentó entusiasmada.
   Por otro lado, está muy agradecida con VF México ya que recuerda el gran apoyo que recibió cuando necesitaba una inversión inicial.  Junto con algunos ahorros pudo adquirir mercancía en cantidades grandes lo que representó mejores ganancias. Su éxito puede notarse con el cambio que realizo de vender de forma ambulante a tener un local fijo donde exhibir su mercancía. Uno de sus sueños es tener una casa propia ya que por el momento vive junto a unos familiares.
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Isabel y Zenaida quienes invertirán en productos de jarcieria; Alicia, en bonetería; Irene, en vasos de licuadoras; José Librado, en plásticos y ropa; Paulina, en bisutería y Rosa, en productos plásticos.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras debajo del quiosco municipal. Vero es quien viste chamarra color naranja.
texts.en:
There is a small and peaceful Mexican community which is inhabited by very cheerful and hardworking people. A large part of the population works growing corn and selling all sorts of items such as plastics, fiber goods, backpacks, decorative items, etc. Some travel to other states of the republic where they spend entire months to be able to sell all their merchandise, however the nostalgia for their family and community make them come back as soon as they finish their work.

Verónica is a very cheerful person, and is a member of El Arenal group who has formed a family of three children who are going to secondary and primary school. Vero, as she is called in the community, along with her husband Librado began to sell a variety of items. For example, Vero normally sells backpacks and bags while her husband does his own sales of cell phone accessories. At the same time, between the two they sell clothing for the cold weather, national flags in September, Christmas decorations at the end of the year, and merchandise for the Day of the Dead in November. "Sales are good, the point is to find opportune seasons, the products with which we get the most earnings are for the cell phones because the sales are constant," she said enthusiastically.

On the other hand, she is very grateful to VF México since she remembers the great support she got when she needed an initial investment. Along with some savings, she could get merchandise in large quantities which represented better earnings. Her success can be seen in the change that she has made from selling as a street vendor to having a fixed space to display her merchandise. One of her dreams is to have her own house because at the moment she lives with some relatives.

The other members of the group are Isabel and Zenaida who will invest in household cleaning products; Alicia in hosiery; Irene in blender jars; José Librado in plastics and clothing; Paulina in costume jewelry and Rosa in plastic products.

*The photo was taken on the stairs below the municipal kiosk. Vero is the one wearing an orange jacket.

loans.use: to purchase more cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Karabi

texts.en:
Karabi, 54, is a hardworking entrepreneur of Kandi. She lives with her husband and three children (two sons and a daughter) in a small village Dhallapara. All of her children are students in various classes. Her husband is a service man and she runs her own briquette selling business. She has been involved with this business for the last five years.

A briquette is a compressed block of coal dust or other combustible biomass material such as charcoal, sawdust, wood chips, peat, or paper used for fuel and kindling to start a fire. She purchases briquettes from the wholesale market and sells them in their neighborhood at a profitable price. In their local area, there is a huge demand for briquettes as they are used as fuel for cooking. So she always tries to supply good quality briquettes to her valuable customers.

Now she needs capital to expand her business. So Karabi is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy good quality briquettes in bulk.

She hopes there will be a boost in her earnings and she can lead a decent life with her family. It will also help her to enhance the business as well as provide her children a good quality education.

Karabi is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase briquettes in bulk for her existing business.

loans.name: Toxiflor Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad muy tranquila del Estado de México se integró un grupo con el nombre Toxiflor el cual hace referencia a la actividad de una de las integrantes dedicada a elaborar arreglos florales. Todos los integrantes son personas muy trabajadoras y sumamente responsables, sus negocios son garantía de buena calidad y mejor servicio.
   Doña Domitila es una mujer emprendedora quien ha emprendido varios negocios junto con su esposo. Uno de ellos es la producción de abono orgánico en sus dos presentaciones: sólido y líquido. Dicho abono es producido por crías de lombrices cuyo proceso es llamado “lombricaria” y consiste en adquirir lombrices de gran tamaño para posteriormente alimentarlas con frutas, comida y verduras; tiempo después estos animalitos transforman todo los residuos orgánicos en abono rico en nutrientes. Este producto puede aprovecharse en cualquier tipo de cultivo, los beneficios que resultan de él son sorprendentes ya que es más saludable y amigable con el medio ambiente a comparación con sus símiles químicos. 
   Doña Domi, como es llamada de cariño, tiene 16 años ininterrumpidos a cargo de su ecológica actividad. Aunado a esto se dedica a la elaboración de arreglos florales ya que, gracias a su abono, las flores que resultan de sus huertos son muy bellas y aromáticas.  Aunque inició casi por accidente ya que en cierta ocasión se le ocurrió salir a la plaza para ofrecer ramos de flores y al ver que sus ganancias fueron favorables decidió dedicarse por completo. De igual modo, su abono le permite cultivar haba, jitomate, nopales, duraznos, entre otros productos. Por si esto fuera poco, desde hace algunos meses inició con la cría de pavos que pondrá a la venta para navidad. 
     Está muy agradecida con los beneficios del préstamo porque sus negocios crecen gradualmente.  Con este nuevo crédito podrá comprar un vehículo para trasladar su mercancía, "realmente queremos un cambio para hacer más fácil el traslado" comentó.
   Las demás integrantes del grupo son: Teresa quien invertirá en refrescos; Vicente y José; en abono orgánico y Cornelio, en zapatos.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín del municipio, doña Domi es quien viste el suéter color azul.
texts.en:
In a very peaceful community in the State of México, a group was formed with the name Toxiflor which refers to the activity of one of the members, who works making flower arrangements. All of the members are very hard-working and extremely responsible people, their businesses are guarantees of good quality and the best service.

Domitila is an enterprising woman who has undertaken various businesses with her husband. One of them is the production of organic manure in their two forms: liquid and solid. This manure is produced by raising earthworms, a process which is called vermiculture and consists of getting large earthworms to later feed them with fruit, food and vegetables. Some time later, these little animals transform all this organic residue into nutrient-rich manure. This product can be used to advantage with any type of crop, the resulting benefits are surprising since they are more healthful and environmentally-friendly in comparison to their chemical parallels.

Domi, as she is lovingly called, has had 16 uninterrupted years in charge of her ecologic business. Along with this, she works making flower arrangements since, thanks to her manure, the flowers that are grown in her fields are very beautiful and aromatic. Although she began almost by accident, since at one point it occurred to her to go out into the plaza to sell bunches of flowers and when she saw her earnings were favorable, she decided to work at it completely. In the same way, her manure allows her to grow broad beans, tomatoes, prickly pears, peaches, and other products. As if this were not enough, some months ago she began raising turkeys which she will sell for Christmas.

She is very grateful for the benefits of the loan because her businesses are gradually growing. With this new loan, she will be able to purchase a vehicle to transport her merchandise, "We really want a change to make transportation easier," she said.

The other members of the group are: Teresa who will invest in soft drinks; Vincente and José in organic manure and Cornelio in shoes.

*The photo was taken in the municipal garden. Domi is the one wearing the blue sweater.

loans.use: to purchase a car to transport her flower arrangements.

loans.name: Los Lirios Group

texts.es:
El grupo Los Lirios está ubicado en una pequeña comunidad mexiquense que se caracteriza por su gran hospitalidad para con sus visitantes. Los integrantes del grupo así como la mayoría de sus habitantes se sienten especialmente orgullosos de conservar sus orígenes provenientes de la cultura mazahua. Las principales actividades económicas son la cría de ganado y el cultivo del maíz, alimento fundamental en la dieta de cualquier mexicano. 
   Cecilia es una chica muy alegre quien contagia su buen humor a los demás integrantes del grupo. Ha formado una familia junto a su esposo Rogelio y sus tres hijos de los cuales dos estudian la educación primaria. Ceci, como le llaman de cariño, desde hace 2 años se dedica a la renta de cimbra, esto es, renta tablones de madera los cuales son utilizados en la construcción de techos de concreto. Inicialmente el negocio era de su cuñado pero los que realmente enriquecieron la actividad fueron Ceci y su esposo y por ello decidieron adquirirlo totalmente. Actualmente solicitan de su servicio dentro de su comunidad e incluso de comunidades aledañas, estos mismos clientes los recomiendan y es así como se benefician gradualmente.  
   Por otro lado se encuentra muy agradecida con VF México ya que gracias a sus préstamos ha hecho crecer su negocio considerablemente, también pudo comparase una camioneta para trasladar todo el material que le soliciten. "El único reto es la competencia que existe en el mercado pero afortunadamente ya tenemos clientes seguros y nuestras ganancias son buenas" comentó. Con esta nueva oportunidad de préstamo compraría material para reparar la madera dañada asimismo gasolina, aceite, clavos, etc. 
   Una de sus metas es ampliar su casa o bien construir una nueva en donde tenga espacio para guardar sus materiales y su vehículo.
   Las demás integrantes del grupo son Refugia quien invertiría en abarrotes; Leticia, en ropa; María del Refugio, en abarrotes y ovejas y finalmente Laura que haría lo propio con artículos de fantasía.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del municipio del quiosco municipal, Ceci es quien viste la chamarra color rosa.
texts.en:
The Los Lirios group is located in a small community in the state of Mexico which is characterized by its great hospitality toward visitors. The members of the group, as well as the majority of the inhabitants, feel particularly proud of preserving their origins from the Mazahua culture. The primary economic activities are raising livestock and growing corn, fundamental food in any Mexican's diet.

Cecilia is a very cheerful young woman whose good humor is contagious among the other members of the group. She has formed a family with her husband, Rogelio, and their three children, of whom two are in primary school. Ceci, as she is lovingly called, for the past 2 years has worked renting trusses, which is to say she rents wooden boards which are used in constructing concrete roofs. Initially, the business was her brother-in-law's but those who really enriched the business were Ceci and her husband and for that, they decided to acquire it. Currently, their services are requested within their community and even in neighboring communities. These same customers recommend them and this is how they gradually benefit.

On the other hand, she is very grateful to VF México since, thanks to her loans, she has made her business grow considerably. She was also able to purchase a truck to carry all the material that is ordered. "The only challenge is the competition that there is in the market, but luckily we already have sure customers and our earnings are good," she commented. With this new opportunity for a loan, she would purchase material to repair damaged wood such as gasoline, oil, nails, etc.

One of her goals is to expand her house or build another one where there is space to store her materials and her vehicle.

The other members of the group are Refugia who will invest in groceries; Leticia, in clothing; María del Refugio, in groceries and sheep and, finally, Laura who would do the same with costume items.

*The photo was taken on the stairs of the municipal kiosk. Ceci is the one wearing a pink sweatshirt.

loans.use: to purchase materials to repair damaged wood such as gasoline, oil, nails, etc.

location.town: Santa Cruz Mextepec, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 28 years old. She is married and a mother of one child.

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 3 years. She earns a monthly income of eight thousand Kenyan shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase spraying chemicals for the crops.

Damaris will use the profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase spraying chemicals for crops.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 56 years old. She is married and a mother of 9 children.

Her business is a green grocery shop. She has been in the business for 30 years.

She earns a monthly income of eight thousand Kenyan shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Mary will use the loan to purchase tomatoes, onions, bananas, kales and cabbages for sale.

Mary will use the profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, bananas, kales and cabbages for sale.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 32 years old. She is married and has 4 children.

She does farming and has been selling the farm produce to her customers. The business has been profitable.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm to get more farm produce for selling and making more income to support her family.

Faith will use the generated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to grow more cash crops, make more income and to be able to improve the living standards of her family, as well as have a healthy family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm to get more farm produce for selling and making more income to support her family.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is 21 years old. He is not married and has no children.

He has had a motorcycle business for two years, and it has been profitable.

Ben has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase an additional motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to plough back into the business.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase an additional motorcycle

loans.name: Sarjina

texts.en:
Twenty-four-year-old Sarjina is an active and energetic married lady who lives in a small village of Kandi in the Murshidabad district of West Bengal. She lives with her husband and only son. Her son is just 2 years old. Sarjina studied up to grade 6, and her husband studied up to grade 7.

The main source of income of Sarjina's family is from a Toto rickshaw transportation service (Toto is like an auto rickshaw that is operated by battery). Her husband is running the Toto in the nearest town, Kandi, and in recent days, Toto is a very popular transport in small town like Kandi. It is also very environmentally friendly as it is operated by battery.

Now he wants to purchase his own Toto, but they do not have sufficient money to bear the cost of a Toto. Therefore, Sarjina wants to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). They will use the loan to buy a Toto rickshaw by adding some of their own savings. After getting a new, owned Toto rickshaw, they expect a good income. This will help her to generate extra income, and she will be able to complete the construction of her semi-concrete house and give her child a better life.

Sarjina will be ever grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to buy a Toto rickshaw for her husband's transportation business.

loans.name: Maa Kandhunibudhi Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Ambika is a 43-year-old lady standing to the extreme right in the photograph. She hails from a humble background and is a blessed mother of two daughters and one son. She resides in a small village of Sonepur, Odisha, India.

Ambika works as a florist in the community, and provides quality service to a large customer base. This is how she has been able to support the household finances. Ambika is well-known by her neighbors for being an honest and hardworking woman.

Ambika, along with her fellow group members, is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy sand, cement, a flush toilet, steel, and other materials to build a septic system so that she can provide her family with better hygiene.

She hopes to be able to rely on this loan, because she wants to do this project as soon as possible so that she can provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, a flush toilet, steel, and other materials to build a septic system

loans.name: Maa Kandhunibudhi Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Pramila is a 32-year-old married lady living with her husband and two daughters in the village of Sonepur in Odisha, India. The lady standing to the left-hand side of the photograph is Pramila.

She is engaged in the activity of making incense sticks, and she sells these sticks directly to the shopkeepers in the market. She started this business four years back when her family's economic condition was not good, and her husband was overburdened with family responsibility.

She has a plan to expand her business of making incense sticks by making them in large quantity and supplying them to the big dealers. She also wants to give training in making incense sticks to the girls of her village to make them self-employed.

She, along with her fellow group member, has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR. Pramila will use her portion of the loan amount for purchasing glue, sticks, raw materials for covering the sticks, fragrance, wrapping bags, etc.

She has a dream of running a training school for making incense sticks and supporting her father economically.

loans.use: to purchase glue, sticks, raw materials for covering the sticks, fragrance, wrapping bags, etc., to make incense.

loans.name: Mana

texts.en:
Mana is a 27-year-old married lady who lives in the small village of Kandi in the Murshidabad district of West Bengal. She lives with her husband and only son. Her son is 9 years old and studying in grade 3. Mana and her husband studied up to grade 8.

Her husband is engaged with painting work, and his income is inconsistent. Meeting the expenditures of daily life was becoming harder day by day for him. Mana is a hardworking lady and wants to help her husband to meet the needs of the family, so she started her home-based business with homemade items like bori, sattu, etc. Bori is a dried lentil dumpling popular in Bengali cuisine, and sattu is a flour consisting of a mixture of ground pulses and cereals popular in India.

Previously, Mana ground the pulses and lentils by her hand, but now she needs a mixer grinder machine to ease her work and serve more customers. She does not have sufficient money to bear the cost of a mixer grinder machine; therefore, Mana applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

She will use the loan to buy a mixer grinder machine and some raw materials like lentils, pulses, grams, etc., for her business. She expects a good income through the help of this loan. This will help her to generate extra income and give her child a better life and better education.

Mana will be ever grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a mixer grinder machine and raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Maa Kandhunibudhi Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Rashmita is a 35-year-old, physically challenged lady living with her husband; two daughters, ages 8 and 10 years old; and a son, age 5. She is the one standing to the right-hand side of the photograph.

She is engaged in the activity of weaving handkerchiefs. Her elder daughter helps her weave them.

The financial condition of the family is not good because Rashmita's husband is also a physically challenged person, and he is not able to do any kind of work.

She buys raw materials like cotton, thread and colors from a dealer and gives the finished goods to him. In return, she gets only the labor cost, which is very little. Rashmita has a plan to buy raw material directly from the market and sell her finished products in the market. Doing so will increase her income.

Rashmita, along with her fellow group member, has requested a loan of 30,000 Indian rupees. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase raw materials for weaving handkerchiefs.

She has a dream that her daughters get married into a good house and that she can save some money for her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for weaving handkerchiefs.

loans.name: Las Mujeres Sabias De Pariachi Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “LAS MUJERES SABIAS DE PARIACHI” conformada por 06 socios con deseos de trabajar y mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella es SHAROL una de las socias de 24 años de edad conviviente con 1 hijo dependiente. Ella tiene su negocio de venta de bebidas como gaseosas jugos y aguas el cual vende desde hace un año. Su mayor deseo es de poder implementar su negocio. Solicito el crédito para la compra de gaseosas y aguas minerales. El grupo “las mujeres sabias de pariachi” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir creciendo. Sharol es la tercera del lado derecho viste chompa color negro.
texts.en:
This is the Las Mujeres Sabias De Pariachi group. It is comprised of six members who wish to work and improve their quality of life. Sharol, age 24, is one of the members. She is in a common-law marriage and has one dependent child. She has a business selling drinks like soft drinks, juice, and water. She has been selling them for one year. Her biggest wish is to be able to establish her business.

She requested the loan to buy soft drinks and mineral waters.

The Las Mujeres Sabias De Pariachi group is grateful to the Kiva lenders who made this loan possible. It allows her to continue growing.

Sharol is the third one on the right, and she is wearing a black sweater.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and mineral waters.

loans.name: Sherkhon

texts.ru: Шерхон интеллигентный и серьезный мужчина. Он женат  и замечательный отец пятерых детей. Шерхон работает учителем в одной из средних школ своего района. Шерхону 61 год, но, не смотря на свой возраст, он очень много трудится. У него есть постоянная работа, однако этого не достаточно, чтобы прокормит семью. Шерхон хочет заняться животноводством, однако у него нет достаточно средств, чтобы купить скот для разведения. Шерхон с большой надеждой обратился за кредитом. Он верит, что с вашей помощью сможет начать свой новый бизнес и увеличить доход семьи.
texts.en:
Sherkhon is an educated and reliable person. He is married and   the caring father of five. Sherkhon works as a teacher in a secondary school in his region. Sherkhon is 61 years old, but, in spite of his age, he works very hard. He has a regular job, but this is insufficient to support his family. 

Sherkhon would like to start a cattle business but lacks the funds to buy cattle for raising. He is very hopeful about obtaining a loan. He trusts that, with your help, he will be able to launch his new business and increase his family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and start his new business.

loans.name: Maa Kandhunibudhi Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Tapaswini is 35 years old, and she is married. She is the one standing in the middle in the photograph. She lives in Sonepur, a rural town in Odisha, India. She has been working in agriculture, raising poultry for more than three years.

Her household was recognized by the local government as poor; moreover, the market need is low in this region. She has no collateral, so she can't get a loan from other banks or credit institutions.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR. Tapaswini will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.

In the future, Tapaswini hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Biswakrma Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Sima, 45, is an industrious and enterprising lady from an interior village of Sonepur, Odisha, India. She is the one standing to the right-hand side in the photograph.

She lives with her son, aged 19 years, in a small village of Odisha, India. Her son goes for schooling in a government school near her house. Sima is a divorcee.

Sima is engaged in a tailoring business and garment business. Her son helps her in her garment business as well as in her tailoring business, as he purchases sewing materials and garments from the big city.

Sima wants to expand her business, and for that she, along with her fellow group member, has applied for a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase a new sewing machine, thread, cloth, etc.

She hopes to make more money after this investment, and she is thankful to Kiva and People's Forum for this kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, thread, cloth, etc

loans.name: Maa Mahalaxmi Shg A-1 Group

texts.en:
Chanchala is 32 years old and married. She has owned a retail business selling groceries for five years. She is the one standing in the middle in the photograph. Chanchala lives in Sonepur, a rural town in Odisha, India.

The family earns a low income from their business, and it is not enough to provide basic living comforts. For example, one of the most critical needs is to have a hygienic latrine to use by the family.

For this reason, Chanchala, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a new latrine. She hopes that this loan could fulfill her family's need to have their own latrine.

In the future, Chanchala hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a new latrine

loans.name: Biswakrma Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Rinki is 36 years old and is standing to the right in the photo. She is a single mother who has a business of selling vegetables.

She hails from a small village of Sonepur, Odisha, India. Through her business, she provides for herself; her two sons, ages 9 and 10; and her two daughters, ages 14 and 12. Rinki, being a very hardworking woman, goes to work every day to provide for herself and her family.

In light of the necessity and demand that exists for her products, she, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy tomatoes, cabbage, peppers, carrots, and onions, among other vegetables, to grow her business and make more profit in order to improve her quality of life.

She dreams of providing her children a quality life and never making them feel the absence of their father.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbage, peppers, carrots, and onions, among other vegetables, to grow her business.

loans.name: Romelio

texts.es: Don Romelio de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica al transporte de carga desde hace 20 años, tiene muchos clientes por la responsabilidad que tiene  a la hora de manejar y por los precios accesibles, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su camión para poder continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Romelio, age 50, lives in his own house with his wife and their two children. He has been providing cargo transportation for 20 years. He has a lot of customers because of the responsible way he drives and for his affordable prices. With what he gets from his work he manages to pay for some of the household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy tires and to provide his truck with maintenance. He will do this in order to be able to continue with his work and to get better earnings this way.

loans.use: to buy tires and to provide his truck with maintenance.

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
Otilia, vive con sus padres y hermanos, ella es madre soltera de un niño, para cumplir con sus obligaciones actualmente se dedica a vender ropa, negocio que está funcionando desde hace un año, lo ejecuta de manera ambulante.
Con el capital podrá comprar ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, ofrecerá estilos renovados para tener un negocio más competente, considera que así tendrá mayores oportunidades de aumentar sus ventas e ingresos.
Su sueño es darle a su hijo lo necesario para salir adelante y que él pueda superarse académicamente.
texts.en:
Otilia lives with her parents and siblings. She is the single mother of one child. In order to fulfill her obligations, she currently works selling clothes. She has had this business, which she conducts in an itinerant manner, for one year,

With the loan she will be able to buy clothes for women, men, and children. She will sell newer styles in order to have an effective business. She thinks that this way she will have greater opportunities to increase her sales and her earnings.

Her dream is to give her child what he needs to get ahead and that he will be able to excel academically.

loans.use: to buy clothes for women, men, and children in order to sell newer styles and to have a more effective business.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 53 years old, married and blessed with three children.

He is a farmer; this is a business he has done for several years, and it has been profitable.

Titus has taken a loan to boost his business by purchasing farm inputs such as fertilizers and seedlings for planting in preparation for the rains.

With the anticipated profits, Titus will repay his loan and put it back into the business.

Titus hopes and dreams in future are to feed his family and expand his farming so as to feed the entire community.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seedlings for planting in preparation for the rains.

loans.name: Maa Mahalaxmi Shg A-2 Group

texts.en:
Twenty-eight-year-old Kamala from Sonepur, in rural Odisha, India, has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Kamala, her husband and her three children are among the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis.

Joining hands with two others whose families also face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, Kamala has formed a group and is hoping to address this issue. Without access to a toilet, their families walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. This puts them at risk of infection, molestation or attack, and even insect or animal bites.

With a toilet in their homes, they will be able to lead a healthier life and save the time they spent on walking long distances to relieve themselves. They seek a loan of INR 45,000 to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

Kamala is the one standing in the middle in the photograph.

loans.use: to build a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a repeat client to the institution. She is an enterprising single mother with one child.

Sarah operates a mobile money service point as her major source of income in Rukungiri town. She has done her business for over three years. However, Sarah has been constrained by limited capital to expand her business.

Sarah decided to approach Ugafode for financial assistance which has enabled her to make more profits. Sarah has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to add capital to her mobile money business. Sarah praises Ugafode for the financial support which has boosted her business, and she is now able to meet her financial needs that sustains her business.

loans.use: to boost her mobile money business (float).

loans.name: Leopardo

texts.es:
Leonardo, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, actualmente vive junto a su pareja y su pequeña hija.

Leonardo, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace más de 15 años, él siembra maíz y frijoles; este trabajo le ayuda a la sostenibilidad de su hogar; pero además de eso se dedica al comercio de ganado, este negocio lo inicio desde hace 5 años, el cual le deja muy buenas ganancias.

El crédito lo está solicitando para comprar ganado para destazar.

A futuro desea tener una familia estable y que el negocio que ejerce le permita la sostenibilidad de su hogar.
texts.en:
Leonardo, age 31, went to school through the fourth grade. He currently lives with his life partner and their little daughter. Leonardo has worked in agriculture for over 15 years. He grows corn and beans. This work helps him to support his household. He is also involved in the livestock trade. He started this business five years ago, and it gives him very good earnings.

He is requesting the loan to buy livestock to butcher.

In the future he wishes to have a stable family and for his business to allow him to support his household.

loans.use: to buy livestock to butcher.

loans.name: Nomali

texts.en:
Nomali is 27 years old. She is married with two children.

Nomali has had an electronics shop which she has bee running for one year. She will be using the loan to purchase electronics to sell and hopes that this will enable her to make more income and help her to pay school fees for her children.

Nomali's hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business, make more profits and open another business.

loans.use: to purchase electronics to sell and hopes that this will enable her to make more income and help her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg A-1 Group

texts.en:
Gharamani is a mother of a teenage child. The lady standing to the extreme left of the photograph is Gharamani. She is a daily wage laborer. Her family is dependent on agriculture for a living.

Gharamani and her family do not have a toilet in their home. They have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private, in dense bushes or isolated fields. They often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves in private. She and her family are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

Gharamani understands the importance of having a toilet at home. She leads a group that has come together to apply for a loan of 45,000 INR. They need the loan to build toilets in their respective homes. Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for these families. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. Your loan will provide these three families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step toward a better standard of living for them.

Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: to build a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Maa Mahalaxmi Shg A-3 Group

texts.en:
Jagyansini is a 32-year-old, rural woman who resides in Sonepur, Odisha, India, with her family. She has a family comprised of her husband and two sons. Both of her sons are associated with some income-generating work. Jagyansini is illiterate (only can sign her name). She has taken a great role in improving her family's livelihood.

Jagyansini's husband is a mason by profession, and she is associated with a fish-vending business. She has been engaged in this business for the past 12 years. She purchases varieties of fish at the wholesale rate and sells them in the local market and in her neighborhood. She has chosen this business as she knows this is a profitable business; most of the people are fond of fish in Odisha. Now, in order to generate more income, she wants to expand her business by purchasing more varieties of fish.

Thus, she, along with her fellow group member, has applied for a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva via People's Forum. The loan amount will help her to purchase good quality fish. She hopes to uplift her business in the future with the profit from the business.

Jagyansini is standing to the left-hand side in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase good quality fish.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is 29 years old. She is married and has four children. She does farming and has been growing cash crops to sell.

This is Angeline's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she will use the loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds for use on her farm so as to grow more farm produce to sell and earn more income to support her family.

Angeline will use the generated profits to pay school fees for her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her farming, make more income and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds for use on her farm so as to grow more farm produce to sell and earn more income to support her family.

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg A-2 Group

texts.en:
Debaki, standing to the extreme right in the photograph, is a humble and a simple lady from a small village of Sonepur, Odisha, India.

The area where she resides is quite underdeveloped, and there is no toilet and sanitation facility in her near vicinity. For this reason, she has to travel long distance to attend nature's call. She and her family are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

Therefore, Debaki, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. Debaki will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic and clean toilet in her home. Your loan will provide these three families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step toward a better standard of living for them.

Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: to build a hygienic and clean toilet in her home.

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg A-3 Group

texts.en:
Sebati, 36, is a very industrious and enterprising lady standing in the middle of the photograph. She hails from a remote village of Sonepur, Odisha, India. She has a family comprised of her husband and two sons.

Sebati and her family do not have a toilet in their home. They have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private, in dense bushes or isolated fields. They often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves in private.

Sebati understands the importance of having a toilet at home. Therefore, she, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. Sebati will use her portion of the loan amount to build a toilet and attach sanitary equipment to it.

Your loan amount will help her in maintaining hygiene and cleanliness and safeguard her family's health.

loans.use: to build a toilet and attach sanitary equipment to it.

loans.name: Jay Bajarangabali Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Maliphula is 42 years old, and she is married. She has had a manufacturing business making wood furniture for seven years. Maliphula lives in Sonepur, a rural town in Odisha, India. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is that her latrine is not hygienic. She, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true. Along with her business profit, Maliphula hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Pliscah

texts.en:
Pliscah is 33 years old. She is married to Pharis who is also a businessman. They are blessed with three children.

She has had a retail business for 10 years, and currently earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. She has borrowed KES 100,000 from VisionFund Kenya. This is her fourth loan after repaying her previous loans successfully.

She will be using the loan to purchase retail household goods. She hopes that the anticipated profit will help her to buy food for the family, pay school fees for her kids, save some savings in her personal account, pay for medical care, expand the current business, and repay her loan, too.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well-established retail business and to enjoy a better life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase household goods for her retail business.

loans.name: Ejohazaza Group

texts.en:
Aaron is a 39-year-old married father with 6 children and he is the president of the EJOHAZAZA group and he is the one who has a paper in his hands. He works everyday at his shop from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. While the work is tough and the hours are long, Aaron is committed to his business so that his children may have good future.

Aaron hopes to find further success with his business not only for himself and his family. Aaron has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy various products like soap, stationary, sugar, juice, eggs, etc. He hopes that the expanded offerings at his shop will increase his marketability and provide additional foot traffic among his neighbors.

With this loan, he will earn more profits which will allow him to keep reinvesting for better financial stability, as well as pay his children's medical insurance and hopefully a plot of land. Over the next five years, as his business continues to grow, Aaron hopes to earn enough money to have a big store and he will be able to buy motorcycle to help him in his business.

loans.use: to buy various products like soap, stationary, sugar, juice, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Hold Sobeh Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Mariatu is a forty-three years old business woman. She is a member of hold Sobeh sisters solidarity group. Hold Sobeh Sisters solidarity group has four members. (see group picture, Mariatu stands on the far left).

Nine years ago Mariatu established her charcoal and fire wood business to support her children in their schooling. She pays school fees, buys learning materials and provides food for her children. She opens her business six days in a week from 8am to 6pm.

“Hold Sobeh” group needs a total loan of 4,600,000SLL. Mariatu is entitled to 1,150,000 SLL which she will use to buy 25 bags of charcoal and 20 piles of fire wood to add to her business.
She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Mariatu is married with four children ages of twenty six, twenty three, twenty one and ten years and the youngest one is in school.

In the future, Mariatu plan to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.

Mariatu and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 25 bags of charcoal and 20 piles of fire wood

loans.name: Gor

texts.en:
Gor has been running farm for many years. He lives in Tsaghkalanj village of Armavir region with his wife, mother and 17-years-old daughter. Over years of hard work, Gor was able to get job in village municipality and develop his farming business. He currently keeps 4 piglets, and grows potato for selling.

He has now applied for this loan to purchase potato seeds, three oxen, forage for feeding the livestock. Gor has been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

This loan is very important, for Gor to enlarge his farm and to be able to improve his family's living.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, three oxen, forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Chariya's Group

texts.en: Chariya’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chariya works as farmer and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.
