Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Dien

texts.en:
Dien is 45 years old and married with three children. She is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in a rural area.

She is borrowing a loan through QBWDF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from cultivation.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Eligio

texts.es:
Eligio está estudiando la carrera de didáctica universitaria, es contador, y quiere poder brindar sus conocimientos a las demás personas.
Él quiere enseñar en la universidad, es por ello que está estudiando esta carrera, pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder cumplir con sus metas y anhelos.
texts.en:
Eligio is studying for a degree in Higher Level Education. He is an accountant and would like to pass on his knowledge to other people. Eligio wants to teach at a university, which is why he is studying for this degree. He is also doing his best in order to improve his living conditions.

Eligio is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the payment of his degree fees. This will allow him to accomplish his goals and dreams.

loans.use: to pay his degree fees.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 59 years old, married, and blessed with six children.

Mary plants and sells food crops, particularly potatoes. She has been in business for 10 years now. She also sell groceries and household goods.

She has borrowed a loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and potato seeds hoping that this will generate income.

Her hopes and dreams in the future are to expand the current business, buy food for the family, and pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and potato seeds.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a 23-year-old M-pesa and retail shop proprietor.

She is a mother of one whose spouse provides additional income. She has been in this business for one year and is doing well.

This is her first time borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase wheat, sugar, maize flour, and M-pesa float. The anticipated profit will be used to repay her loan.

She hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, sugar, maize flour, and M-pesa float.

loans.name: Oscar De Jesus

texts.en:
Oscar is 41 years old and lives in the municipality of Yarumal. He has 2 children, a boy who is 15 years and a girl who only is 5 years of age. They are the boost of Oscar’s life and the reason why he decided to start this same year his own business. He raises cattle, something he learned to do by himself.

His business is really traditional in Colombia, but no easy to manage because the costs of the inputs are really high, and the people who do this job don’t possess the capital to buy them. In order to make his business sustainable, he’s asking for a loan that allows him to buy 4 steers so he can increase his herd.

As the family is Oscar most important thing in his life, he dreams with giving them a great life, and to buy a house is part of this big dream, so he hopes his business let him to give that present to his family. Help Oscar now with a loan so he can accomplish this dream and more.

loans.use: to buy 4 steers so he can increase his herd for the benefit of his children

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is from Metsamor town of Armavir region. She lives there with her husband, parents-in-law and two chidlren. The family has been occupied in agricultural works for many years.
They cultivate tomato, eggplant, pepper and greens in their greenhouse. The greenhouse is partially damaged and needs some improvement so the family will be able to cultivate vegetables in winter as well.

Naira asks this loan to purchase polyethylene cover, wires for the greenhouse renovation and fertilizer for land cultivation.

Naira has been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. This loan is very important, for Naira to enlarge her farm and to be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for polyethylene covers, wires for the greenhouse renovation and fertilizer for land cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar system that allow them to light their house and improve their life quality.

loans.name: Hamada

texts.en:
Hamada is 38, married and has one son and 3 daughters. He has a small grocery store project and it is the only source of income to the family.

He is requesting 4000 EGP to buy some grocery products such as oil, rice and pasta to increase his income for his family.

loans.use: to buy some grocery products such as oil, rice and pasta. .

loans.name: 4 Woman 1 Man Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu is a thirty-six years old business woman. She is a member of “4 women and 1 man” solidarity group. (see group picture, Kadiatu is in the middle). She has been in food stuff business for the past 11 years. She opens her business six days a week from 8am to 6pm.

Kadiatu established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buy learning material and provide food from the profit she gets from the business.
Kadiatu and her group members needs a total of 5,750,000 SLL of which Kadaitu is entitled to Le 1,150,000 SLL which she will use to buy additional 2 bags of rice, cartons of salts, Maggi cubes, tomato etc. for her business.

She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Kaditu is married and has two children age eighteen and two months old baby; one is a school going child.
In the feature, Kadiatu plans to generate more money to provide for her children university education. She believes educating her children to university will better the lives of her family.
Kadiatu and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional 2 bags of rice, cartons of salt, Maggi cubes, tomato, etc .

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado LAS DIVINAS está en su ciclo número 23 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, se fijaron como meta ayudarse las unas a las otras para poder mejorar sus vidas. Están además dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, capacitándose para poder crecer.
Una de las personas que se destaca en el grupo por ser una mujer luchadora y que quiere salir adelante es la Sra. Daniela, quien se dedica a las confecciones, ella tiene un taller en el que todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano, haciendo todo tipo de confecciones, y con este trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas en cantidad, agujas, hilos, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group called “Las Divinas” (The Divine Ones) is in its 23rd loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are working and helping one another to move forward. The goal that they established is to help each other so that they can improve their lives. The members are also participating in the poverty elimination program and in training seminars so that they can grow.

Sra. Daniela is one of the members of the group who is known for being a determined woman who wants to get ahead. She is a seamstress and has a shop where she works every day, beginning in the early morning hours. Daniela produces all types of items from her sewing. Through her work, she has the means to help her family.

Daniela is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics in bulk, needles, thread, and other supplies. This will allow her to continue sewing just as before.

loans.use: to buy fabrics in bulk, needles, thread, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar system to light her home and allow her kids do their homework after sunset.

loans.name: Olga Celina

texts.en:
Olga is 39 years old and lives in the municipality of Puerto Salgar. She has one son who is 10 years of age, whom she loves very much. Since he was born, Olga is been looking for a way to provide for him but also where she can be independent, so last year she started her own raising chickens business, in order to solve her economic issues.

Sometimes the costs of the inputs can get really expensive, and for a mother who has to support alone her son, it can turn into a difficulty. That doesn´t stop her, and she found a way to improve her business, to make it sustainable. With the help of Interactuar and Kiva she expects to get a loan which allows her to build a new barn because she has 50 chickens and she’s going to buy a hundred more.

Olga dreams with leaving her business to her son one day, reason why she works really hard. You can help Olga to accomplish all her dreams with just a loan.

loans.use: build a new barn because she has 50 chickens and she’s going to buy a hundred more

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is 30 years old and lives in the municipality of San Pelayo. He is the father of a little boy who only is 8 years of age, and who has become the center of Manuel’s life. Having a son is a big responsibility that this man wants to face fatherhood with dignity, so he’s going to start his own business raising chickens.

He’s aware that his main objective is to provide for his family, specially his son so he has a good quality of life, so he’s determined to work hard so he can have good profits and can make his business sustainable. He’s asking for a loan so he can start his business and to buy some chickens and feed for them.

Manuel wants to accomplish great things and dreams of seeing his son do the same, giving him a good life. He also would like to improve the condition of his house. You can be part of this entrepreneur's story, help him and his business succeed by loaning now.

loans.use: start his business and to buy some chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon runs this variety store located in Tigbauan, Iloilo. It has significantly progressed in her ten years of operation. She started by selling basic commodities like sachets of shampoo and biscuits, and now she has wide array of inventory. Aside from this, she is also sewing dresses, skirts and blouses, because she has a background in designing clothes. She maximizes her talent in order to better prepare for the future. Her husband, Jose, is also doing his part by working as a driver. Their combined income sustains their family’s needs. But Corazon doesn’t stop dreaming. She aspires to bestow a stable business to her children someday. 

To develop her business further, she is requesting for an additional capital worth PhP 15,000. She plans to buy sacks of rice, assorted snacks, grocery items, and beverages. 

Corazon is a dutiful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, assorted snacks, grocery items, and beverages

loans.name: Angela Rosa

texts.es: Doña angela de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 26 años, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa y por los buenos precios con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Doña Ángela está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas sopas, leche, huevos, golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, etc. ya que le va bien en sus ventas y asi poder seguir teneiendo buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Angela is 63 years old and lives in her own house with her family group. For 26 years she has had a store located in her home. Due to the variety of products she sells and her good prices, she has many customers. From what she makes from her sales she manages to meet some of her family expenses.

Angela is seeking another loan to buy more soups, milk, eggs, candies, drinks, staple grains, etc., as things are going well with her sales and this will allow her to continue having good earnings.

loans.use: to buy more soups, milk, eggs, candies, drinks, staple grains, etc.

loans.name: Sol Piedad

texts.en:
Sol is 36 years old and lives in the municipality of San Pelayo. She is the mother of 5 children, 3 girls and 2 boys, whom are between 17 and 8 years of age. Her job as a mother is what she loves the most in her life, but her family is having some economic issues so she decided to start her own business raising pigs.

Since she was a little girl she has had an entrepreneur soul, and this is why she trusts her business is going to be very successful and is going to give her great profits so she can solve her problems and give to her family a good quality of life. She’s asking for a loan so she can start her business and buy some pigs and feed for them.

Sol’s house has some issues that she needs to repair so her family can live safely and comfortably. She hopes that this business can let her fix that and accomplish many more things. Help Sol now and see how she is going to turn her new business into a successful one.

loans.use: start her business and buy some pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Sira Del Carmen

texts.en:
Sira is 36 years old and lives in the municipality of San Pelayo. She has 2 little girls who are the center of Sira’s life and for whom she wants to succeed in life. The economic situation in her house isn’t in its best and is the reason why she decided to find a way to provide for her family. So she’s going to start raising pigs.

She’s ready to work really hard to obtain good profits from this new business in order to give to her daughters a good quality of life. She’s a strong woman who always stays positive even in a bad situation. She’s asking for a loan so she can start her business and can build a pigsty as well as buy some pigs.

Sira’s most important dreams concern her daughters, because they are the most essential thing of her life, so she wants to improve her house so they can live better, Loan now and help her achieve all her goals and start her own business.

loans.use: start her business by building a pigsty and buying some pigs.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.en:
Cesar is just 21 years old and lives in the municipality of Monteria. He is really young but thinks a lot about his future because he wants to be a successful person who can help his family. Since he was a boy he has always dreamed with having his own business, and he’s about to start it. He is going to be the owner of a bakery.

His stepfather has always supported Cesar so he can accomplish all his dreams, and he’s the one who taught him about baking so he can start his business on the right foot. Right now he doesn’t have the capital to do it, so he’s asking for a loan so he can start his bakery and buy some machines and start-up items he needs.

Cesar wants to go further in life, he dreams with being a professional, so he expects that his business give him enough profits to pay for his studies and to help his parents. He expects someday his business has many clients and sales a lot. Help this young man to accomplish all his dreams with just a loan.

loans.use: start his bakery and buy some machines and start-up items he needs.

loans.name: Eisela Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a 33-year-old married woman who lives in the municipality of Cocorna. She is the mother of a boy who is 14 and a girl who is 11 years old. She loves and feels very proud of her family. Unfortunately, they are going through a bad time economically speaking, so she is going to start a business raising cattle.

In order to obtain good profits from her business she is determined to work hard because she wants to support her family and give them the best quality of life she can. She’s asking for a loan to start her business and buy 3 steers to raise.

Margarita dreams with having a successful business that allows her to pay for a good education for her children, because she wants to see them become professionals and successful people. You can help Margarita with a loan, support her and watch her do great things.

loans.use: start her business and buy 3 steers to raise

loans.name: Aleja

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Aleja pertenece al banco comunal SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la  agricultura y a la ganadería, la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente, la socia lleva buen  tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes entre otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Aleja is a member of the Communal Bank “San Bartolome de Tambo Real”. She divides her time between her daily activities and her agriculture and livestock business. Aleja is very grateful to Kiva for helping her develop her business activities. Therefore, she promises to complete her loan payments on time.

Aleja has been in this business for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. She would like to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family. Aleja is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio de 55 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, el se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y de frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos para seguir teniendo una buena cosecha y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Julio is 55 years old and lives with his family group in a home they own. He works in agriculture, growing corn and beans. He sells his products in the different markets found close to his house. With what he makes from his sales he is able to meet some of his household expenses.

He is seeking another loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides and manure to continue having a good harvest, in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and manure.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: NANCY de 27 años de edad es soltera y tiene 3 hijos dependientes. Ella Pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “las emprendedoras” la cual lo conforman 07 socias con deseos de  trabajar honradamente y progresar. Ella hace más de 1 año que se dedica al negocio de confección de prendas de vestir. Gracias a su constante dedicación logro sacar adelante a  su familia. Su mayor deseo es poder ampliar su negocio. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de telas e hilos. La Alcancía “las emprendedoras” agradece a los Inversionistas de Kiva por el apoyo y se comprometen a seguir trabajando honradamente. Nancy es la segunda del lado izquierdo viste casaca color negro.
texts.en:
Nancy is 27 years old, single, with 3 dependent children. She belongs to the “Las Emprendedoras” communal bank, which was formed by 7 members with the desire to work honestly and progress. For over one year she has worked making articles of clothing. Thanks to her constant dedication she was able to move her family forward. Her greatest desire is to be able to expand her business.

She seeks the loan to buy fabrics and thread. "Las Emprendedoras" bank thanks the Kiva lenders for their support, and promises to continue working honestly. Nancy is the second from the left, dressed in a black jacket.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es:
María, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, por motivos económicos no pudo culminar sus estudios, es madre soltera, es comerciante en pequeño de mariscos, tiene dos hijos que están estudiando.

María, comercializa mariscos y tiene varios años de dedicarse a la venta de este producto, y la venta la realiza en la ciudad y se trasporta en bus cada día para poder vender en el mercado de dicho lugar.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar un motor para la lancha, que será utilizada para la pesca artesanal, con la ayuda de este préstamo será más factible la pesca y espera recolectar aún más mariscos.

María, desea tener en un futuro un negocio estable y formal, que le permitirá la sostenibilidad económica de su familia, para que de igual forma sus hijos puedan culminar una carrera académica.
texts.en:
Maria, now 40 years old, only studied up to eighth grade. For economic reasons, she could not culminate her studies. She is a single mother, a small-scale merchant of shellfish, and has two children who are studying.

Maria has sold shellfish in her city for many years. Each day she travels by bus to be able to sell her merchandise at the city market.

Maria needs a loan to purchase a motor for her boat, which will be utilized for artisan fishing. With the help of this loan, fishing will become more feasible and she hopes to collect even more shellfish.

Maria's desire for the future is to have a more stable and formal business that will offer her family economic sustainability so that her children can complete their academic careers.

loans.use: purchase a motor for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María con la ayuda del crédito anterior ha mejorado mucho la sastrería, hoy en día ya cuenta con dos máquinas de coser, con los nuevos ingresos aporta un poco más en los gastos de su hogar y cancelo las cuotas de la deuda.
Ve en los créditos una herramienta para mantener su negocio, solicita apoyo nuevamente para comprar telas, hilas, botones, agujas, zippers, aplicaciones, hombreras, etc., tendrá los materiales básicos para elaborar las prendas de vestir que le han solicitado.
texts.en:
María, with the help of the previous loan has greatly improved her sewing shop. Today she has two sewing machines and with the new income she can support the household expenses a bit more and is paying the installments of her loan.

She sees the loans as a tool to sustain her business. She is once again requesting help to buy thread, buttons, needles, zippers, appliqué, shoulder pads, etc. This will give her all the basic materials to make the clothing that has been requested of her.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, buttons, needles, zippers, appliqué, shoulder pads, etc. to have all the basic materials to make clothing.

loans.name: Alicia Del Carmen

texts.en:
Alicia is a 42-year-old married woman who lives in the municipality of Puerto Boyaca. She has three sons; they are 27, 21 and 10 years of age. Some years ago, her family was having some economic issues, so she decided to face the problem and start her own business. Now she owns a store where she sells different kind of products.

There’s a lot of competition where her store is located and the inputs can get a little expensive, so in order to improve her business, by increasing her sales and become more competitive, she’s asking for a loan so she can buy a show window, to paint a room and buy more market and beauty products, to expand the store.

Alicia has many dreams, but her biggest one is to be able of paying for the best education for her children so they all can be professionals. You can help Alicia to accomplish all her dreams with just a loan.

loans.use: buy a show window, to paint a room and buy more market and beauty products,  to expand her store.

loans.name: José Rául

texts.es:
José, de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, vive junto a su familia y un pequeño de 8 años de edad.

José, se dedica a la producción de granos básicos y a la producción de hortalizas, estos cultivos los realiza desde hace 10 años con el apoyo de su familia.

Jospé, necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y abono para la milpa.

A futuro desea ver a su hijo convertido en un profesional.
texts.en:
José is 53 years old and studied up to Grade 6. He lives together with his family and a 8 year old child.

José works growing basic grains and growing vegetables. He has been cultivating these for ten years with the help of his family.

José needs the loan to buy fertilizer and manure for his corn crops.

In the future he wants to see his son become a professional.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure for his corn crops.

loans.name: Jay Bajarangabali Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Bindu is 26 years old and is standing in the middle in the photograph. She lives in her own house with her life companion and her two children, aged 7 and 8 years old. She is a hardworking woman who, due to her friendliness, has many customers who visit her business of selling fruit and vegetables.

One factor that concerns her is that she does not have access to a hygienic latrine at her home. Therefore, Bindu, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to install a toilet in her home so that she would no longer have to depend on an open field for defecation.

This intelligent woman believes that it is the right time to get another Kiva loan with Peoples Forum. She will invest it in finishing construction on her bathroom: buy tile, cement, and a sink, and install a shower. She is dedicated to improving the health of her family, and that is why she is making these changes, which also help to stop ground contamination.

loans.use: to install a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Jovencia

texts.en:
Jovencia is a 41-year-old woman who lives with her spouse in the area of Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She wants to improve her business as well as the general living conditions of the entire family.

Jovencia has been making savings for many days in order to buy a new motorcycle unit to be used for her transportation business, but most of the savings have had to be spent on household expenses.

Now she wants to buy motor parts for motorcycle maintenance, but she does not have enough money to buy them. Therefore she has requested a loan so that she can buy the motor parts, with a contribution from savings.

She hopes that her tenant will drive the motorcycle with real devotion and will earn sufficient income.

loans.use: to buy motor parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Maxiliano

texts.es:
Maximiliano, de 42 años de edad, debido a la crisis económica que atravesaba su familia no pudo estudiar, actualmente se encuentra casado y es padre de familia de 3 hijos.

Maximiliano, se dedica a la producción de granos básicos desde hace 25 años, esta actividad la realiza con el apoyo de su familia; pero además decidió poner una pequeña tiendita en su casa desde hace aproximadamente 5 años.

Maximiliano, necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y abono para su milpa. 

Maximiliano, desea ver a sus hijos convertidos en todos unos profesionales y que su trabajo le sea rentable para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Maximiliano is 42 years old. Because of the financial crisis that struck his family, he was not able to go to school. He is currently married and is the father of three children.

Maximiliano has earned his living producing staple crops for 25 years. He carries out this activity with the support of his family; in addition he decided to set up a small shop in his house about five years ago.

Maximiliano needs the loan to buy fertilizers and soil amendments for his cornfield. He would like to see his children all become professionals and for his work to be profitable for him and for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and soil amendments for his cornfield

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en: Thy’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Thy works as farmer and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Oscar Orlando

texts.es: Oscar de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee un negocio de reparación y venta de relojes, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal desde hace mas de 20 años, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, El cliente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor como relojes, control para televisión, baterías, calculadoras, etc. y asi surtir con mas mercaderia para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Oscar is 48 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife. He has a business repairing and selling watches. He has had his business in the municipal market for more than 20 years. With the sales he makes, he manages to cover some of his household expenses.

Oscar is requesting a loan for the purchase of more products at wholesale, like watches, remote controls for televisions, batteries, calculators, etc., so that he can stock up with more merchandise in order to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more products at wholesale, including watches, remote controls for televisions, batteries, calculators, etc.

loans.name: Cúc

texts.en:
Mrs Cúc is 26 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years.Cúc lives in Hoang Hoa district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to comfort her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.
This is Cúc first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.
In the future, Cúc hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in Haykashen village of Armavir region with her big and nice family: her husband, two sons, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren.
Gayane helps her family to handle everyday costs with the income she gets from her agribusiness. More specifically, she cultivates greens, peach and apricot trees. After selling the harvest in local markets, Gayane gets income for her family. She asks this loan to purchase polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, fertilizer for the land cultivation and cover cultivation costs (watering, harvesting).

As this is Gayane's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance-loan program provides loans to people who don’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, fertilizer for the land cultivation and cover cultivation costs (watering, harvesting)

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 71 years old. She is widowed and blessed with 5 adult children.

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of forty thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya.

She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer. She will use the profits from expanded business to reinvest in the business.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a better business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: No Explain Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Aminata is a member of No-Explain solidarity group, she sells fish. Aminata has been selling fish for the past two years. She uses proceeds of his business to pay for her children’s education and to provide a livelihood for her family.

Aminata and other group members of No-Explain solidarity are requesting for their second loan. The group members are in need of a loan of 5,000,000SLL. Of this amount, Aminata will personally receive 1,000,000SLL which she will use to purchase more cartons of fish for her business. (see group picture, Aminata is on the right).

Aminata is 33 years, married with three children. She hopes that her business continues to exist, so that she can save enough money to build a house and also prepare for her old age. She hopes that this loan will earn her more profit for her to support her family
Aminata and her group members thank you for financing their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of fish for her business

loans.name: Om Hashem

texts.en:
Om Hashem is 37, married, and has a 2 year old son. She has a small grocery store project and it is the only source of income to the family. She previously requested 5000 EGP loan and successfully repaid it on due dates.

She is requesting 8000 EGP to buy some grocery products such as oil, rice and pasta to increase her income for his family.

loans.use: to buy some grocery products such as oil, rice and pasta. .

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 34 years old and lives in the municipality of Dabeiba. Life hasn’t been easy for this woman who has had to work really hard so she can provide for her family because they have been through bad economic times. These problems encouraged her to start her own business and now she has a raising chickens one.

She has some incapacity that can be a problem sometimes but which doesn’t interfere with her dreams. She wants to increase her clients so the sales can increase too and this way she can have a sustainable business. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy more birds, food for them and inputs the business needs.

Beatriz dreams with having a beautiful house with all the things she likes, so she hopes that her profits let her improve the conditions of her house. Support Beatriz by loaning, this will help her a lot.

loans.use: buy more chickens, food for them and inputs the business needs.

loans.name: Osladys Patricia

texts.en:
Osladys Patricia is 32 years old and lives in the municipality of Sonson. She has 2 children, a boy and a girl, whom she loves very much and they are her main reason for working hard.

Osladys Patricia has some financial problems so she has decided to start her own business and set up a restaurant. She learned to cook by herself and she is really good at it. She wants to start her business so she can provide for her family and give them a good quality of life.

She is asking for a loan so she can buy a refrigerator, a stove, utensils, a microwave and a blender to start her restaurant.

Osladys Patricia dreams of paying for an excellent education for her children so they grow up to be professionals. She is asking for just a little help to achieve all her goals, so please support her with the loan she needs.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, a stove, utensils, a microwave and a blender to start her restaurant

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 59 years old, married, and has three grown-up children.

She is managing a store and panciteria (eatery) for business. She is selling affordable and delectable foods in her eatery.

She would like to improve her sales. That is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy pancit (noodles) to cook and soft drinks, vegetables, and canned goods to sell. She will invest her loan to improve her merchandise.

She will save funds for emergency needs. She also promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy pancit, soft drinks, vegetables, and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Jairo Luis

texts.en:
Jairo Luis is 37 years old and lives in the municipality of Tierralta. He has 4 children, 2 sons and 2 daughters, who are between 15 and 7 years old. He loves them and feels really proud of all of them. They are the reason why he is determined to start his own business raising chickens, so that he can provide better for them.

He wants to start this business and make it successful. If he can get good sales and with those, good profits, then he can make his business sustainable. Right now he lacks capital so he is asking for a loan in order to be able to start his business by buying some chickens and building a barn for them.

Jairo Luis dreams big, and as he has a big family to whom he wants to give a good quality of life. He hopes his new business will help him to buy a house where his family can live safely and comfortably.

Please help Jairo Luis to accomplish all his dreams with a simple loan.

loans.use: to start his business by buying some chickens and building a barn for them.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita earns a living from selling goods in her retail store, while her husband does farming. For 10 years, Teresita has earned well and improved her business. Her earnings go to her children's education costs.

To add inventory capital, she took a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more grocery items to sell.

She hopes to have more returns in order to generate additional income to provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase good items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jay Bajarangabali Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Padmabati is a 28-year-old woman, standing to the right hand side in the photograph, and a mother to three teenagers. Padmabati is a divorcee.

She is a farmer in Sonepur. She engages in milk and egg production for commercial purposes, as opposed to many rural farmers who produce for subsistence. Padmabati also grows maize for food and sales. These commercial activities place her in a better position to engage in other agricultural businesses, which, in fact, she does.

Padmabati, along with her group member, is seeking a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva lenders via Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to construct a cow shed. This will help significantly in managing the animals’ health and hygiene. She has been in the farming business for at least six years. She has no plans to quit in the future, as she finds farming to be not only fulfilling, but also lucrative.

The additional income from this development will go to her children’s education. Kindly lend to this farmer with great dreams! A loan will do a lot for her.

loans.use: to construct a cow shed.

loans.name: T'mixe Group

texts.es:
T´Mixe es un vocablo de la lengua mazahua cuyo significa literal es "pozo de agua" y es, además, el nombre de un grupo ubicado en el Estado de México. Las integrantes decidieron usar dicho nombre ya que representa el respeto que tienen por el lugar de donde obtienen el líquido vital. Huelga decir que la comunidad ha mantenido la lengua y cultura mazahua a través del paso del tiempo. Otras cualidades a destacar son su carácter humilde y su espíritu trabajador.
   Doña Juana es quizás la más amigable del grupo pues siempre busca sacar una sonrisa a las personas que conoce. Está totalmente dedicada a su familia  integrada por su esposo Sebastián quien trabaja como taxista y cinco hijos de los cuales sólo dos dependen de la pareja. Juanita, como le dicen de cariño, motivó a su esposo para brindar servicio del taxi puesto que en su comunidad sólo había servicio de autobús y éste sólo pasaba dos veces al día. Por tal motivo, la pareja decidió ahorrar y adquirir un auto que adaptaron para dar el servicio de taxi.  Actualmente Sebastián trabaja todos los días en el taxi mientras doña Juana se dedica a criar ganado ovino, vender frutas y verduras además de ofrecer productos naturistas para obtener ingresos extras. Su mayor sueño es que sus hijas terminen la universidad para que así tengan mejores oportunidades de trabajo.
   Por otro lado, Juanita tiene muchos años trabajando en conjunto con VF México; las primeras inversiones las utilizó para invertir en la cría de animales y con sus ganancias adquirió el automóvil que sirve de taxi. Con este nuevo préstamo comprará más fruta y verdura, "la verdad hemos podido levantar nuestros negocios y con nuestras ganancias hemos podido solventar los gastos del hogar y sobretodo con los gastos de escolares" comento muy contenta.
   Las demás integrantes del grupo son María Albina quien invertirá en cerdos; Aurelia, Beatriz y María de los Ángeles, en ovejas; María Luciana, en abarrotes y Victoria, en artículos de papelería.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco, Juanita es quien viste el suéter color café y el rebozo gris.
texts.en:
T´Mixe is a term in the Mazahua language, the literal meaning is "water hole" and it is also the name of a group in the state of México. The members decided to use this name as it represents the respect they have for the place where they obtain this vital liquid. Needless to say this community has kept it's Mazahua language and culture through the passing of time. Other qualities that stand out are their humble character and their spirit of working.

Juana is perhaps the most friendly of the group as she is always looking to get a smile out of the people she knows. She is totally dedicated to her family which is made up of her husband Sebastián who works driving a taxi and five children, only two of whom are dependent on the couple. Juanita, as she is known with affection, motivated her husband to offer taxi services as in her community there is only bus service and it only goes twice a day. For this reason the couple decided to save and acquire a vehicle that they adapted to provide service as a taxi.

At present Sebastián works every day in the taxi while Juana works raising sheep, selling fruit and vegetables and also offering natural products to obtain extra revenues. Her greatest dream is for her children to complete university and thus have better employment opportunities.

On the other hand Juanita has been working with VF México for many years. She used her first loans to invest in raising animals and with the profits acquired the vehicle that serves as a taxi. With this new loan she will buy more fruit and vegetables. " The truth is that we were able to start our businesses and with our profits we have been able to pay the household expenses and most importantly the educational expenses", she commented with satisfaction.

The other members of the group are: María Albina who will invest in pigs; Aurelia, Beatriz and María de los Ángeles, in sheep; María Luciana, in groceries and Victoria, in stationary products.

The photograph was taken on the steps of the kiosk. Juanita is wearing a brown sweater and a grey shawl.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

location.town: San Lucas, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy has been running his business for many years. He's earning well from this activity. He was able to send his children to school and was able to pay his previous loan used in his business.

Recently, he took a new loan to cover the cost of maintenance of his photocopier machines in order to provide a better service to his loyal customers.

He is hoping to expand and improve his business in order to earn more profit for the educational needs of his children when they get into college.

loans.use: to cover the cost of machine maintenance.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is 33 years old and sells handbags, a business he has been doing for 6 years now. He is married and blessed with 2 children.

This is his first term with VisionFund Kenya and he will use the loan to buy more stock of handbags for sell and hopes this will enable him to meet the demands of his customers and make more income to support his family. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. He hopes to expand his business and open a boutique and make more income to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of handbags for sell and hopes this will enable him to meet the demands of his customers and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 56 years old and married. She has two children and lives in Gata Daku Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family. She owns a farm and is doing well. It earns her a good income for the family.

She had repaid successfully her previous loan, which was used for fertilizer for her farm. With her investment, she was able to generate more income than before and was able to support her children's education.

Teresita took a new loan recently to pay labor costs for harvesting bananas to earn more income.

She wants to improve her farm, and her plan is to renovate their home to create a safe living environment for the family.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for harvesting bananas.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.en:
Juan is 33 years old and lives in the municipality of San Pelayo. Since he was a little boy he has always dreamed with having his own business, this year he decided to make it happen so he can fulfill his dream and can solve some economic issues. Taking advantage of some knowledge that a friend shared with him, he’s going to start raising pigs. 

He’s aware that there’s a lot of competition in the market so he has to offer good prices and an excellent service, and he’s ready to do that so he can have good profits and to make his business last in time. He’s asking for a loan so he can start his business and build a pigsty and buy pigs. 

Juan wants to work hard so he can accomplish all his dreams, he wants to see his business as a successful and recognized one. You can help John to achieve all his goals and to start with the right food with just a loan.

loans.use: start his business and build a pigsty and buy pigs

loans.name: Jay Bajarangabali Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Lalita, the lady standing to the left in the photo, is a 45-year-old lady who lost her husband four years ago. Since then, she has taken on all the burdens of her family. She lives with her daughter, age 20, and her son, age 18.

After her husband passed away, she became involved in an agriculture activity. This is not sufficient to manage her family, so she purchased a cow. Now she is taking care of her cow and selling milk in the local market. From this business, she earns 2,000 to 2,500 INR per month.

She wants to purchase one more cow and continue her milk business. She has one year of experience in this field, and she has time to take care of the cow. Lalita, along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase a jersey cow and fodder for her cows.

She says that this business can strengthen her economic condition, and she can pay her children's tuition. She has a dream of educating her children so they can earn for themselves in the future. She does not want her children to face the same kinds of problems in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a jersey cow and fodder for her cows.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar system to improve his family´s quality of life, stop breathing smoke from the candles and ocote and have a sustainable and efficient source of electricity.

loans.name: Sumber Tanjung Group

texts.en:
The Sumber Tanjung group made the payment of 20.000.000 IDR to MUK on time. They tell us that there’s an increasing profit they earns during the loan period of six months. The pigs grew fat and healthy. They sold the pigs in a high price because lots of demand from the market. The situations stimulate they spirit to run the business. The group hopes the cooperation between MUK, Kiva and the client to continue smoothly and last longer. Ni Ketut, as the head, controlling and monitoring the member of her group. She also help by other boards. She sold all her pigs and earned a satisfactory profit. She saved all the profit and use it for business capital later.

The Sumber Tanjung group received a new loan of 20.000.000 IDR. The loan use for increasing the number of piglets, renovate the barns and purchase superior feed. The group still need a loan until they have enough capital to run the business by themselves.

Ni Ketut and the member feel happy receiving the support all this time from Lenders, Kiva and MUK. She’s use the loan to purchase 2 superior piglets, feed and more fishes to sell again. She hopes she can have enough saving soon and continue the business by herself.
2 members not pictured because of sickness and traveling out of the city for 2 days.

loans.use: to purchase 2 superior piglets, feed and more fishes

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester owns and operates an agriculture business  planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ester has been engaged in his business for 10 years and earns well from these activities. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming supplies. Her farm is still doing well and yet, She needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently, She took a new loan to buy fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.name: Ma. Teresita

texts.en:
Ma. Teresita is thankful that there are people willing to help small business owners liker her. The previous loan of Php 20,000 has paved way to increase her daily sales. She was able to add needed stocks of supplies needed in the variety store. She want to thank all the lenders participating in the Kiva program. Without their help, she wouldn’t know how to get additional capital for the business.

Ma. Teresita wants to save more for her family’s future. She also aspires to make the business grow with the help of the people around her. She knows everything is possible with faith, dedication and passion to what she believes is right. Ma. Teresita prays that God would touch the hearts of the people who will read her story. She once again applies for a new loan and this time at the amount of Php 25,000 which she will use for the said purpose.

Ma. Teresita is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Niyati

texts.en:
Niyati, who is 44 years old and a married woman, lives in the small village of Falakata with her family. Her family comprises her husband and two children (a son and a daughter). Her daughter is married, and her son is engaged in masonry work. She is illiterate, but can sign her name only. Her husband is a mason and works from dawn to dusk to earn for the family, but his inconsistent income is quite insufficient for the family's livelihood.

For giving financial help to the family, Niyati started animals farming five years back with the purchase of one dairy cow. She has been supplying milk and cow dung to her neighbors and local villagers who are her regular customers. Cow dung is used in rural areas as manure. So, there is a huge demand for her products in the village, but Niyati can hardly satisfy her clients' demand. Now, she has decided to expand her business to earn more for the family by selling more milk. She wants to purchase another dairy cow.

So, she has asked for financial help from BJS (Kiva's partner). The addition of one more cow will increase her production and help her to earn more. It will be a great support for this hardworking woman, enabling her to live in better conditions.

Niyati thanks her lenders wholeheartedly.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Saen's Group

texts.en: Narin’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Narin works as farmer and she also does extra work as factory laborer and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en:
A two-child mother living in Battambang province, Pha is 30 years old. One of her children is in school while the other one is too young. Cassava farming has been the main source of income for seven years already. To earn supplemental income, Pha spend her free time to work on her co-villager’s farm for a fee.

Due to having not enough working capital, she is now leading a group of three to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fee in order to increase productivity of her crop yield. Through this loan, she actually hopes to gain more returns than before, which will allow her to better support her family’s living and save for future need.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer in order to increase productivity of her crop yield, so to gain more returns to better support her family’s living.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
It was hard for Razia to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband. Razia is 37 years old, a married woman and mother of 7 children. Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work.

Now, she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. Razia has gained great confidence in the business, as she has learned how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Ratna

texts.en:
Twenty-eight-year-old Ratna is an enthusiastic woman from the small village of Falakata, West Bengal. She is a housewife, and her husband is a blacksmith by profession and engaged with an iron grill-manufacturing business. They are blessed with two children (a daughter and a son), who are both students now.

They have a workshop with a lathe machine. Her husband manufactures iron grills and sells them to their neighbors and villagers, as well as in the market as per their customers' demand. Her husband has been involved in this business for six years. This is the only source of income for the family. He has chosen this business because it is profitable and there are very few grill shops in the village.

With their present economic situation, when prices of essential commodities are increasing daily, the couple decided to expand their business. Thus, Ratna has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase raw materials such as iron rods, colors, etc. in bulk from the wholesale market. She and her husband hope it will improve their business and economic condition, as well as satisfy the demand of their customers on time.

She is grateful to both BJS and Kiva for this financial support.

loans.use: to purchase raw iron and necessary materials for their grill-manufacturing business.

loans.name: Odkhuu

texts.en: Mr. Odkhuu, 34 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as an engineer at a power plant for 13 years. His wife has a disability due to a car accident and gets state pension. Their elder son studies at university while the younger one goes to high school. The house his family lives in has been deteriorating over the years and it needs urgent repair. Accordingly, he is requesting a loan of US$1,400 to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam. After the renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, thereby releasing fewer pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en: Mrs. Otgonbayar, 39 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have been transporting people using their micro van since 2012. Using her previous loan, she has renovated her Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling), thereby creating a comfortable environment for her family. Currently, she is requesting a loan of US$1,300 to build a barn next to her ger. The barn will keep the heat and serve as an extra barrier against strong wind during the winter.

loans.use: to build a barn next to her Mongolian traditional ger in order to reduce the loss of heat

loans.name: Erdenetsogt

texts.en: Mr. Erdenetsogt, 25 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi services to local people since 2013. His wife stays at home, looking after their son. He is requesting a loan of US$2,000 to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam in order to renovate his home with a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling). By doing so his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, thereby releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his home in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Ariane Ve

texts.en:
Ariane Ve is 29 years old, married and lives with her family. She had a retail store serving several customers; she sells assorted groceries and beverages to generate additional income while her husband also doing a business. 
Ariane Ve has been ten  years in this field. Ariane Ve is working hard every day in order to provide income for the family and to show customers her responsibility and reliability to serve. 
Ariane Ve requested this  loan to purchase canned goods, soft drinks and grains for sale in her store. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits so that he may open a bigger place and continue assisting her family with the additional income.

loans.use: to purchase goods and items for her store to sell.

loans.name: Iresh Mae

texts.en: Iresh is 25 years old and married woman. Her husband is a security guard while Iresh manage their vegetable garden. For over  years, she has been earning well in selling  her vegetables in the market.It covers the cost of their household expenses considering also the income of her husband which she considered  as their main source of income. She gained access in GDMPC and recently, she took a  loan for the purpose of buying  organic fertilizer to have a more productive harvest. She wants to improve her vegetable  farm to ensure a better source of income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer  for her crops

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: For the past two years, Alma has operated a grocery store that sells assorted goods. She works hard every day in order to provide income for her family and improve their living situation. Emma is requesting a loan to purchase more groceries to sell in her store. This will allow her to increase her sales. Emma's goal is to develop her business and increase her profits for the educational needs of her children when they got into college  and ensure a higher quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Austami

texts.en:
Austami is a young woman of 24 years, hailing from Falakata. She is married, and her family consists of three: her husband and two toddler sons. Though Austami could achieve education only up to grade five in her childhood, her greatest motivation in life is to provide the best education to her children.

Her husband is a farmer by profession and has a plot of land. He mainly grows vegetables such as potatoes, bottle gourd, bitter gourd, pointed gourd, etc. He has three years experience in farming. His products are in much demand in the markets.

Austami is an energetic and hardworking woman. Although she is a housewife, she helps her husband in his work a lot, especially at the time of harvesting and carrying the products to the market for sale. The income for her family entirely depends on this agribusiness, so the couple wants to develop it by growing more vegetables. They have chosen to grow eggplant.

As they have no capital in hand, Austami is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase agricultural inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc. for eggplant cultivation.

Her dreams are to admit her sons to a good school and improve their quality of life by strengthening the family assets.

She is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for eggplant cultivation.

loans.name: Meerim

texts.en:
Meerim has always been an active school-girl and likes to participate in different educational programs as she considers them to be so important for her. Her family couldn’t afford all those programs so she used to look for scholarships and grants. Thanks to grants she was an exchange student in USA by FLEX, what paid for her expenses to live and study at high school for 1 AY. IDEA is the next organization, which supported her in Global Youth Forum in summer 2013 and in Asian Youth Forum in spring 2013. US.Department of State has sent her to Civic Education Workshop, so all these programs had made her competitive, stronger and the best.
Out of her academic achievements she is so proud of herself to be a laureate of “Student of the year” award at school starting the seventh grade. Every year she was motivated by this award to be more successful at school not just academically, but in extra-curricular activities too. This award kept her ambitious, improved leadership skills and learnt her never give up.

But the award that she is most proud of is being an octofinalist of Karl Popper Debate World Championship, where she debated among her team-players from her school, and her team was in the Top 16 Best Countries in The World Championship. During this Debate and after 100 rounds of debating various social issues on both sides, she has developed a very strong personal ideology.
This year Meerim is a freshman at AUCA and hopes to be listed in AUCA Debate club in order to progress and represent it in different international debating events. She hopes to cover the part of her tuition fee with Kiva loan, what will enable her to continue her studies in Economics and provide her good education.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee in Economics  at AUCA.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia has been running her plastic ware and kitchen utensils business for two years.She is widowed and has one child. With her dedication and hard work, she was able to improve her plastic ware and kitchen utensils business. Alicia still wants to have a profitable and progressive business, which is the reason why she's asking for a loan of PHP50,000 to buy stocks of plastic ware and kitchen utensils to sell. She hopes to have continuous growth in her business, to sustain her daily needs, and to send her child into higher levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of plastic ware and kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is a 52-year-old married woman. She settled in Campo 4 Ramon Magsaysay,Zambo Del Sur, Philippines with her five children. Over the past twelve years, Virgnia was able to put up a grocery store that absolutely met the market demands in their village. Until now, the business is still doing good and it covers their household expenses. Virgina joined GDMPC  to have an easy access to financial services. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to buy more grocery goods to sell. Virginia expects an increase in sales to expand her business and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita considers that her buy-and-sell business has grown over the last six months, as she’s able to earn about Php 7,000 every month. She enjoys the business, for it helps them earn extra income to pay bills and other expenses.

The loan that she previously took was used to buy garlic, pepper, onion, ginger and various herbs and spices, which were repackaged for resale. She wanted to thank CCT and all lenders for the financial assistance.

She explains that her struggle in doing business is that she needs to ride a bicycle under the scorching heat of the sun to look for customers. Elenita dreams of having a place which she can call her own, where she can sell her products. That’s why she is determined to earn more each day to save money and improve her business someday. But for now, she wants to focus on how she can increase her daily sales, have available products in stock and have a revolving fund as well.

With this, Elenita applied for an amount of Php 10,000 to cover all her business needs.

On a weekly basis, Elenita meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and business experience and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of various spices, which she will sell in her business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is an active member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) in Batasan, Quezon City . She is a 58 years old entrepreneur managing a buy and sell business of ready-to-wear clothes and a variety store business as well. She is earning to approximately Php 7,000 each month and Elvira is praying that God will continually provide more customers so she can earn more revenue for her family.

Like other entrepreneurs, Elvira is determined to see progress on what she pursues. She dreams of having her own place in Batasan Market to sell her product, save money for future needs and have more stocks of ready-to-wear-clothes for her buy and sell business. With this, she is applying for a loan amounting to Php 10,000. This amount will really be a great help for her business’ growth.

Despite of being busy managing the business, Elvira spares time attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hear testimonies from other CCT partners and able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: to have more stocks of ready-to-wear-clothes for her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cartons of sugar, milk, cocoa etc

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is a 38-year-old member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) who is currently running a food-vending business near the place where she lives. She sells fried snacks and drinks each day. Her husband Rizaldy works in a junk shop to help support their daily financial needs.

She wants her children to finish college - this is why Rona is really determined to succeed for them.

Rona is blessed that God continually provides customers for her business. However, she still needs additional capital, as she wants to have additional products to sell and to have rolling capital for buying ingredients each day. An amount of Php 10,000 will cover all her business necessities. This will have a vast impact on her business, and she prays that people who read her story will consider her request.

Rona believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group meetings for CCT partners that consist of 15 to 30 members, where she gains spiritual strength from members' life-changing testimonies, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to have additional products to sell and to use the remaining amount as a revolving fund for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Trean's Group

texts.en: Trean’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Trean works as farmer and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is 38 years old, married woman and a mother of 4 children. She is working hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education.   She, with her husband(also shown in the photo) is doing work in agriculture for some years. They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.

In order to purchase different types of seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides, currently Saima has applied a loan of 50000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Malarani

texts.en:
Malarani is a 40-year-old married woman from Falakata. She is a homemaker and is blessed with three sons.They live at a small village, Harinathpur, in Alipurduar district of West Bengal. Her three sons are involved with agricultural work.

Malarani's husband is engaged with a wood-selling business. He purchases trees from the local tree owners and sells the logs of wood in the market to earn money for his family. He has been involved with this business for the past three years. Malarani always supports her husband in his business.

Now they have decided to enhance their wood log-selling business in order to generate more income. But, they are unable to purchase good-quality trees because money is the main problem for them. So, to help her husband, Malarani applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS. With this loan money, her husband will purchase more trees for more logs of wood to sell.

She is hopeful that the increase in sales volume will retain good revenue for her family’s well being and will grow the business simultaneously.

She is very much thankful to her generous lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase trees for her husband’s wood-selling business.

loans.name: Artavazd

texts.en:
Artavazd is from Arevshat village of SHirak region where he lives with his mother and sister. Artavazd's mother is elderly retired and the only source of income for the family is their farming business. Artavazd, as the only breadwinner of the family, keeps 4 calves and cultivates a large variety of vegetables in the yard near his house.

While working hard to sustain his family's living, Artavazd builds plans for the development of his farm. He asks this loan to purchase forage for feeding the cattle in the winter. Shirak is a poor region with a high unemployment rate and low living standards. Lack of access to loans, bad market conditions, and high costs makes a number of difficulties for people to develop their business in Shirak region. Artavazd's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to underserved population of Shirak region, to help them to earn a living.
Artavazd hopes for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the cattle in the winter

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en: Mary Rose is single and she is working in a private company in order to  make a living. She helped her parents by providing them a motorcycle used for transportation services. To improve the services she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy motor parts and other accessories. She is planning to build a store in their village to let her parents managed while she is working. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy motor parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Fazeelat

texts.en:
Fazeelat is 38 years old and a vigorous, married woman.

For many years, she has had a business of hand-embroidering. She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work and client demand is strong. But, business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. By himself, her husband does not earn enough money to support his family well.

Fazeelat ’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of five children.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy raw materials, such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand, time after time. She hopes to gain more profits to fullfill her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials in large quantities, such as thread, sequins, and pearls, to meet the increasing demand, time after time.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 42-year-old, married woman and a mother of four children.

The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently, she has requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase another buffalo, to increase her sales and earns profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

Rani aspires to further expand her business and increase the number of animals she currently owns.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo, to increase her sales and earns profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Marilet

texts.en: Marilet has been running her retail store business.For more than ten years it covers their daily expenditures which she considered  as their main source of income. Marilet successfully repaid her previous loan for she is earning well from these activities. Recently, she took a new loan for the purpose of buying more grocery to sell  to gain more profit. She wants to improve business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
She is Evelyn. With all hopes, she’s only praying right now for your kind hearts to help support her again with her loan request.

She has a small barbacue stall in the market place. It is very admirable how she manages to be a full-time mother and a businesswoman simultaneously. However, it doesn't matter as long as she really wants to support her husband in improving their present family condition.

Being into this business requires a lot of effort though income is really not stable. It only depends on the customers’ demand. But since Filipinos love eating street foods including those that she sells, her business has a good potential for business expansion. Evelyn knows this is possible through your help so she is requesting again another loan worth PHP 12,000 which she will spend in buying additional raw ingredients like meat and other stuff for her barbecue stall. She once proved that she is capable and faithful in repaying; and she believes that you won't hesitate to help her again. She is assuring you that she will not waste your trust and preserve this kind of generosity you will give her.

Someday, she dreams of having a more affordable kind of living and she hopes for more strength for her family. Also, she wishes that her business will grow as she pursues more. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy more raw ingredients for her barbecue business.

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en: Like many women it was financial constraints that played a potent factor in encouraging our client Munawar to approach Kashf Foundation in search for a loan. Munawar is a 46 years old married woman. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested for a loan of 60000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Sipra

texts.en:
Thirty-one-year-old Sipra lives in a small village, Raychenga, of Falakata with her husband Pravat and one daughter. Her daughter is a student in grade two.

Sipra is a homemaker, and her husband runs a fast food stall in their locality. She also assists her husband in making fast foods after managing all the household chores. They mainly sell chowmins, egg rolls, chops, fish fry, etc. from their shop. These snacks are very popular among the people of their locality. Her husband sells these items to their neighbors and local area people.

Sipra knows that this business will produce sufficient revenue, but for continued operation she needs some capital. So, she requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase necessary ingredients like raw noodles, gram flour, eggs, oil, vegetables, spices, sauce, and different necessary resources so that she can increase her production to fulfill their customers' needs.

She dreams of enhancing the business so that the increased profit generated by the business will help them to ensure the financial stability in her family and provide good education to her only daughter.

Sipra is grateful to her lenders.
