loans.use: to purchase necessary ingredients for their fast food selling business.

loans.name: Puspa

texts.en:
Puspa hails from Falakata in Alipurduar district, West Bengal. She is 29 years old. She lives with her husband and one toddler son. She is a housewife, and her husband is associated with a banana-selling business.

Puspa’s husband has been involved with this business for the last three years. He brings his stock of bananas from the local wholesalers and the villagers who have banana trees, and then he sells these bananas in the local market. The income generated from this business is hardly sufficient to maintain the family properly. As this is the only income-generating source for the family, the couple wants to buy bulk stock of good-quality bananas for sale. Buying the stock in bulk will help to reduce her husband's frequent travel to the market, and eventually, transportation and buying costs.

So, Puspa is seeking a loan amount from BJS, Kiva's field partner, to purchase stock of bananas in bulk. This will improve their earnings, enhance the business, and provide a decent lifestyle to her family.

Puspa is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase bananas in bulk for her husband’s banana-selling business.

loans.name: Maria Deysy Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, administra una tienda de productos varios, en su inicios ofrecía específicamente boquitas y dulces, con las ganancias ha logrado ir ofreciendo más productos a sus clientes, abre su negocio a las 7:40 am. y cierra a las 5:00 pm.; es una madre soltera que tiene que sacar adelante a dos hijos, no cuenta con ayuda económica de otras personas, sus hijos están estudiando.
Invertirá en granos básicos, café instantáneo, azúcar, sal, pan, huevos, etc., aumentara su inventario para que los clientes continúen visitando su negocio, espera poder incrementar las ventas y ganancias. 
Su objetivo es cancelar la deuda en un corto tiempo.
texts.en:
María manages a shop that sells various products. At first, she specifically offered snacks and sweets. Using her earnings, she has managed to gradually increase the products she offers to her customers. She opens her business at 7:40am and closes at 5:00pm.

María is a single mother who has two children to support. She receives no financial help from anyone. Her children are studying.

She will invest in basic grains, instant coffee, sugar, salt, bread, eggs, etc. to increase her inventory so that her customers continue to visit her business. She hopes to be able to increase sales and profits. Her goal is to pay off the loan in a short space of time.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, instant coffee, sugar, salt, bread, eggs, etc. to increase her inventory so that her customers continue to visit her business.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Divorcée et sans enfant, Ayawa est une femme qui vit à Tokoin. Ayawa est une revendeuse de noix de coco qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend au bord de la route et à domicile.  Ayawa sollicite ce crédit pour commander des unités de noix de coco. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Ayawa va pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en: Divorced and childless, Ayawa is a woman living in Tokoin. Ayawa sells coconuts and stocks up once a month at the market and sells on the side of the road and from home. Ayawa is seeking a loan to order coconuts. With the profit she will make, Ayawa is going to be able to meet her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy 30 coconuts.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chiziis a married woman; she has four children, all of whom attend school. Chizi owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Chizi has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman; she has three children, two of whom attend school and one is still young to attend school. Amina owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Amina has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen  was living a tough life some years ago; it was very difficult to bear her household expenditures. She is 38 years old, married woman running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purpose. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has 4 children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, now, she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is a married woman and has been blessed with eight children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that  has electricity and piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over three years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Félicia

texts.fr: Mère  de quatre enfants, Félicia est une femme mariée résidant à Tokoin. Agée de 38 ans, Félicia produits des gâteaux faite à base de la farine du blé et s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Félicia vend ses marchandises en parcourant les quartiers et à domicile. Félicia sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de farine de blé en vue de bien vendre et d’en fabriquer plus de gâteaux et répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients puis soutenir son mari à bien s’occuper de leurs enfants.
texts.en: A mother of four, Félicia is a married woman residing in Tokoin. She is 38 years old and produces cakes made with wheat flour. She gets her supplies once a month at the market. She sells her products at her home and by going from neighborhood to neighborhood. Félicia is requesting this loan to purchase sacks of wheat flour with the aim of doing well in her sales and making more cakes to respond favorably to customer expectations. Then she can help her husband take good care of their children.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sacks of wheat flour

loans.name: Somie

texts.fr: Somie est une femme mariée avec quatre enfants à charge. Somie est âgée de 38 ans et habite à Tokoin où elle exerce son activité de restauratrice  de la pâte et du riz mélangé du haricot. Somie s’approvisionne du nécessaire servant à la préparation deux fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Somie sollicite ce crédit pour commander des bols de maïs, du riz et du haricot en vue de bien vendre puis de gagner plus de bénéfices et de venir en aide à son mari aux besoins de la famille et d’améliorer les conditions de vie quotidiennes de leurs enfants.
texts.en: Somie is a married woman and has four children to support. She is 38 years old and lives in Tokoin, where she operates her restaurant selling pâte [a sort of polenta] and rice mixed with beans. Twice a month at the market, she gets the supplies necessary for making her products. She resells in a shed in front of her home. Somie is requesting this loan to order bowls of corn, rice, and beans with the aim of doing well in her sales and earning more profit, so as to help out her husband to meet family needs. She will also improve their children’s day-to-day living situation.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bowl of corn, 20 bowls of rice, and 15 bowls of beans

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 36 ans, Afi  est une femme qui a quatre enfants à charge. Habitant à Tokoin, Afi prépare de la pâte bandée appelée « Akpan » et le revend à la devanture de son domicile en vue d’avoir une bonne rentabilité financière. Afi s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché du nécessaire pour la préparation. Pour commander des sacs de maïs, Afi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat en vue de bien vendre et de gagner plus de revenus pour faire face aux besoins de ses enfants en aidant son mari à payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants dès la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en: Married and 36 years old, Afi is a woman who has four children in her care. Living in Tokoin, Afi prepares corn patties that are dipped in a sauce called “Akpan” and sells it in front of her house in order to have good profitability. Afi stocks up four times a month at the market for the things she needs to prepare it. To order some sacks of corn, Afi is asking for this loan to be able to make the purchase in order to make good sales and earn more to meet the needs of her children and help her husband pay for their schooling for the next school year.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of corn.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina is a 41-year-old enterprising lady from Raychenga village of Falakata in West Bengal. She is a mother of two children (one son and one daughter). Her son is a student of B.A. second year (Bachelor of Arts), and her daughter got married. Her husband is a car mechanic on a daily wages basis. His income is inconsistent and low, and depends on the availability of customers.

To give a financial supplement to her husband’s income, Rina rears cows and sells milk in her neighborhood. There is a good demand for cow milk in her area; this is why she has chosen this business. For additional income, she also sells cattle by-products like cow dung, which is used as good manure in farming, to the local farmers.

Now Rina needs to expand her business, as the household costs as well as the education costs of her son are gradually increasing. To cope with the situation, she plans to buy one more cow for enhancing her business.

Thus, she is asking for a loan from BJS, a Kiva partner. She feels that this will add more income and provide better living conditions to her family and continuous further education to her son.

Rina thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Afi  Ahoefa

texts.fr: Mariée et mère d’un enfant, Afi est une femme âgée de 34 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Afi est une couturière qui expose des pagnes dans son atelier de couture sise à son domicile. Pour s’approvisionner du nécessaire, Afi se rend trois fois par mois au marché et demande ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes de hautes et moyennes qualités en vue de bien vendre puis de gagner un gain et pouvoir aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: A married mother of one child, Afi is 34 years old and lives in Tokoin. She is a dressmaker who displays her ‘pagne’ cloth products in her sewing workshop in her home. To stock up on necessities, she goes to the market three times a month. Afi is asking for this loan to order lengths of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) of high quality and medium quality with the aim of doing well in her sales and earning more profit, so as to help her husband to meet her children’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase 3 lengths of high-quality 'pagne' cloth and 3 lengths of medium-quality 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Noro Lantosoa

texts.fr:
Noro est une femme entreprenante de 29 ans. Elle est séparée de son mari depuis 4 ans et élève seule sa fille de 4 ans. Elle vend des produits divers comme le savon, la radio, des ustensiles de cuisine au grand marché depuis 4 ans. 
Noro est emprunteuse chez Vahatra depuis 2 ans ou elle a pu augmenter le capital de son activité. Actuellement, elle veut diversifier les produits à vendre pour répondre davantage aux besoins de ses clients. Elle va acheter différentes qualités de savons et de couches pour les bébés. 
Elle a comme objectif d’être autonome dans son activité et d’épargner beaucoup pour son avenir et celui de sa fille.
texts.en:
Noro is an entrepreneurial 29-year-old mother. She separated from her husband four years ago and is raising her 4-year-old daughter alone. She has been selling diverse items, such as soap, radios, and kitchen utensils at the grand market for four years.

Noro has been a borrower from Vahatra for two years, and she has been able to increase her business capital. Currently, she would like to diversify her products in order to better meet the needs of her customers. She is going to buy different qualities of soap and diapers.

Her goal is to be autonomous in her business and to save a lot for her and her daughter’s future.

loans.use: to buy different items like soap, diapers, and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman; she has six children, all of whom attend school. Chizi owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
Chizi has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces major challenge of transportation and stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a married woman with four children all of whom attend school.She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

She has operated a business of selling plastic utensils for the past three years selling at the market.She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in her business.
With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase a stock of plastic utensils for resale.She decided to join yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of plastic utensils for resale

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a widowed woman. She has been blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Mwanamisi has operated a fish selling business for more than ten years, selling from her home to restaurant operators and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability, leading to losses.

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married woman and has been blessed with six children, five of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Dama operates a business selling poultry. She has done this for more than six years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Dama dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Wendy Leticia

texts.es:
Wendy, es soltera, tiene 4 hijos, los cuales son dependientes, su madre le apoya un poco económicamente, su fuente de ingresos es atender una tienda de productos de la canasta básica, venta de pupusas y joyería de enchape, trabaja de lunes a sábado, los días domingos lleva a vender productos comestibles a una cancha.
Comprará específicamente productos para la tienda como: gaseosas, jugos, boquitas, pan, huevos, aceite, etc., para que sus clientes encuentren en su negocio lo que están buscando, espera poder atender a nuevas demandas y recuperar la inversión.
Su proyecto de vida es darles a sus hijos mejor calidad de vida y apoyarlos para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Wendy is single and has four children, who are dependent on her. Her mother provides her with a little bit of help financially. She earns a living attending customers in a grocery store, which also sells pupusas, traditional El Salvadorian corn tortillas with a filling and costume jewellery. She works from Monday to Saturday, and on Sundays she takes food to sports field to sell.

She will specifically buy products for the store such as to buy products such as fizzy drinks, juices, snacks, bread, eggs, oil, etc. so that her customers can find what they want in her store. She hopes to get more orders and recover the investment.

Her life project is to give her children a better quality of life and support them so they have a better future.

loans.use: to buy products such as fizzy drinks, juices, snacks, bread, eggs, oil, etc. so that her customers can find what they want in her store.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman, staying together with her husband and eight children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past 17 years, she has operated a paraffin selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase a stock of paraffin to sell. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of paraffin to sell.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a single woman; she has no children, . Mwanaisha owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mwanaisha has operated a fuel selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other fuel operators in her business.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase a stock of fuel for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of fuel for resale

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is a married mother of four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables. For over eight years she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of business.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tealeaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tealeaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Rene Antonio

texts.es:
Rene vive con su grupo familiar compuesto por su esposa e hijos, no tiene ayuda de remesas, se dedica a atender un taller de estructuras metálicas, lo tiene desde hace 5 años, también desarrolla diferentes actividades agrícolas.
Invertirá en láminas, tubos, pintura, hierro y electrodos, para fabricar puertas y ventas, brindará mayor calidad y puntualidad en la entrega de sus trabajos, espera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y cambiar su situación financiera.  
Sus sueños son tener una buena imagen en su comunidad, disminuir las necesidades de su familia y cuidar que sus hijos sean personas que aporten cosas buenas a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Rene lives with his family group, made up of his wife and children. He does not have help from remittances [from abroad]. He dedicates himself to operating a workshop for metal structures. He has had this workshop for 5 years, and he also carries out various agricultural activities.

He will invest in metal sheets, tubes, paint, iron and electrodes to manufacture doors and windows. This will allow him to provide better quality and timeliness in the delivery of his work. He hopes to keep his customers satisfied and change his financial situation.

His dreams are to have a good reputation in his community, reduce his family's areas of need, and ensure that his children will be people who contribute good things to society.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheets, tubes, paint, iron and electrodes to manufacture doors and windows, providing better quality and timeliness in delivering his work.

loans.name: Dandjenko

texts.fr: Dandjenko est une femme mariée âgée de 44 ans qui avec ses quatre enfants à charge. Dandjenko est une revendeuse de condiments et de produits alimentaires  résidant à Tokoin. Dandjenko achète ses marchandises trois fois par mois au marché et le revend dans sa propre boutique à domicile. Dandjenko sollicite ce prêt pour commander des paniers de tomates fraîches, de gombo et des cartons de macaronis en vue de bien vendre et d’avoir un bénéfice pour aider son mari à bien organiser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Dandjenko is a married woman, 44 years old, who has four children to support. She is a retail grocer residing in Tokoin. She purchases her merchandise at the market three times a month. She resells in her own store in her home. Dandjenko is requesting this loan to order baskets of fresh tomatoes and okra and boxes of macaroni with the aim of doing well in her sales and having more profit, so as to help her husband to arrange for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase a basket of tomatoes, a basket of okra, and a box of macaroni.

loans.name: Afi  Marcelle

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Afi est une femme qui vit à Tokoin. Agée de 42 ans, Afi achète des jouets pour enfants deux fois par mois au marché et les revendent dans sa boutique à domicile. Afi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités de jouets nounous en vue de bien vendre et de tiré profit puis venir en aide à son mari aux  diverses charges de sa famille.
texts.en: A mother of two, Afi is a married woman who lives in Tokoin. She is 42 years old and purchases children’s toys at the market twice a month. She resells them in the shop in her home. Afi is requesting this loan to order units of stuffed toys with the aim of doing well in her sales and earning a profit, so as to help out her husband in covering the diverse expenses of her family.

loans.use: to purchase 90 units of stuffed toys

loans.name: Maurille

texts.fr:
Maurille est un homme de 48 ans, marié et vit avec ses 3 enfants dans un quartier animé de la ville. Il vend des fournitures scolaires pendant la période de la rentrée scolaire, des parapluies et des imperméables au moment des saisons de pluie. 
Cela fait maintenant 5 ans qu’il exerce cette activité. Ce prochain prêt lui servira à augmenter et à diversifier les fournitures scolaires à vendre. En effet, il profite de la rentrée scolaire afin de gagner beaucoup de bénéfices.
Il a comme projet d’acheter une voiture qu’il utilisera comme moyen de transport public pour avoir plus de revenus, constituer beaucoup d'épargne et ainsi assurer l’avenir de ses 3 enfants.
texts.en: Maurille is a 48-year-old married man who lives with his three children in an animated neighborhood in the city. He sells school supplies during the start of the school year, and umbrellas and raincoats during the rainy season. He has been doing this for five years. This next loan will help him augment and diversify the school supplies to sell. Indeed, he benefits from the start of school by earning a lot of profits. He has plans to buy a car, which he’ll use as public transportation to earn even more, saving a lot, and thus ensuring the future of his three children.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, such as notebooks, pens, and schoolbags to sell for back to school.

loans.name: Reth's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Battambang province, Reth is a 54-year-old mother of six dependent children and two of whom are in school. Reth has been working very hard on her cassava and rice fields for twelve years. On the other hand, she takes her free time to work on her co-villager’s farm for fee to earn the additional income to support her family as well.

Not having enough working capital to do cassava farming is the main challenge for her. To fix this problem, she is now leading a group of three to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund and she is willing to use her entire loan portion to pay for pesticide and plowing fee to protect her farm from threats by insects. She is very hopeful with this loan to increase her crop yield as well as her income to improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to pay for pesticide and plowing fee to protect her farm from threats by insects to badly affect her crop.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman and has been blessed with nine children, three of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mwanasiti operates a business selling poultry. She has been running this business for more than eight years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Mwanasiti dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Priscillar

texts.en:
Priscillar is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. She cites school fees and food as being her greatly monthly expenses. She has operated a beauty salon business for the past two years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbors and people at the market place.

She dreams of earning more income and incorporating hairdressing skills in the future. With the KES 5,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. For over three years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tealeaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tealeaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Mourine

texts.en:
Mourine is married with two children going to school. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She has operated a Khanga (women’s wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khangas to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khangas to sell.

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is a married woman with five children, all of whom don't attends school. She owns a  house that has electricity but no  piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past twelve years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a married woman with six children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a cereal shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase a stock of sacks of maize for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with two kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanaisha has  operated a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 


With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Elsa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Elsa es una persona dedicada a vender ropa y a atender a su familia, ella es  madre soltera de tres hijos, los cuales aún son dependientes, inicio su negocio hace tres años, de esta manera tiene las entradas de dinero para costear las necesidades familiares, atiende su negocio de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde.
Ella está necesitando de un crédito para comprar camisas, ropa interior, blusas, pantalones, etc., fortalecerá su negocio para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes, espera que sus ventas e ingresos sean mejores, su dificultad es que puede ser víctima de  asalto.
Sus sueños son ampliar su negocio para salir adelante con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elsa is dedicated to selling clothing and taking care of her family. She is a single mother of three children, who are still her dependants. 

She started her business three years ago. Through her work she generates the income to cover her family's needs. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.

She is requesting a loan to buy shirts, underwear, blouses, pants, and other items. With this purchase, she will strengthen her business to meet the needs of more customers. She expects her sales and income to improve. 

The challenge she faces is that she could become a victim of robbery.

Her dreams are to expand her business and get ahead with her children.

loans.use: to buy shirts, underwear, blouses, pants, and the like to strengthen her business and meet the needs of more customers.

loans.name: Mawuena

texts.fr: Mawuena est une femme mariée âgée de 35 ans résidante à Tokoin. Ayant deux enfants à charge, Mawuena est une revendeuse des produits alimentaires qu’elle revend dans sa boutique à domicile. Mawuena s’approvisionne du nécessaire deux fois par mois  au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des paquets de papiers mouchoir, des bols de farine de manioc et des sacs de détergents. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Mawuena compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider sa famille à avoir un épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en: Mawuena is a 35-year-old married woman who lives in Tokoin. Having two children in her care, Mawuena sells food products that she sells from her shop at home. Mawuena stocks up on the necessities twice a month at the market and would like this loan to order packets of tissue, bowls of cassava flour, and sacks of detergent. With the profits she will make, Mawuena plans to improve the appearance of her shop, help her family thrive, and provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy 10 packages of tissue, 16 bowls of cassava flour, and 4 sacks of detergent.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Yan is a 44-year-old mother who resides in a rural village of Battambang province. She is a mother of three children who are all in school. Yan is a rice and cassava farmer and she has been involved in these businesses for ten years. Moreover, she spends her free time to work on her co-villager’s farm for fee to complement her family’s need. Having not enough working capital to grow her crop is the main challenge for her business.

In order to fix this problem, she is now applying for a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fee to help her crop grow fruitfully. Yan is working very hard in her both farms in order to increase her income to save for future need as she wants to renovate her old house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fee to help her crop grow fruitfully in order to increase her income to save for future need.

loans.name: Puna

texts.en: Puna is 21 years old with 2 children. She runs a business of selling vegetables(cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. Puna hopes to expand her business, but in order to do this, Puna requested for a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves, to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves,

loans.name: Cacilda

texts.pt:
A senhora Cacilda de 55 anos de idade  é comerciante, casada é mãe de 5 filhos dos quais 3 a estudarem e 2 já nos seus lares e sustenta 6 netos que vivem com ela na casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo este  pretende comprar  açúcar, feijão, óleo, arroz, amendoim,  omo para revender no seu estabelecimento..
seu sonho é desenvolver sua  atividade, construir uma outra mercearia na zona onde vive e melhorar a dieta alimentar da sua família.
Diz que o seu maior desafio é o financeiro e conta com ajuda de seu esposo para supera-los .
texts.en:
Cacilda, 55, is a businesswoman. She is married, and the mother of five children; three of them study, and two have their own families. She sustains six grandchildren that live with her in a house she owns.

She says that she planning to use the loan to buy sugar, beans, cooking oil, rice, peanuts, and OMO washing powder to resell in her store.

Her dream is to develop her activity, build another store in the area where she lives, and improve her family's food intake.

She says that her biggest challenge is financial in nature, and that her husband helps her to overcome it.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, cooking oil, rice, peanuts, and OMO washing powder.

loans.name: Taufanua

texts.en: Taufanua is 57 years old with 4 children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. Taufanua requested for a loan to buy wheelbarrow, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, backpack sprayer, taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2013, and hopes to use her business profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheelbarrow, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, backpack sprayer, taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling),

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop for the past six years, selling goat meat at the market. She faces a major challenge of transportation and seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats to slaughter so she can sell the meat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats to slaughter

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman and has been blessed with six children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Judith has operated a fish-selling business for over one year, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces major challenges of seasonality and perishability, leading to losses.

With the KES 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of fish to sell.

She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish to sell.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a married mother of one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Sarah operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
O senhor  José de 39 anos de idade é pedreiro e fiscal do projecto, vive maritalmente a 5 anos, pai de 2 filhos todos  a estudar vive na casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo  pretende comprar  cimento, barrotes, portas, areia, pedra, varões, para dar continuidade a sua obra tipo 1.
O seu sonho é  terminar a obra e fazer o muro de vedação de seu quintal e adquirir bens para o bem estar de sua família uma vez que acabou de mudar se da casa de seus pais que vivem na mesma zona.
Diz que o seu maior desafio é a insuficiência de fundos e para superá-los faz trabalhos por conta propria e também faz machamba e que ira solicitar mais empréstimos para para concretizar os seus planos.
texts.en:
José, 39, works as a mason and as a construction director. He got married five years ago, and is the father of two children who study. He owns the house where he lives.

He says that he is planning to use the loan to buy cement, bars, doors, sand, stones, and beams to continue building his one-room house.

His dream is to finish building his house, build a division wall in his yard, and buy household goods for his family's well-being, since he recently moved from his parents' house. His parents live nearby.

He says that his main challenge is the lack of funding, and that he works on his own to overcome it. He also works the land. He will apply for more loans to realize his plans.

loans.use: to buy cement, bars, doors, sand, stones and beams.

loans.name: Santos Salvador

texts.es:
Santos, con el apoyo de financiamientos ha podido seguir trabajando en la agricultura, sus cosechas son favorables y mantiene estabilidad económica, su familia está en óptimas condiciones de salud.
Está preparándose para la nueva temporada de siembra y necesita de capital para comprar insumos agrícolas con los que eliminara la maleza del terreno y dará un buen trato al cultivo de maíz.
texts.en:
Santos has been able to continue working thanks to the loans he has received. His harvests have been good, and he has reached financial balance. His family is healthy.

He is getting ready for the new sowing season and needs capital to buy agricultural supplies to weed the land and take good care of his corn plantations.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to weed the land and take good care of his corn plantations.

loans.name: Mutheu

texts.en:
Mutheu is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.Her greatest monthly expense is food.
She has operated a plastic selling for the past two year selling at the market.She mentioned transportation as a major challenge in her business

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase a stock of plastic items like basin,cups and mugs for resale.She decided to join yehu to access loan and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of plastic items like basin,cups and mugs

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a married woman with two children, neither of whom attends school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi est une femme divorcée qui vit à Tokoin avec son enfant. Ablavi est âgée de 44 ans et  s’active énormément pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Ablavi est une revendeuse de pagnes  qui s’approvisionne huit fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile puis dans les quartiers environnant. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Ablavi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités de pièces de pagnes en vue de bien vendre et de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider son enfant dans son éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Ablavi is a divorcee who lives in Tokoin with her child. Ablavi is 44 and works very hard to have a good financial situation. Ablavi sells pagne dresses that she buys eight times every month at the market and resells from home and in the neighbouring district. To achieve her goals, Ablavi requests this loan to order pagne fabrics so as to make a good volume of sales and to satisfy her customers’ needs and achieve remarkable financial autonomy to provide her child with a good education.

loans.use: to buy  02 units of pagne fabric.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married with two school going children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a khanga (women's cloth wrap) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas for resale.

loans.name: María Gloria

texts.es:
María, de 60 años de edad, no tiene ningún nivel académico debido a los escasos recursos económicos en los que ella vivía, es madre de familia de 11 hijos ya mayores de edad.

María, ha aprendido muy bien acerca de la agricultura, este conocimiento lo adquirió después que su esposo falleciera, pues ella necesitaba un apoyo para el sustento de sus hijos.

María, utilizara el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y abono para la siembra de maíz.

A futuro desea ver a sus hijos con sus propias familias.
texts.en:
María, 60, could not study due to the scarce economic resources she had when while growing up. She is the mother of eleven children, all of the adults now.

María has learned a lot about agriculture after her husband died. She realized she needed to find support for sustaining her children.

María will use the loan to buy fertilizers and compost to grow corn.

In the future, she would like to see her children having their own families.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and compost to grow corn.

loans.name: Elvina

texts.en:
Elvina is a married mother of four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over one year, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy started to manage a variety store business at the age of 21. At this very young age, she was already passionate to explore and even enhance her entrepreneurial skills. The business is still running and helping with their everyday expenses.

“Sari-sari” store in the Philippines means “variety of choices”. Most Filipinos preferred to buy items here since there’s no need for them to spend money for fare just to buy a product. Sari-sari stores are located in every barangay, municipality or even in cities. Lucy has the business in the comfort of her own home in Batasan, Philippines.

Lucy now has three children and two are already in the elementary level. She and her husband Noli are working together to support their children’s school expenses and other bills. Being in the business for 10 years now, Lucy aims to improve more her chosen business. Thus, she lacks of supporting capital for her to buy stocks of the grocery items she needs. Lucy requested a loan of Php 8,000 this time.

Lucy regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to add to her stock in her variety store.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha província de Maputo tem 31 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, pai de 2 filhos menores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua cunhada e sua irmã que vivem em sua casa.
Este é o seu 1º empréstimo na hluvuku com o qual pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio de criação de frangos adquirindo produtos como: pintos, ração e vitaminas para satisfazer os seus clientes.
Futuramente pretende ampliar o seu negócio da machamba e de criação.
texts.en:
He was born in Namaacha, Maputo province. He is 31 years old, married, and the father of two underage children who go to school. He takes care of his sister-in-law and his sister, who live in his house.

This is his first loan from Hluvuku, and he is planning to use it to expand his chicken-raising business, by buying products such as chicks, animal feed, and vitamins to fulfill his customers' demands.

In the future, he plans to expand his business of growing vegetables and raising animals.

loans.use: to buy chicks, animal feed, and vitamins to fulfill his customers' needs.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past five years, Sidi has operated a mat-weaving business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding and establishing a poultry business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting, Sidi wants to purchase paints and sewing materials. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase paints and sewing materials

loans.name: Sabiran

texts.en: Sabiran  is a hard working lady. Everyday increasing expenditures compelled her to initiate her own business of milk selling. She is 56 years old married woman.  She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Sabiran’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Sabiran  has requested for 60000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Lina operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Jumwa has operated a grocery and vegetables-selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul esta estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, es una persona que se esfuerza para poder ser una buena profesional y de esa forma poder ayudar a las demás personas. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, para poder seguir con sus estudios. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo de seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Raul is studying for a degree in Accounting. He is an individual who strives to become a successful professional so that he can help other people. Raul says that his previous loan was used to pay his degree fees, which was a great help.

He is requesting a new loan so that he can invest in the payment of his degree fees, which will allow him to continue his studies. Raul appreciates the opportunity he has received so that he can keep studying.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) from Batasan, Quezon City. She’s managing a variety store business for 10 years already. She also sell viands for lunch and dinner and earning to approximately Php 11,000 each month. A variety store is much known as “Sari-sari store” in the Philippines, meaning “variety of choices”. It is almost same to a convenience store but a smaller version. You’ll see a lot of it if you’ll go in the Philippines. Many patronizes this kind of business since items here can be purchased by piece, kilo and by volume unlike in supermarkets where most products are being sold in wholesale.

These businesses became a very helpful medium for the daily needs of her family. She’s thankful to God for blessing her with what she has right now. Her goal is to acquire more knowledge to make the business grow and learn new marketing strategies to further expand her product inventories. She takes advantage every time CCT conducts seminars for microentrepreneurs like her.

Being a mother, Marilyn works hard for her family as she wants her business to become successful someday. She aims to sustain their future needs through savings and to have revolving fund as well. With this, Marilyn is requesting for a Php 10,000 loan to start her desired plans. She will be using this amount to buy grocery items for her variety store and she looks forward to a better future ahead for her family.

Marilyn has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners, this made her to become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her variety store business.

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

Esha decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Nzisa

texts.en:
Nzisa is married, and has three children. She has owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a fruit and coconuts selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges are high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Ksh 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale . She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a married woman. She works at hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors and along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment; will allow her to cater to more customers consistently.

She is hopeful to get increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors and along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment; will allow her to cater to more customers consistently

loans.name: Maaloa

texts.en: Maaloa is 22 years old and single. She runs a business of selling cabbage,cucumber, eggplant, in her village to earn a living. Maaloa requested for a loan to buy vegetable seeds(cabbage,cucumber, eggplant), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals, to help her with the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds(cabbage,cucumber, eggplant), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals,

loans.name: Dina Emerita

texts.es: A sus 47 años de edad Dina continua esforzándose cada día para salir adelante, ella vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos, un nieto y la esposa de su hijo mayor. Ella es una mujer con mucha visión para los negocios, ya que cuenta con una tienda de productos básicos desde hace 20 años, en los que se ha logrado mantener en el gusto de sus clientes. Dina se siente feliz ya que con el crédito anterior logro mejorar el techo de su vivienda, evitando la filtración de la lluvia, pero actualmente solicita un nuevo crédito el cual invertirá en: cemento, arena, grava y ladrillo para reparar la pila y el lavadero de su vivienda y de esta manera cuidar del buen consumo del agua y evitando su desperdicio.
texts.en:
At 47 years old, Dina continues to work hard every day to get ahead. She lives together with her husband, her two children, a grandson, and the wife of her older son. She is a woman with great vision for business, since she has had a store selling staple products for 20 years that she has succeeded in maintaining to please her customers.

Dina is happy with her last loan, which allowed her to improve the roof of her home to avoid water dripping in. She is currently requesting a new loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and brick to repair the sink and washing area of her home so she can watch her water consumption and avoid wasting it.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and bricks to repair the sink and washing area of her home.

loans.name: Ruth Yanira

texts.es: Ruth de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de jugos y licuados desde hace 8 años su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de frutas, leche, azucar, vainilla entre otras cosas que necesita para la elaboracion de los alimentos y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Ruth is 44 years old and lives in a house she owns with her husband and her daughter. She has worked selling juices and smoothies for eight years. Her business is located close to her home in a well-traveled area. With the income she earns, she is able to pay for some of the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit, milk, sugar, vanilla, and other items she needs to make her shakes so she can earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, milk, sugar, vanilla, and other items.

loans.name: Chondo

texts.en:
Chondo is a divorced woman with five children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past one year, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers come to buy food. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients hence perishable of goods leading to losses.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid was born in 1957 year. He is married and lives with his wife in the north part of Tajikistan. He is very kind man. Rashid works hard from early morning till late evening. He is a master of repairing cars. He has his own workshop near his house.

Rashid is the only wage earner for the family, as his wife is a housewife. Rashid and his wife have no children and they want much to have children. His wife needs treatment for this aim. So, Rashid is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy medicines for treatment for his wife. Rashid and his wife await your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment of his lovely wife.

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.
With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

Rose has operated a fish selling business, which has been operational for over four years. She mentioned inflation as a challenge in the business.Rose dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira is a married woman and has been blessed with five children three of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Subira has been operating a poultry selling business for over two years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Subira dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a divorced woman and has been blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives together with her children in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a fish selling business for over one year, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces major challenges of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a married woman with two children, all of whom attends school. She owns a house that  neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a married woman with seven children, five of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has piped water nor electricity. Masika has operated a coconut business for the past ten years, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, tienen 52 años de edad, se encuentra acompañada, es madre de dos hijos de 22 y 15 años de edad, ellos están estudiando, la familia comparte una misma vivienda, ella se dedica a vender mariscos en un puesto fijo y de forma ambulante, su pareja le apoya en el desarrollo de sus actividades, su negocio funciona desde hace 15 años.
Opta por un crédito para mejorar su negocio, comprara pescado, camarones, conchas, etc., ofrecerá producto fresco a sus clientes y tendrá capital para abastecer su inventario cada vez que sea necesario, espera seguir trabajando para cumplir con sus responsabilidades.
Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande y darles a sus hijos un estilo de vida más confortable.
texts.en:
María is 52 years old, has a partner, and is the mother of two children, who are 22 and 15 years old and in school. They all live together in the same house. María works by selling seafood both from a fixed location and by traveling. Her partner supports her in her activities and she has been in business for the last 15 years.

She decided to apply for a loan to improve her business. She will buy fish, shrimp, shellfish, etc. She will provide fresh product to her customers and will have enough capital to purchase supplies whenever necessary. She plans to continue working to meet her responsibilities.

Her dream is to have a larger business and to give her children a more comfortable quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, shellfish, etc. She will provide fresh product to her customers and will have enough capital to purchase supplies whenever necessary.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various types of clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past three years, she has operated a mat weaving business, selling them from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a poultry business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase paints and sewing materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: purchase paints and sewing materials.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Agnes operates a vegetables stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi  is a married woman with two kids, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that  has electricity  but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Zawadi  operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation in  her place of operation.


With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en:
Kamel is in his twenties, and lives in a village near Jenin City and is taking care of his elderly parents who suffer from illness. He is single and is planning to get married.

Kamel owns a women’s clothing shop. He has been involved in this business for two years.

He is looking forward to improving his standard of living, so he has requested $1500 from Kiva’s partner, Alibdaa Palestine to buy new products that meet the requirements of his customers and provide more variety of clothes. Then he could provide for his family and the pay for medical treatments for his parents and then marry.

He is planning to buy more stock of clothes to increasing his inventory for kids and men so he can attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes for kids and men and increase his stock of clothing.

loans.name: Buron

texts.en:
Buron is a first time client of IMON. He was born in 1963 and is a caring father of 3 children. He has worked in the railway as a conductor for many years. He is industrious man. His salary is not enough to provide good living standard for his family.

Currently, his child is ill and be needs to buy medicine for treatment of his child. Buron is asking for a loan 3000 Somoni to buy these medications.

Buron and his child await your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicine for the treatment of his child.

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Maurine is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is electricity.

For the past four years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standards.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Dzidza

texts.en:
Dzidza is a married woman with six children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has piped water nor electricity.

Dzidza has operated a coconut business for the past ten years, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a married woman with eight children .She owns a house that has no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is electricity.

For the past twelve years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standards.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза, 32 года, замужем. У нее высшее образование, уже 5 лет в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается торговлей мужской одеждой, стартовав с 50,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Наргизы, на данный момент в обороте есть товар на сумму 260,000 сом (KGS), ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 19,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Наргиза обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одежды для реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Nargiza is 32 years old, married, and has a post-secondary education. For 5 years now, Nargiza has been selling men's clothing, which she began doing with 50,000 som (KGS). Nargiza's work is the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to Nargiza's very hard work, she currently has goods in stock worth 260,000 som (KGS), and her monthly income is around 19,000 som (KGS).

In order to continue developing her business, Nargiza has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy clothing for resale. With the income from the loan, Nargiza plans to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase men's clothing for retail sale in her shop.

loans.name: Roció Ivon

texts.es:
Roció, de 24 años de edad, es una joven emprendedora y luchadora, está soltera, estudio técnico en computación, actualmente vive con sus padres y hermanos. 

Roció, tiene un cibercafé y vende útiles escolares desde hace 3 años junto a su hermano, el negocio que posee está ubicado a medio kilómetro de distancia de su casa, camina aproximadamente 10 minutos para llegar ahí y su horario de atención es de lunes a viernes de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m. de la tarde.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar una maquina fotocopiadora de mayor capacidad que la que tiene y además comprará más útiles para exhibir y proponer a sus clientes. 

Roció, sueña con seguir estudiando en la universidad y estudiar ingeniera en sistemas, porque solo estudio un técnico, además desea mejorar su negocio y tener un local propio, porque donde actualmente trabaja alquila.
texts.en:
Rocio, who is 24 years old, is an enterprising and determined young woman. She is single and studied computer science. She currently lives with her parents and siblings.

Rocio has a cybercafe and sells school supplies with her brother and has for 3 years. Her business is located half a kilometer from her house. She walks for approximately 10 minutes to arrive there and her business hours are from Monday to Friday from 8:00am to 5:00pm.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy a higher capacity photocopier than the one she has and also to buy more supplies to exhibit and recommend to her customers.

Rocio dreams of continuing to study at the university and study Systems Engineering because she only studied for a technical certificate. She also wishes to improve her business and have her own property since she rents where she currently works.

loans.use: to buy a higher capacity photocopier than the one she has and also to buy more supplies.

loans.name: Pulega

texts.en:
Pulega is a 58-year-old mother with three children. She has a small business of selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living with the help of her children.

Pulega requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves, a backpack sprayer, and a chainsaw, which she needs for running the business.

She hopes to expand her business by using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2003.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves, a backpack sprayer, and a chainsaw.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese is a 45-year-old mother of seven children. She runs and operates a convenience store in her village to earn a living.

Akenese requested a loan to buy a freezer, a box of chicken, a sack of flour, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, a box of milk, and plastic bags, which she needs for her business.

She has been doing this for more than a year. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, a box of chicken, a sack of flour, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, a box of milk, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is married and has been blessed with five school-going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a dairy farming business, selling as retail and at the market to her local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase medicine for livestock and cow feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for livestock and cow feed.

loans.name: Selvina

texts.en:
Selvina is a widowed woman with four children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standards.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Alirio Esteban

texts.en:
Esteban is just 23 years old and lives in the municipality of Cañasgordas. A while ago, his family was going through a difficult economic time, reason why his father decided to teach him to work the land so he can start his own business, and he did, in 2007 he started growing different products so he could provide for his family.

8 years later, the business is running fine, but there’s a lot of competition on the market and this young man wants to improve his business, he desires to expand his growing and make his business sustainable. He’s asking for a little help, a loan that let him buy fertilizers and a pulper, and also to pay for some workforce. 

Esteban is very young, but really committed to his work and family, and in which he deposits his whole trust and know that it would let him accomplish great things in his life, and with your help, that can happen a lot faster, loan now and see how it happens.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and a pulper, and also to pay for some workforce

loans.name: John Francisco

texts.en:
John is 38 years old and lives in the municipality of San Pelayo. He has 3 beautiful daughters who are 11, 10 and 6 years old. These little girls are everything for this devoted and loving father who works hard to give to them an amazing life. To accomplish that he wants to start his own raising pigs business.

He’s aware that a good business is going to give him good profits that allow him to provide for his family; but he also is aware that to accomplish that he has to work hard and invest time and money in his business. He’s asking for a loan so he can start his business and can buy pigs and food for fat them up. 

John has many dreams but almost all of them are for the wellbeing of his daughters. He would love to fix his house in order to make them feel safe and comfortable. Support John so he can achieve all his goals and can give his family a good life, loan now.

loans.use: start his business and can buy pigs and food for fat them up

loans.name: Petrona Del Carmen

texts.es: A sus 35 años de edad Petrona sigue demostrando sus deseos de superación, ya que desde hace 6 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, actividad que realiza frente a su domicilio y le permite salir adelante con su familia. Petrona habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su madre y su pequeño hijo de 5 años de edad al que está sacando adelante como madre soltera. Petrona con el crédito anterior construyo un tapial alrededor de su vivienda, para brindar mayor seguridad además de invertir en maíz por mayor para su negocio, porque sintió que era más prioritario, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y ladrillo para construir una pila en su vivienda y de esta manera cuidar de la sanidad de su hogar.
texts.en: Petrona is 35 years old and wants to improve her life. She has spent 6 years making and selling tortillas, something she does from home. This activity has helped her to support her family. Petrona lives in her own home, along with her mother and her young 5 year old son. Petrona is a single mother. She used a previous loan to build a wall around her home to provide more security. She also bought more corn for her business. She felt that supplying her business was top priority and so she has had to wait to complete other home improvement projects.
