María, de 58 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está casada y vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, uno trabaja en la agricultura con el padre y la otra hija estudia.

María, trabaja en la agricultura desde hace muchos años junto con su esposo e hijos, ellos cada año trabajan en la agricultura cultivando maíz y todos los días se dedican a cuidar sus cultivos.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para aplicarlos a sus cultivos y esto le ayudará a mejorar sus cultivos y obtener mejores cosechas.

María, sueña con tener cultivos más productivos y también anhela que su hija siga estudiando y sea profesional.
texts.en:
Maria, who is 58 years old, went to school through second grade. She is married and lives with her husband and their two children. Their son works in agriculture with his father, and their daughter goes to school.

Maria has worked in agriculture for many years, along with her husband and children. They work in agriculture every year, raising corn, and every day they work to tend their crops.

Maria needs the loan to purchase agricultural supplies to apply to her crops, and this will help her to improve her crops and obtain better harvests.

Maria dreams of having more productive crops, and she also wants her daughter to continue going to school and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to apply to her crops.

loans.name: Maria Delfina

texts.es: Maria vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica la venta de pan dulce y pan frnaces y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando y pintando las paredes pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de materiales de construccion, pintura y pago de mano de obra para poder tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Maria lives in her own house along with her family group. She works selling sweet bread and french bread. With what she obtains from her sales, she is able to pay some household expenses.

She wants to improve her home by plastering and painting the walls, but as she doesn't have sufficient capital, she is applying for a loan to buy construction materials and paint and pay for labor in order to be able to have a dignified home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and paint and pay for labor.

loans.name: Tuyến

texts.en:
Mrs Tuyến is 26 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for 7 years. Tuyến lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to comfort her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.
This is Tuyến first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.

In the future, Tuyến hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Yokutkhon

texts.en:
Yokutkhon is a young and smart woman. She is single and lives with her parents in Tajikistan. She graduated school this year and has applied to the university. She always wanted to get higher education. Yokutkhon studies well and she is one of the best students at the university.

Her parents are workers and they have no money to pay for her university tuition. She is asking for a loan of 4000 Somoni to pay for her first semester university tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for her university education.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a fish selling business for over two years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces major challenges of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with one child who is too young to attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

Saumu decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Milicent

texts.en: Milicent told us, "I have always wanted to own a biogas system but didn't have enough information about cost options and reliability. However, I learned about Takamoto biogas from a neighbour and opted to install their system. This biogas system will enable me to save money spent on fuel every month which i will channel to paying school fees for my kids." She says the most surprising thing about her is that she is very straightforward and her pride and joy is her family.

loans.use: to buy a bio-digester for clean, renewable cooking for her family.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwajuma operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en: Eseta is 57 years old with 9 children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Eseta requested for a loan to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2010, and she will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals,

loans.name: Pesa

texts.en:
Pesa is in her late 40s and married with one grown up child. She has been running a labeling business for 15 years now. She works from 8:30am to 8:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Pesa's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy labeling products and served many people who used her labels for their cars stickers and companies for labeling their T-shirts. She is doing fine and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to take care of her family, to repay the loan, build her own house, buy a TV set, sofa sets, and cupboards and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the labeling items to meet her customers' requirements. She dreams of renovating her office to be on the standard level.

Pesa will be accountable for paying back her loan.

loans.use: to buy labeling materials to meet her customers' requirement.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Ernestina,  la socia  continua dedicándose  a la  Ganadería  y producción de  lácteos, la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente, la socia  continua produciendo  leche, queso y yogurt entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca.
texts.en:
Sra. Ernestina is a member who continues to engage in livestock breeding and milk production. She is extremely grateful to Kiva for helping her develop her business activities. Therefore, she is committed to completing her loan payments on time. Ernestina continues to produce milk, cheese, yogurt, and other products. She is a responsible person who works in this manner so that her family can get ahead.

Ernestina is requesting a loan in order to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past ten years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to pay her for goods taken on credit.

Dama decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with six kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanajuma operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Nhanh's Group

texts.en:
A 29-year-old divorced woman who is a resident in Kampong Cham province, Nhanh has one dependent daughter who is now in school. She earns a living through working as factory worker and selling grocery items. The challenge to her selling business is that there are fewer customers buying her items.
Nhanh who is the leader of three-member group will spend her loan on purchasing more grocery items to replenish her store so that she can attract more customers. She hopes she can improve her living condition and support her daughter’s studying until she finishes school.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to replenish her store so that she can attract more customers.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Gitanjali

texts.en:
Gitanjali is 34 years old, and she is married. She has had a manufacturing business making leaf plates for three years. She lives in Bolangir district, a rural town in Odisha, India. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet.

She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true.

With her business profit, Gitanjali hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Ratanak

texts.en:
Ratanak, aged 31, resides in Kandal province. He is married and has a daughter who is under the age of school. To make a living, he is working as a barber, while his wife is working as a tailor. Lack of working capital and too small barbershop are the challenge to Ratanak’s business.

He has been with VisionFund for 12 cycle loans already and now he is applying for a loan to repair his barbershop, to make it in good condition and to buy barber supplies. He hopes that after repairing the shop, there will be more customers and he can earn more income to support his family’s needs on times and send his daughter to school.

loans.use: to repair his barbershop to be more appealing, so as to attract more customers.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is 21 years old. He is married and is blessed with 1 child. He has had a welding business for 3 years. He will be using the loan to buy welding materials such as metal bars and iron rods for making windows and door frames and hopes this will enable him to make more income to support his family. His hopes and dreams for the future are to open another business and make more income to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy welding materials such as metal bars and iron rods for making windows and door frames and hopes this will enable him to make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a Kiva borrower with three children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells salts, sugar, flour, tea, sweets and other items. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 85,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, tea, and other items. She hopes that in the future she will have a stable business. She will use the anticipated profits to open another shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, tea, and other items

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita has been farming for many years and she earns better income from this. With her previous loan used for buying livestock to raise, she was able to raise more and was financially prepare for the next cropping season. She had repaid successfully her previous loan and is now planning to take a new loan for to buy livestock feeds to boosts her pigs. She is now happy to say that she was assured for a productive piggery in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Janireh

texts.en: Janireh is 29 years old and married with 3 children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport business in the local community to earn a living. He has been with his business for over 5 years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. He has been with GDMPC since 2009 and is now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to repair and purchase spare parts. He dreams to help his children complete their education.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Welda

texts.en:
Welda is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now. Welda works hard to support her family.

She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell.

In the future, Welda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 59 years old and married and she works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sugar, coffee, noodles, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Anita has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Anita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sugar, coffee, noodles, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a married woman and has been blessed with six children, five of whom attend school. One is still too young to attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces major challenges of seasonality and perishability leading to losses. She also operates a cloth selling business that earns her another source of income.

With the KES 45,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces major challenges of seasonality and transportation in her business.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Scolasicah

texts.en:
Scolasicah  is a married woman . She lives at her own house that  neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.
With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA JOVEN MADRE DE FAMILIA QUE MANTIENE A SU HIJO, ESTA PRESENTANDO PROBLEMAS DE DESCALSIFICACIÓN DENTAL DESDE SU EMBARAZO Y POSTERIOR AL PARTO. ELLA DESEA TRATARSE DE MANERA INMEDIATA PARA EVITAR PERDIDA DE PIEZAS DENTALES.
texts.en: This borrower is a young mother who supports her child.  She has been having problems with her teeth decalcifying since she was pregnant, as well as after giving birth.  She would like to obtain immediate treatment so that she can avoid losing her teeth.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Ay's Group

texts.en:
Ay, aged 43 years, is a married woman who is blessed with four children, three of whom rely on her. She resides in Kampong Thom province where she has been growing rice for the main source of income for 25 years. Sometimes, she uses her spare time to work for others for a fee in order to add more income. The obstacles to her farming business are drought and harvesting low outputs. Both businesses earn Ay about USD8 per day and can save approximately about USD3 each day. 
She is now leading a group of six members to apply for a loan support from VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy a water filter for her family; she hopes that all of her family members drink clean water so that they will be kept away from diseases.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide her family clean water and keep her children away from diseases. .

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Prasat Balang district

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 35 and the mother of seven children. She lives with her spouse and children in Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. He is a power loom worker by profession. He has been working for 5 years to meet the family’s expenses. A loom is a device used to weave cloth and tapestry. The basic purpose of any loom is to hold the warp threads under tension to facilitate the interweaving of the weft threads.

Now Shamim’s husband wants to buy a vandour machine to earn a proper income but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to do so. Therefore, Shamim has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Shamim’s husband can buy a vandour machine to earn an income.

Shamim and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy a vandour machine.

loans.name: Nyonko Group

texts.en:
The Nyonko Group is made up of four members; all are women. Between them, they are responsible for their families by supporting their husbands. They are from Accra, Teshie, which is known for being a productive area for trade and industries. They are selling cooking ingredients, charcoal, slippers, soft drinks, and provide bakery and sewing services.

The group has shown responsibility in their repayments. They are working hard to make progress with their different jobs, with their dreams and goals, and to provide their children with the stability that they need.

Because of her dedication, the representative of this group is Juliana, who has been sewing ladies' tops and skirts and also kids' dresses in a kiosk for fifteen years. She works eight hours a day. It is work that she really enjoys, since it provides a way of feeding her family.

The loan money will be used to buy one knitting machine, materials, lining, and thread to sew ladies' tops and skirts and also kids' dresses, which she will sell to customers.

In the not-too-distant future, she expects to earn more money. This is her second loan with Kiva and her fourth loan with ID-Ghana.

loans.use: to buy one  knitting machine, materials, lining, and thread to sew ladies' tops and skirts and also kids' dresses, which she will sell to customers.

loans.name: Ana Diosis

texts.es: Ana es una mujer que muestra su tenacidad cada día, cuando desde muy temprano se despierta para preparar a sus hijos para que vayan a estudiar y después debe salir muy rápido hacia la empresa de elaboración de prendas de vestir, en la que labora desde hace 17 años. Ana habita junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos una niña de 13 años y un varón de 12 años de edad en vivienda propia. Ana desea terminar de construir el muro perimetral de su vivienda, ya que la inseguridad en su comunidad cada día es mayor, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para terminar el muro perimetral en su vivienda, por lo que espera contar con este apoyo para poder brindar seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is a woman whose tenacity shows every day, when she gets up very early in the morning to get her children ready for school, and then very quickly goes on to work at the clothing manufacturing company, where she has worked for the last 17 years.

Ana lives in her own home with her husband and two children: a 13 year-old girl and an 12 year-old boy. She would like to finish building a wall around her house, since security in her community is worse every day. This is why she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and rebar, in order to finish the wall around her home. She hopes to have the support in order to be able to make her family safe.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and rebar to finish the wall around her home.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 58 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Fe requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Fe successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Fe has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Fe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet used the previous loan to buy secondhand clothes to sell.She is a 33-year-old widow with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She sells secondhand clothes to the people around her town and has been in business for 10 years. She is a hardworking woman charged with the responsibility of looking after her children and gets additional income from cocoa selling. Harriet faces the hardships of competition and limited capital to meet all her personal and business expectations.Harriet is seeking for another loan to buy secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marta De Jesus

texts.es:
Martha, de 60 años de edad, nunca fue a la escuela, porque sus padres en aquel momento decían de que no era necesario, está soltera y vive con su pequeño hijo el cual estudia cuarto grado y es el único que depende de ella.

Martha, se dedica a la crianza de pollos desde hace tres años, comenzó con pocos pollo solamente para el consumo de ella, pero luego se convirtió en un negocio, también en ocasiones hace meriendas para la venta como tostadas, enchiladas y panes con pollo y su pequeño hijo es el único que le ayuda en la crianza de los pollos.

Martha, necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz y concentrado para pollos, ya que están en edad para engordarlos y venderlos y posteriormente comprar pollos nuevos, esto mejorara la venta de los pollos porque entre más gordos están se venden mejor y eso significa mayores ganancias.

Martha, sueña con ver crecer a su hijo y se convierta en profesional; también sueña con tener una granja de pollos más grande en la cual pueda tener cientos de pollo.
texts.en:
Martha is 60 years old. She has never been to school, because her parents didn't think it was necessary. She is single and lives with her small child who is in the fourth grade. He is her only dependent.

Martha has raised chickens for the past three years. She began with only a few for her own consumption, but then it turned into a business. Occasionally she also makes snacks to sell such as tostadas, enchiladas and chicken sandwiches. Her young son is the only one who helps her with raising her chickens.

Martha needs the loan to buy corn and feed for the chickens, since they are at an age to be fattened and sold. Then she will buy new chickens. This will improve her sales because the fatter they are the better her earnings are.

Martha dreams of seeing her son grow up and become a professional. She also dreams of having a larger farm where she can have hundreds of chickens.

loans.use: to buy corn and feed for the chickens.

loans.name: Robson

texts.en:
Robson is a young enterpreneur residing in Nansana, a city surburb. He is a businessman who has dealt in marketing and distribution of lantern lamps for two years.

He orders these lamps from Dubai by using his friends who are doing trade on a wider basis. This enables him to obtain the lamps cheaply, and he markets them in Uganda and sells them at a good profit across the country. The lanterns have a market because of the constant power cuts, so people resort to them.

Mr. Robson is a good saver with Ugafode Microfinance Limited, and this has created trust in him over time.

Mr. Robson has applied for a loan of UGX 5,000,000 at Ugafode Microfinance to find a solution to his financial limitations. He will buy lantern lamps using the loan.

loans.use: to boost his  lanterns trade business by buying more lanterns to sell.

loans.name: Wazeer

texts.en:
Wazeer is a 50-year-old mother of four children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a manufacturer by profession and coats nickel polish over metallic spare parts and sells into the market. His practice to buy nickel and various chemicals to coat the spare parts for making it shiny and bright. He has been doing same practice for many years and been cherishing his entire family. Nowadays the nickel's market value has increased and unable to buy raw material to continue his business.
Therefore, Wazeer has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy nickel and various chemical to continue his manufacturing business. Wazeer hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to buy nickel and chemical for her husband coating spare parts and then selling business.

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es:
Aldo es estudiante de la carrera de contabilidad, es una persona muy sacrificada que se esfuerza por poder salir adelante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través de sus estudios, comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, lo cual le fue a de mucha ayuda.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo nuevamente en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Aldo is studying for a degree in Accounting. He is a self-sacrificing individual who strives to get ahead and improve his living conditions as a result of his studies. With his previous loan Aldo says that he was able to invest in the payment of his degree fees, which was a great help.

He is requesting this loan so that he can invest once again in the payment of his degree fees. This will allow him to continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina, who is in her late 30s, is married with one child. She has been running a clothing shop for six years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Amina's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep on increasing her clothing stock and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.

She used the profit to pay school fees, to buy a plot of land, for loan repayment, and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy up-to-date clothes to meet her customers' requirements.

Amina will be accountable for paying back her loan. She dreams of finishing building her house.

loans.use: to buy up-to date-clothes to sell.

loans.name: Las Martínez Group

texts.es:
Cuando se visita cierta comunidad del Estado de México es inevitable pasar por alto los bellos paisajes naturales que evocan un sentimiento de tranquilidad. Allí, gran parte de la población aún conserva la lengua mazahua y sus tradiciones aunque desgraciadamente están desapareciendo de manera gradual. Lo que sí tienen muy presente son sus fiestas patronales ya que realizan bailes, juegos, comidas, etc. Otro rasgo importante es que la mayor parte de la población se dedica al cultivo de maíz pues es la base de su alimentación.
   Alma es parte integral de un grupo que solicitó los préstamos de VF México, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable que, ante todo, busca la estabilidad económica para su familia. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la compra y venta de productos electrodomésticos, herramientas, materiales reciclados, juguetes, ventanas, es decir, que adquiere artículos descompuestos o usados y después de repararlo e incluso remodelarlos los pone a la venta en su comunidad.
   Todos los días lunes se puede encontrar en un pequeño puesto ubicado en el centro del municipio donde aprovecha para vender toda su mercancía. No obstante, ahora que conoce a VF México pudo comprar una vaca pequeña para iniciar una actividad secundaria que le genere ganancias extras. "Quiero tener animales ya que siempre me ha llamado la atención cuidar de ellos, pero pienso continuar con mi otra actividad para generar más beneficios" comentó entusiasmada. 
   Cabe mencionar que es un ejemplo para sus compañeras pues contagia su manera de ver la vida y su esfuerzo para enriquecer sus actividades. Además, con sus ganancias pudo comprar una vivienda que le asegura un patrimonio a sus hijos. Su meta es aumentar la producción de su negocio para que su esposo pueda trabajar hombro con hombro con ella; además desea abrir una tienda de abarrotes.
    Las otras integrantes del grupo son María Guadalupe quien invertiría en dulces; Soledad, en ropa y Cristina, en pollos.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el negocio de Alma quien asoma la cabeza en la parte de atrás.
texts.en:
Anyone visiting this community in the state of Mexico can't miss the beautiful scenery and countryside, which evoke a feeling a peace.  A large part of the population there have maintained the Mazahua language and their traditions, although unfortunately those are gradually disappearing.  What they do keep solidly in mind are their patron saint festivals, because they throw dances, hold games, make food, and so on.  Another important characteristic is that a majority of the population works growing corn, which is the foundation of their diet.

Alma is an integral part of a group that is asking for loans from VF México.  She is a very hardworking and responsible woman who, above all, is seeking financial stability for her family.  For the past four years she has worked buying and selling household appliances, tools, recycled materials, toys, and windows.  That is to say, she gets broken or used items and, after fixing them up or even completely re-making them, she sells them in her community.

Every Monday she can be found in a small stall located in the center of town where she sells all her merchandise.  Nevertheless, now that she knows VF México, she could buy a small cow to start a new, secondary line of work that will give her extra income.  “I want to have animals because caring for them has always appealed to me, but I’m thinking of continuing my other job in order to get more earnings,” she says, enthusiastically.  

It is worth mentioning that she sets an example for her group mates because her way of seeing life and her effort to improve her work are contagious.  Additionally, with her earnings she could buy a house that would ensure a legacy for her children.  Her goal is to increase her business’s production so that her husband can work side by side with her.  She also wants to open a grocery store.

The other group members are María Guadalupe, who will invest in sweets; Soledad, in clothing; and Cristina, in chickens.

The picture was taken in Alma’s business; she is sticking her head up in the back.

loans.use: to buy a small cow

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en: Dinah is single and lives in Sebac, Tudela with her family. She earns a better income from her transportation business and was able to support her parent's needs. She also bought some home appliances out of her generated income. Her previous loan was used for maintenance of her vehicle and it was repaid successfully. To make her services more comfortable and safe, she took a new loan recently to buy tires and accessories for her motorcycle and repair costs. She plans to use her profit to buy a sidecar to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tires and accesories for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es:
Pastora, nunca fue a la escuela, vive con su hijo y la esposa de su hijo, él trabaja como albañil y su esposa como comerciante y Pastora, depende directamente de los ingresos que su negocio genera.

Pastora, tiene una tienda desde hace un año, fue una idea que surgió de la necesidad que tenia de generar algunos ingresos, pero aparte de eso ella sale a vender algunos productos casa por casa en toda su comunidad. 

Pastora, necesita el préstamo para comprar más productos para la tienda y así ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y que sus ventas mejoren.

El principal sueño de Pastora, es que su tienda sea una de las más grandes de la comunidad y ayudarle a su nieto para su educación.
texts.en:
Pastora never went to school. She lives with her son and her son's wife. He works as a bricklayer and his wife is a businesswoman.

Pastora depends directly on the income that her business generates. She has had a store for the last year. It was an idea that arose from the necessity she had to generate some income. And besides this she goes out and sells some products door-to-door throughout the community.

Pastora needs the loan to buy more products for her store and thus offer more variety to her clients and improve her sales.

Pastora's main dream is for her store to become one of the largest in the community and help her grandchild with his education.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a mother with four children and a resident of Batasan, Quezon City in the Philippines. She operates a Piso Net center to earn a living. (Piso Net is a merger of PC and arcade rental services in which customers use tokens to pay for time on a computer or arcade game.) She received a prior loan through Kiva's field partner CCT to buy equipment, supplies, and materials needed for her business. As a result she saw a great improvement in her center and an increase in her profits.

Josefina has now applied for a 50,000 PHP loan from CCT to acquire a faster and more efficient internet connection and perhaps buy more PC units. She is determined to be successful and build a life that is easier for her family.

All CCT community clients like Josefina are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to acquire a faster and more efficient internet connection and perhaps buy more PC units.

loans.name: Neemat

texts.en:
Neemat is a 50-year-old married mother of three and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. She works as a hairdresser from her house and sells clothes to help her husband in covering the needs of their children.

Neemat's family is her priority. She is a self-sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her children. Today she is acquiring a 2,500 USD loan through Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her daughter's wedding expenses. She is planning to make it a special day for her beloved daughter.

Neemat hopes to develop her business more in the future to stay capable of providing her family with good living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's wedding expenses.

loans.name: Mweke

texts.en:
Mweke is a married woman with no children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mweke operates a grocery vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.


With the KES 15,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nyadzua

texts.en:
Nyadzua is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated an orange selling business, selling at wholesale to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of seasonality in her business. Nyadzua dreams of establishing a vegetable stall in the future.

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of oranges for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of oranges for resale.

loans.name: Anbebara Group

texts.fr:
Awa  est la femme qui tient la corde du bélier dans la photo .
Agée de 36 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants; son mari est cultivateur. Elle et aucun de ses enfants ne sont scolarisés. Elle pratique l’élevage depuis  5 ans; Elle fait ses achats au marché public de sa localité. Ses ventes sont faites dan le même marché . Elle demande un prèt au RMCR pour acheter plus béliers pour son élevage. Avec le profit tiré elle prend les depenses de sa famille et de scolariser ses enfants.
Elle aime l’élevage car cette activité lui permet de gagner sa vie dignement  seulement elle a comme difficulté le manque de moyen nécessaire pour agrandir son élevage et d’acheter  d’avantage d’ alliment betaille. C’est pourquoi elle fait recours au RMCR pour acheter beaucoup de béliers pour revendre.
texts.en:
Awa is the woman holding the rope of the ram in the photo. She is 36 years old and married with 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. She and none of her children have been in school. 

She has been farming for 5 years. She makes her purchases at her local public market. Her sales are made in the same market. She is asking for a loan from RMCR to buy more rams for breeding. With the profit she makes, she covers the expenses of her family.

She loves farming as this activity allows her to earn a living with dignity. However, she lacks the necessary means to expand her breeding business and buy even more animal feed. That is why she is asking for a loan from RMCR to buy many rams to resell.

loans.use: to buy rams to resell after.

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en:
Ruta, 50, has three children, one of whom is disabled. Kristina, her sister-in-law lives with them as well; both are pictured above. The family lives in a little town in northern Albania.

The family's income comes mainly from governmental disability payments and caretaking support. Kristina receives a monthly check for $79 for the ongoing therapy she receives for a severe illness she's had for the past three years. Ruta’s son also receives $79 in disability income monthly, with an equal amount going to Ruta for her care for him. Ruta's daughter also receives $79 a month in her role as a caretaker.

Ruta has applied for a 220,000 ALL loan through Kiva's field partner VisionFund Albania in order to pay for Kristina’s continued medical care. The family is impoverished and have been under emotional distress for several years now. This family is in need of compassion as well as financial aid.

loans.use: to pay for Kristina’s continued medical care for her severe illness.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a single woman with no children. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past year, she has operated a business selling clothes. She sells door-to-door to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 10,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with six children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Jane has operated a tailoring business for the past two years. She makes women's and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. Her major challenge is transportation. In addition, she operates a Khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business that provides her another source of income.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman and has been blessed with six children, two of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mwaka has operated a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over five years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Mwaka dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a single woman. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is electricity. 

For the past two years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standard. 

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Muzazi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Elie fait partie du groupe  Muzazi II et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 31 ans et est marié à Dina, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 6mois à 10 ans, dont  1 étudie. 

Il a une boutique et un salon de coiffure depuis 13 ans.  

Il est à son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu'il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  des produits de beauté et tondeuse  pour servir beaucoup de clients, afin de  gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait pratiquer l'agriculture des légumes, l’élevage de vaches, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Elie is a member of the Muzazi II group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 31 years old and is married to Dina, a farmer. Together, they have three children, aged from six months to 10 years old. One of the children are in school.

Elie has had a shop and a hair salon for 13 years. He is on his third loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, he is going to increase his capital and buy beauty products and clippers to serve his customers in order to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to farm vegetables, raise cattle, and see his children go to school.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and clippers.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with seven children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Margeret

texts.en:
Margeret is a married woman with two children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with six children, three of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.
With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married mother of four children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat . She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa est une veuve femme  avec quatre enfants à charge. Kossiwa est âgée de 55 ans et habite à Agoè où elle exerce son activité de restauratrice  de la pâte bandée « kom » faite à base du maïs. Kossiwa s’approvisionne du nécessaire servant à la préparation deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Kossiwa sollicite ce crédit pour commander des sacs de maïs  afin de gagner plus de bénéfices et de venir en aide aux besoins de sa famille et d’améliorer les conditions de vie quotidiennes de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kossiwa is a 55-year-old widowed mother to four children who lives in Agoè. This is where she runs her catering business where she cooks and sells "Kom", a paste which is made from maize. Kossiwa gets the necessary supplies for this maize mash twice monthly from market. She then resells the finished product out of her own home.

She is requesting this loan to purchase bags of maize so she can earn a larger profit and thereby meet her family's needs and improve the daily living standards of her children.

loans.use: to purchase five bags of maize.

loans.name: Elikplim

texts.fr: Mère de deux enfants, Elikpim est une jeune femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé. Agée de 23 ans, Elipkim est une revendeuse de cereales et de charbon de bois  qui s’approvisionne et le revend  deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois, Elipkim  nécessite ce prêt en vue de gagner des bénéfices pour aider ses enfants à l’épanouissement et dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Elikpim is a mother of two and a young married woman living in Adidogomé. She is 23 years old.

Elipkim is a cereal and charcoal retailer who procures merchandise and retails at the market twice a month.

Elipkim is requesting this loan to order charcoal bags and make profits with which to help her children flourish and get a school education.

loans.use: to buy twelve bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Juan Alejandro Lazaro

texts.es:
En el Estado de México se ubican distintas comunidades que tienen como característica principal su riqueza natural y la amabilidad de sus pobladores. Una comunidad en específico cuenta con impresionantes vistas debido a sus grandes cerros llenos de vegetación durante todo el año; muchos árboles frutales y otros más con propiedades medicinales que los habitantes utilizan de forma tradicional.  Los amaneceres y los ocasos son dignos de admiración y no pocos fotógrafos acostumbran ir para captar estos bellos fenómenos. 
   Don Juan es un hombre que no obstante su edad sigue manteniendo una gran energía y todos cuanto lo conocen saben que es muy trabajador y responsable. Ha formado una gran familia junto a su esposa Bertha desde hace 50 años y fruto de ello son sus 12 hijos quienes a su vez han formado sus propias familias. 
   La labor de don Juan es vender  pinturas y  productos industriales como tambos de plástico, metal, cartón, etc. con el fin de reciclarlos. Formalmente, lleva cinco años  en  la venta de dichos productos, pero toda su vida se ha dedicado a recolectar distinto material reciclable. Su actividad le causa satisfacción porque además de obtener ingresos considerables, ayuda al medio ambiente y las futuras generaciones. Los principales clientes provienen de ferreterías locales que una vez limpios los contenedores reutilizan con pinturas o aceites.
   Con este nuevo préstamo que solicitó a VFMéxico tendrá los ingresos necesarios para pagar un lote de contenedores y también compraría más recipientes plásticos y de metal. “El único reto que tengo es cuando debo ingresar la inversión inicial pero gracias al crédito lo he superado" comenta contento. “No me gusta cuando mis clientes tienen que regresar sin lo que buscaban” agregó don Juan quien siempre se esfuerza por cumplir con las expectativas de sus clientes.
*La fotografía fue tomada dentro de su negocio donde se pueden apreciar los contenedores.
texts.en:
In the State of Mexico there are distinct communities that have as their principal characteristic their natural wealth and the kindness of their citizens. One specific community has impressive vistas due to its large mountains filled with vegetation year round, including many fruit trees and others that have medicinal properties which the residents use in traditional ways. The sunrises and sunsets are worthy of admiration and photographs tend to not capture the beautiful phenomena.

Don Juan is a man who, in spite of his age, continues maintaining great energy. Everyone who knows him knows that he is very hard working and responsible. He has made a large family together with Bertha, his wife of 50 years, the fruit of which is their 12 children who in turn have formed their own families.

Don Juan's work is selling paints and industrial products such as plastic barrels, metal, cardboard, etc. with the aim of recycling them. Formally, he has been selling the aforementioned products for 5 years, but his whole life he has earned a living collecting different recyclable materials. His business gives him satisfaction because in addition to getting considerable income, he helps the environment and future generations. The principal clients come from local hardware shops which, once clean, reuse the containers with paint or oil.

With this new loan which he requested from VF Mexico, he will have the necessary income to pay for a batch of containers and also he would buy more plastic and metal containers. "The only challenge that I have is when I need to enter the initial investment, but thanks to the loan I have overcome it," he comments happily. "I do not like when my clients have to go away without what they were looking for," added Don Juan, who always makes the effort to fulfill his clients' expectations.

*The photograph was taken inside his business where the containers can be seen.

loans.use: para pagar un lote de contenedores y recipientes plásticos y de metal

loans.name: Maravillas De Cristo Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Maravillas de Cristo” y está formado por 11 integrantes responsables. Rocio de 42 años de edad es conviviente con 03 hijos. Rocio se dedica a la Agricultura y ganaderia. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a la agricultura, ya que una actividad que a heredado de sus padres y gracias a su constante dedicación puede darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de fertilizantes para su siembra. El deseo de Rocio es contar con un terreno mas amplio para seguir sembrando en cantidad. El grupo “Maravillas de Cristo” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por darles la oportunidad de conseguir sus metas. Thalia Y Melisa no se muestran en la fotografía ya que el dia de la reunión no se pudieron dar tiempo ya que tenían que cuidar sus siembras. Rocio es la que esta con una chompa rosada y cargando en su espalda a un bebe quien es su nieto.
texts.en:
This is the Maravillas de Cristo group, which is made up of 11 responsible members. Rocio is 42 years old, married, and has three children. Rocio works as a farmer and raising livestock. For more than 10 years, she has been a farmer, since it was an activity she learned from her parents. Thanks to her constant dedication, she is able to give her family a better quality of life.

She is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizers for her crops. Rocio's dream is to have a larger plot of land to continue planting in larger quantities.

The Maravillas de Cristo group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for giving them the opportunity to achieve their goals. Thalia and Melisa are not in the photograph since they had to care for their crops and could not attend the group meeting. Rocio is the one in the pink sweater carrying her grandson on her back.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Mwanaheri, who is in her mid 30's is married, with two kids who are still in school.She has been running a grains shop for one year now. She works from 07am to 09pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mwanaheri's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increasing on her grains stock and has managed to pay back her loan successfully. She is so grateful with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group.

She used the profit to pay school fees,loan repayments,bought a plot of land and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increase on the grains stock and sell at wholesale price as well as retail price. She dreams of expanding her business and to build her own house.

Mwajuma will share this loan with her loan group Mshikamano which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan

loans.use: to increase on the grains stock and sale at wholesale price as well as retail price.

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita is 49 years old and has five children. Estrellita is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Estrellita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Estrellita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

Estrellita has been in pig fattening for 31 years now and has borrowed 25 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Estrellita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 48 years old and married with two children.

Amalia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Amalia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Amalia has been raising livestock for 5 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Amalia would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Ma. Erma

texts.en:
Ma. Erma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She has a candy-making business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 60,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her candy-making business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Erma dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her candy-making business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. Gina is widowed and has a business buying and selling scrap materials in the Philippines.

Gina requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more scrap materials to sell.

Gina has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is 52 years old and married with eight children.

Rose Marie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Rose Marie has been in this business for 22 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Rose Marie aspires to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a single woman who has no children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food .

For the past three years, she has owned a food stall business, selling to neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients resulting in perishable goods going to waste and leading to losses.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to include a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa is a single woman who has no children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Santa operates a grocery vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Arizona A Group

texts.en:
Salumu is in his early 30s and is married with three children. All of his children are still in school. He has been running three projects, selling fried fish, running charcoal business, and selling traditional chicken for ten years now. He works from 7am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Salumu's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loans to increase his fish stock, to buy sacks of charcoal and to start selling traditional chicken. He has paid back his loan successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay his loan and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to increase his fish stock, to buy cooking oil for frying fish, to buy sacks of charcoal and to increase his supply of traditional chicken to sell.

He dreams of building his own house.

Salumu will share this loan with his loan group Arizona A, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his fish stock, to buy cooking oil for frying fish, to buy sacks of charcoal and to increase supplies of traditional chicken to sell.

loans.name: Santa Elena Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Santa Elena está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Graciela quien tiene un kiosco con todo tipo de productos, gracias a que tiene una buena variedad siempre, le está yendo muy bien y está mejorando poco a poco su negocio. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través de su negocio.
La Sra. Graciela  pide este préstamo para la compra de los productos que ella ofrece en su negocio como por ejemplo; azúcar, arroz, harina, leche, panificados, entre otros.
texts.en:
The group named “Santa Elena” is in its first loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. It is a new group in which all of the members are working and helping one another to succeed.

One of the members is Sra. Graciela, who has a kiosk where she sells all types of products. Thanks to the good variety that she always offers, her business is doing very well and is improving little by little. Graciela appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can improve her living conditions through her business.

Sra. Graciela is requesting a loan in order to buy products that she can offer in her business such as sugar, rice, flour, milk, baked goods, and other items.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour, milk, baked goods, and other products.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny is a 38-year-old married woman with six children. Being a farmer, she can only make 10 USD per day to support her family. Ny resides in a rural area of Ba Phnum District, Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involving in the farming sector for nearly 15 years now.

Because she is facing a financial issue in her family, Ny would like to get a low-interest loan from Kiva in order to build a new hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan since it will improve her health, the environment, and her living standards. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like her.

loans.use: to build a new hygienic latrine

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 35 year old. She is a single mother of one child. She sells handbags and clothes and has been in this business for the last nine years and it has been profitable.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she will use the loan to purchase handbags, shoes and clothes for sell and hopes this will enable her to serve more customers and get more income to support her family. She will use the anticipated profits to provide food for her family. 

In future, she hopes to expand her business by opening a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase handbags, shoes and clothes for sale and hopes this will enable her to serve more customers and get more income to support her family.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Life may be too tough and sometimes rough-sailing, but when you have hope, nothing is impossible. That's what Nenita upholds and she's thankful that you let her borrow an amount previously which helped her a lot in her food stall business. Because of the financial aid, she was able to increase her profit in such a way that she was able to supply her family with their basic needs at home.

She would like to access again another loan that she would use to buy additional raw ingredients for her recipes and other materials needed in cooking or selling. A PHP 40,000 loan is enough to cater to these needs. She really hopes that you'll trust her again. The main reason why she does persevere in her business is to provide and invest a better future for her family.

She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for her recipes and other materials needed in cooking or selling.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a very diligent entrepreneur manifested on how she has kept her persistence managing her own direct-selling business. Here, she sells different kinds of personal product sales like lotions, cosmetics, perfumes and other relative products. Through investing to such, she finds a living for her family be it food or other basic necessities.

In fact, to further improve her business sales, she had a loan from KIVA that she utilized in purchasing more products to sell. This was actually a great help. Although sometimes, it is inevitable to experience hardships especially in business matters, Leonila still continues. 

Today, she would like to request again a PHP 15,000 loan. She needs support because she wants to buy additional merchandise for her trade. It would be more preferable if she has more direct-selling products to sell because it means additional income. 

In the future, she dreams to eventually expand her trade and wishes her family to prosper, not just financially but also spiritually. By faith, she hopes that you will grant her request today. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase personal products like perfumes, cosmetics, toiletries and other products.

loans.name: Ma. Nena

texts.en:
Ma. Nena is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Nena dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zeniada is 67 years old, widow with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Zeniada has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Zeniada requested a PHP 26,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients to make her dried fish.

Zeniada has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Zeniada would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her dried fish making business.

loans.name: Laurencia

texts.en:
Laurencia is 36 years old, married with two children.

Laurencia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, biscuits, candies, noodles, soft-drinks, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell.

Laurencia has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from vegetables vending.

Laurencia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, biscuits, candies, noodles, soft-drinks, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Angelina is 43 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Angelina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Angelina requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional variety of fish to sell to her customers.

Angelina has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Angelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional variety of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Levie

texts.en:
Levie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Levie has been in this business for 3 years. Levie earns additional income from dried fish making.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Lisley

texts.en:
Lisley is 45 years old and married with six children. With three children currently in school, Lisley works very hard to provide for them.

Lisley runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Lisley has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, biscuits, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, etc.

In the future, Lisley would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lewelyn

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of three children, Lewelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Lewelyn is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of rice to resell.

Lewelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 29 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to resell.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 54 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marietta has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Marietta requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell.

Marietta has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Marietta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy gasoline and other materials for her motorcycle transport business.

Perla has been in this business for 5 years. Perla earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and other materials for her motorcycle

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman . She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expence is food.

For the past one year, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standards.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Elvina

texts.en:
Elvina is a married woman and has been blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Elvina has operated a poultry-selling business, which has been operational for over six years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Elvina dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Masika operates a grocery vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Ana Griselda

texts.es:
Ana elabora meriendas típicas como: tamales, yuca frita, tostadas de plátano, entre otros platillos, ya cuenta con mucha experiencia, el oficio lo aprendió al ayudar a su madre, pues también ella se dedica dicha actividad, sus productos los vende casa por casa; Ana vive en casa familiar junto a sus padres, su compañero de vida y un hijo de 6 meses de edad.
Está optando por un financiamiento para poder comprar al mayoreo productos como azúcar, aceite, maíz, yuca, etc., para preparar la venta de antojitos, podrá ahorrar y tener un margen más grande de ganancias, espera que las ventas se mantenga para recuperar la inversión sin problemas.
Sus aspiraciones son apoyar a sus padres y darle a su hijo un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Ana prepares typical snacks such as tamales, fried cassava, and banana toast, among other dishes. She already has a lot of experience. She learned this trade while helping her mother, since she too is engaged in this business. She sells her products door to door. Ana lives in her family home with her parents, her life partner, and their 6 month old son.

She is electing to take out a loan to buy wholesale products such as sugar, oil, corn, and cassava, etc., to prepare snacks to sell. This will enable her to save and have a higher profit margin, and she expects her sales will be supported to recoup the investment without problems.

Her aspirations are to support her parents and to give her child a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy wholesale products such as sugar, oil, corn, cassava, etc., to prepare snacks to sell.

loans.name: Zeinat

texts.en:
Zeinat is a 47-year-old married mother of four. She works hard to support her family, who are her main concern in life. She works hard to provide them with a better standard of living, especially because they are Palestinian refugees in Lebanon and don't have the same minimum decent living standard that others do.

Three years ago, Zeinat started selling clothes for a living. Today, she is obtaining a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy a car which will facilitate her business and allow her to transport products easily.

Zeinat hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car which will facilitate her business

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jean works hard to support her family. Mary Jean is married and has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

Mary Jean requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell to her customers.

Mary Jean has been in this business for 7 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Mary Jean would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines.
