Jocelyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 20 years now.

Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, pancit canton, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like rice farming.

Mary Jean dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, pancit canton, etc.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a hollow blocks making business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothes. Analyn is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy materials like cement, gravel and sand to use in making hollow blocks.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like cement, gravel and sand to use for making hollow blocks.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Helen dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es:
Yamileth es una señora con 36 años de edad, tiene dos hijos menores de edad y vive en el municipio de Sincelejo. Los diversos factores que la han llevado al fracaso en ocasiones anteriores no han sido impedimento para esta mujer querer salir adelante y realizar sus proyectos, lo que se propone lo logra, actualmente desea montar su propio negocio, quiere dedicarse a la venta y preparación de comidas como lo son los tamales, es por esto que solicita un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de carnes, papa, sal y demás alimentos que sean de su utilidad.
Su  mayor sueño es poder pagar la educación de sus hijos, pues su bienestar le preocupa.
Sabe que con la ayuda de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva sus sueños se harán realidad.
texts.en:
Yamileth is a 36-year-old woman with two young children. She lives in the town of Sincelejo. There have been various factors that have resulted in past failures and prevented her from succeeding and accomplishing her goals. Now she is determined to succeed by establishing her own business.

Yamileth would like to prepare and sell food, such as tamales. For this reason she will invest in the purchase of meats, potatoes, salt, and other ingredients that will be useful.

Her greatest wish is to pay for her children’s education, since she is concerned about their welfare. Yamileth knows that with the help of Interactuar and the Kiva lenders, her dreams can become reality.

loans.use: to buy meats, potatoes, salt, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Abel Antonio

texts.es: Abel de 34 años de edad, vive al lado de su hijo de 8 años de edad por quien lucha día con día por ofrecerle una mejor forma de vida y sacarlo adelante. Abel se desempeña como jornalero tanto fuera como dentro de la comunidad en la que habita, para así ganarse la vida y poder llevar el pan de cada día para su hijo, y así en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: bloque, hierro, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para mejorar su vivienda, ya que parte de ella está construida con láminas y madera. Y para sentirse más seguro desea construir la pared de bloques y concreto.
texts.en:
Abel is 34 years old. He lives with his 8-year-old child for whom he fights daily to offer him a better way of life and tp get ahead. Abel works as a day laborer both in and outside the community where he lives in order to make a living and bring bread every day for his child. In this way he seeks to improve his quality of life.

He is requesting a FUSAI loan to invest in: cinder blocks, iron, cement, sand, and labor payments in order to improve his house, since part of it is constructed with wood and metal sheets. In order to feel more secure, he wants to build the wall with cinder blocks and concrete.

loans.use: to invest in: cinder blocks, iron, cement, sand, and labor payment in order to improve his house.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, su objetivo es poder terminar su carrera de enfermería, para poder mejorar su futuro y el de su hija.
Ella comenta que su meta es poder ayudar a su hija para que tenga un mejor futuro y que no le falte nada, que no pase por necesidades como las que ella paso.
Pide ese préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city of Paraguarí. Her goal is to finish her degree in Nursing so that she can have a better future for herself and her daughter.

Maria says that her goal is to be able to help her daughter have a better future without any hardship and not have to go through the same experience that she endured.

She is requesting a loan in order to pay for her degree fees.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalyn is 30 years old and has four children who are in school.

Rosalyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Rosalyn requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rosalyn has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Rosalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is married, and has two kids who attend school. She has owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a motorcycle spare parts business from home. Her potential customers are motorcycle operators. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge in her business.
With the Ksh 30,000 she wants to purchase stock of motorcycle spare parts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards

loans.use: to purchase stock of motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Tifai

texts.en: Tifai is a 56 year old mother with 5 children, who runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. Tifai requested for a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, and plastic bags, to assist her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, and plastic bags,

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwajuma operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Mariga

texts.en:
Mariga is a married woman with three children all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a motorcycle transport business for more one year now. Mariga is a very self-sacrificing woman, and she operates from door to door. She mentioned a major challenge of seasonality in her business.
She is requesting the loan to purchase a second hand motorcycle, and so meet her customers' needs. She decided to join yehu to access loans and boost her business and also improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a second hand motorcycle,.

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en: Sumera is a 33 years old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a driver by profession. He drives a pick-up van in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. He wants to change his vehicle's tires and purchase some spare parts. That is why Sumera  has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR for her husband to provide better facilities to his customers. Sumera  is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to change her husband's vehicle's tires and to purchase some spare parts.

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili is a single woman and has two children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators in the market.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Saira Carolina

texts.es: Saira de 25 años de edad, vive al lado de su hija de 6 años de edad, y demás de su familia. Ella es madre soltera quien con mucho esfuerzo saca adelante a su hija. Saira es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora que en busca de poder ofrecerle lo mejor a su hija, presta sus servicios domésticos en una comunidad cercana a su vivienda, actividad que realiza con el fin de cubrir sus necesidades básicas y las de su familia, además con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida, los fines de semana también presta sus servicios domésticos en un comedor dentro de su comunidad y lo que le permite aumentar sus ingresos económicos. Saira desea mejorar su vivienda para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: bloques, arena, cemento, láminas, clavos y pago de mano de obra para la construcción de su baño, de esta manera poder mejorar su vivienda y a la vez tener una mejor sanidad.
texts.en: Saira, 25, lives alongside her six-year-old daughter and the rest of her family. She is a single mother who provides for her daughter through much effort. Saira is an enterprising and hardworking woman. In order to be able to offer her daughter the best she can in life, she provides housekeeping services in a community near her home. She works in order to cover her basic needs and those of her family, and also to improve her quality of life. On the weekends, she also provides her domestic services in a small restaurant in her community, which allows her to make additional income. Saira wants to improve her home, so she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in: blocks, sand, cement, sheet metal, nails, and labor to construct her bathroom. In this way, she can improve her home, and also have better health.

loans.use: to invest in: blocks, sand, cement, sheet metal, nails, and labor to construct her bathroom.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia Rosa pertenece al banco SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, la socia continua dedicándose a la ganadería, producción y venta de leche, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma, a la vez la socia continua dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores,   siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra  de chanchos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “San Bartolome de Tambo Real”. She continues to raise livestock and sell milk that her animals produce. Rosa is a responsible individual who appreciates the opportunity she has received in this manner. Therefore, she promises to complete her loan payments on schedule.

Rosa continues to raise small animals so that she can help her family move forward. She is requesting a loan in order to buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her buy-and-sell fish business. Gina has been in this business for 2 years. She earns additional income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 60 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, conditioner, soap, etc.

Mercedita has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, conditioner, soap, etc.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past year, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 10,000 she wants to purchase stocks of new clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
El Sr. Valentin tiene 65 años, está casado, tiene 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad, que junto con su esposa criaron y sacaron adelante con mucho esfuerzo, y hoy ya son hombres de bien.
Valentin es gomero, comenzó como ayudante de su padre de quien aprendió el oficio, desde hace 40 años trabaja por cuenta propia, y ya tiene muchos clientes que siempre se acercan a él. Su gomería está bien ubicada, por lo que le va mejor.
Pide este préstamo para comprar compresoras para poder utilizar en su negocio, y agradece por la oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Sr. Valentin is 65 years old, married, and has three grown children. He and his wife were able to raise them and help them move forward with a great amount of effort. Today they are outstanding individuals.

Valentin is a tire repair technician. He started out as his father’s assistant, which is how he learned the trade. Valentin has worked on his own for the past 40 years and has many customers who always seek his services. His tire repair shop is in a good location, which is why it is doing well.

Valentin is requesting this loan so that he can buy compressors to use in his business. He appreciates the opportunity he has received.

loans.use: to buy compressors for his tire repair shop.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is married and a mother of six children. She owns and manages her fishpond just to earn a living. With the help of her husband, she earns income through selling fish in their village. She has been doing this for ten years.

She always wants to augment their situation to provide an improved living standard for her family. Without hesitation, Ma. Theresa borrows an amount to buy new fishing nets and hooks. She is a member of GDMPC, and with her access to it, her goal of improving her business will become easier.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and hooks

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Amani operates a grocery vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school while the other is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a cosmetic shop business, her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbours, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks, and body lotions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks, and body lotions for resale.

loans.name: Lucio Rolando

texts.es: Lucio es un hombre de 63 años, vive junto a su pareja en la localidad rural de Pampacolca, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Él se dedica a trabajos múltiples, como peonaje agrícola, venta de forraje, crianza de ganado vacuno orgánico y cultivo de alfalfa y papa orgánica; solicita el micro crédito para poder sembrar papa orgánica, es decir, para comprar semilla orgánica de papa y para preparar el terreno agrícola con abono orgánico. En el futuro espera poder darle a su pareja estabilidad económica y sobre todo espera poder tener salud, es por ello que apuesta por lo orgánico, para seguir estando junto a su ella por mucho tiempo más.
texts.en:
Lucio is a 63-year-old man who lives with his partner in the rural town of Pampacolca, which is located in Arequipa. He works multiple jobs such as being a farm laborer, selling fodder, raising organic cattle, and cultivating organic alfalfa and potatoes.

Lucio is requesting a microloan in order to cultivate organic potatoes. In other words, he will be buying organic seed potatoes and preparing the soil by spreading organic fertilizer. In the future he hopes to provide his partner with financial stability, but most of all, he hopes to remain healthy. This is why he is committed to an organic lifestyle, so that he and his partner can be together for a very long time.

loans.use: to buy organic seed potatoes and fertilizer.

loans.name: Dzendere

texts.en:
Dzendere is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a grocery vegetables selling stall and sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Bendera

texts.en:
Bendera is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, she lives at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Kiwa Island Group

texts.en:
Shelemiah is the school principal of the secondary school found in Kiwa which is an island in Lake Victoria. While the national grid passes on the mainland, Kiwa is yet to be connected to the grid. The students at the school have to use kerosene lamps to study at night. This is both inefficient and strenuous for the students.

A new solar micro-grid has just been installed on the island. The micro-grid will replace these kerosene dependent lamps. It will offer constant, reliable, and clean energy that will be beneficial to the school and community at large.

Shelemiah believes that this power will have a big impact on the performance of the students at this secondary school, the only one on the island. The students will be able to study comfortably without straining their eyes or breathing in harmful kerosene fumes. Shelemiah is also optimistic that due to presence of electricity, the students and community at large will feel more secure.

Other than the secondary school, the neighboring primary school and health clinic as well as thirteen other members of the village will also be connected to the micro-grid. They are all ecstatic about this project and look forward to getting their homes and businesses connected so they no longer have to rely on kerosene lamps or diesel generators.

The solar micro-grid will allow residents to use more than just lighting. It provides AC electricity to power normal appliances like refrigerators and TVs. The residents believe that the electricity will have a positive economic impact on the community and improve the quality of life.

With the solar micro-grid installed and the kerosene lamps and diesel generators completely replaced, the students and community will live healthier and happier lives without the harmful smoke from fossil fuels.

loans.use: to connect his secondary school to the solar micro-grid on Kiwa Island, allowing the students to study using real lights rather than dim and smoky kerosene lanterns.

loans.name: Rupali

texts.en:
Rupali is a rural woman who lives in a small village of Falakata, Alipurduar district of West Bengal. She is 22 years old and lives with her husband and one toddler daughter.

Rupali is a housewife and her husband runs a bag manufacturing business with the active support of Rupali. They purchase materials like good quality fabric, thread, buttons, nylon zips, etc., and stitch bags of different sizes and colors. At leisure times, Rupali also helps in stitching bags. Her husband supplies his finished product to the wholesale dealers.

In this process, they have been able to become successful to provide financial sustenance to their family. Now to increase their saving for future, Rupali wants to expand the business. She wants to buy materials in a bulk to make bags in a large scale. As they have no capital, she seeks a business loan from Kiva via BJS.

She hopes this will enable them to manufacture bags in bulk for supplying to the wholesale dealers and will earn good revenue to ensure financial stability in her family. She dreams to open a bag shop in future with the generated profit from the business.

She is very grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials for the bag manufacturing business.

loans.name: Ronald Alexander

texts.es: Ronald de 20 años de edad, vive junto a su madre y junto a sus dos hermanos. Ronald se desempeña como jornalero en su vivienda, labor que le permite aportar a la economía del hogar, pues su sueño es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ya que habita en una vivienda humilde y en la cual no cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica, servicio que es indispensable en todo hogar. En busca de mejorar esta situación solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: caja térmica, cables eléctricos y demás herramientas para instalar la energía eléctrica en su hogar. De esta manera vivir de una mejor manera y más digna.
texts.en: Ronald is 20 years old and lives with his mother and his two brothers.  Ronald works as a day laborer, which allows him to contribute to the household economy.  His dream is to improve the quality of life for his family, who live in a humble house that does not have electricity, which is indispensable for every home.  Aiming to improve this situation, he is applying for a loan with FUSAI to invest in: a power box, electrical cables, and other gear to install electricity in his home.  Thus they may live in a better and more dignified manner.

loans.use: to invest in: a power box, electrical cables, and other gear to install electricity in his home.

loans.name: Anju

texts.en:
Anju is a 42-year-old married lady, hailing from Raychenga village in Falakata. She is blessed with a son who is a student of grade 6. She is a housewife, looks after her household, and also assists her husband in running his grocery business.

Anju's husband has been running a small grocery store for six years. He sells a variety of grocery items like mustard oil, rice, flour, sugar, spices, soap, hair oil, and other items for daily necessities at a reasonable price and has retained many regular customers. The local villagers and neighbors are his main customers. He is passionate about his work and his client volume is also high due to his polite behavior and dedication.

But the income is not satisfactory to run the family smoothly. He wants to grow the business and make his store fully stocked with different grocery items. So Anju requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BJS to buy more stock of grocery items and other daily necessities from the wholesale market for her husband’s grocery store.

She hopes that her husband would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently and expects a boost in the earnings for a better standard of living.

She expresses her gratitude to her lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for her husband's grocery store.

loans.name: Thamara

texts.en:
Thamara, aged 34, inherited her talent from her father who was also an artisan. Making jewelry out of horn is her family's heritage.

After her high school graduation, she was encouraged to come to her father’s shop to see and learn the trade. Thamara then went to a vocational school to learn handicrafts. Two years later, she had become an artisan herself. Through hard work, she has added a design piece to her father’s work and has introduced handbags to the field.

She now needs to increase production to prepare for at least three local fairs. As Thamara behaved well in her first credit with Zafen, she applies for a second loan for the same amount. The development of this project will help to strengthen her workshop and her father's while maintaining five jobs and two trainees.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as horns, sandpaper, french polish, and paints in bulk.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to make repayments for goods taken on credit.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Edlorde

texts.en:
Edlorde has been in business for the past 8 years. He is originally from Haiti and is the proud owner of EE Construction, a residential and commercial construction business located in East Orange, NJ.

Coming from a poor family, Edlorde worked hard in Haiti to provide for his family. It was there that he learned the fundamentals of construction. Given the political and economic climate, he was unable to create and sustain a successful business. After trying to pursue his dream as a business owner in Haiti, he decided to come to America to make that dream a reality.

Since immigrating to the United States, Edlorde has been working tirelessly to build a successful construction business. His hard work is now paying off. His biggest success in running his business so far has been securing long-term contracts doing construction for a large healthcare company. Edlorde's biggest challenge is finding the capital to invest in his business. As his business continues to grow, Edlorde needs to upgrade many of his tools.

A Kiva loan from you will allow Edlorde to invest in more of the tools that are essential for him to accept new construction jobs as he continues to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase new tools

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
29-year-old Jamila is a married woman who lives with her family at a small village in Falakata of West Bengal. A mother of three children (two daughters and a son) Jamila is an illiterate (but can sign her name only) housewife who was deprived of formal education in her childhood. Her children are all students of different grades.

Jamila's husband is involved in paddy cultivation. He has five years of experience in this field. This is the main source of income for the family. He sells paddy rice and straw to the local market and rice dealers. From his income, it is being very difficult for him to maintain his family.

Since paddies are grown well in their region and have a huge demand for being a staple food, they want to grab the opportunity to cultivate paddy on a large scale. To get sufficient surplus and to reinvest in the business is practically impossible for them due to lack of capital, so Jamila wants to strengthen her husband's business and thus she is seeking a loan from BJS, a Kiva partner.

She will purchase better quality seeds and other inputs like fertilizers and manure, which will help her husband in paddy cultivation and get higher production. Jamila is confident that she will be able to improve the quality of life and that of her family and provide a good educational opportunity to get her children ahead.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural inputs for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Jazmin Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado JAZMIN está en su ciclo número SEGUNDO del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, son mujeres luchadoras que se esfuerzan para poder dar a sus familias lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Limpia quien tiene una despensa bien surtida montada en su propia casa, ella es una mujer muy luchadora que se esfuerza para poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser: verduras, carne, frutas, verduras, panificados y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios, como lo viene haciendo y agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
The group named “Jazmin” is in its second loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are working and helping one another so that they can move forward. The members are determined women who strive to provide their families with the things they were not able to have.

One of the members is Sra. Limpia, who has a food pantry that she established in her home. She is a woman who is extremely determined to provide her loved ones with everything that she was not able to have.

Limpia is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of inventory for her food pantry such as vegetables, meat, fruits, baked goods, and other products. This will enable her to continue her sales just as before. Limpia appreciates the opportunity she has received.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, fruits, baked goods, and other products.

loans.name: Ana Dilia

texts.es: Ana de 22 años de edad, vive al lado de sus hijos, una niña de 2 años y un niño de 6 años de edad. Ana con mucho esfuerzo lucha por que a sus hijos no les falte nada y puedan crecer con todo lo necesario en su vida. Ella se dedica a vender productos de belleza y así de esta manera obtener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir sus necesidades básicas y las de sus hijos. En busca de mejorar su calidad de vida, Ana decide solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para construir un cuarto habitación en su vivienda, para ofrecerle una calidad de vida mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en: Ana, who is 22, lives with her children, a two-year-old little girl and a six-year-old little boy.  Ana really exerts herself to make sure her children don't want for anything and can grow up with everything they need in life.  She sells beauty products for a living and this is how she generates the income she needs to cover her basic needs and those of her children.  In search of a better quality of life, Ana has decided to request a loan from FUSAI to spend on: brick, cement, sand, and labor costs to build a bedroom in her home to provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to spend on: brick, cement, sand, and labor costs to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in her business by buying merchandise.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a married woman and has been blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Usha

texts.en:
Usha is 43 years old and she is married. She is a mason by profession. She lives in Bolangir district, a rural town in Odisha,India. Her family is a low-income household in the village and the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet. She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true.

With her business profit, Usha hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to build a new toilet

loans.name: Banita

texts.en:
Banita is 47 years old and she is married. She has been involved in thecarpentry business for the last seven years. She lives in Bolangir district, a rural town in Odisha, India. Her family is a low-income household in the village and the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new and clean toilet. She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true.

With her business profit, Banita hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to build a new and clean toilet

loans.name: Faida

texts.en:
Faida is a married woman and she lives together with her husband and five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is 30 years old and she is married. She has had a fish selling business for last five years. She lives in Bolangir district, a rural town in Odisha, India. Her family is a low-income household in the village and the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet. She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true.

With her business profit, Sabita hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to build a new toilet

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman and has been blessed with six children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a fish selling business for over two years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Kumudini

texts.en:
Kumudini is 27 years old and she is single. She is a tailor by profession and works hard to earn her livelihood. She lives in Bolangir district, a rural town in Odisha, India. Her family is a low-income household in the village and the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet. She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true.

With her business profit, Kumudini hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Basanti

texts.en:
Basanti is 32 years old and she is married. She has had a tailoring business for last six years. She lives in Bolangir district, a rural town in Odisha, India. Her family is a low-income household in the village and the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new hygienic toilet. She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true.

With her business profit, Basanti hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to build a new hygienic toilet

loans.name: Roxana Edelmira

texts.es: Roxana de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compeñro de vida y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboracion de piñatas para fiestas de cumpleaños desde hace 10 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y con las ventas que realiza ha logrado cubrir los gastos de su hogar, la clienta solicita un crédito que le permita comprar más materiales como: papeles de todo tipo de colores, pegamento, alambre, papel de diario entre otras cosas que le sirven para la elaboración y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Roxana is 40 and lives in her own home with her life partner and their two children.  She has been making piñatas for birthday parties for 10 years; her business is located in her home and with her sales she has been able to cover her household expenses.  She is requesting a loan, which will allow her to buy more materials, such as: paper in all kinds of colors, glue, wire, newspaper, and other things that she uses.  This will allow her to make more profits so she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more materials, such as: paper in all kinds of colors, glue, wire, newspaper, and other items.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia Carmen se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bank member Carmen has a business selling prepared foods. She makes different dishes, such as roasted chicken, soups, and beef stir fry. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. She has had this business for 8 years now and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to buy products to cook, such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

She is happy with he loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy products to cook, such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman; she has six children, all of whom attend school. Mariam owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mariam has operated a charcoal selling business for the one year, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Pinki

texts.en:
Pinki is 28 years old and she is married. She has had a vegetable vending business for last two years. She lives in Bolangir district, a rural town in Odisha, India. Her family is a low-income household in the village and the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet. She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true.

With her business profit, Pinki hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to build a new toilet

loans.name: Mukhi

texts.en:
Mukhi is 34 years old and she is married. She has had a food stall business for the last four years. She lives in Bolangir district, a rural town in Odisha, India. Her family is a low-income household in the village and the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet. She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true.

With her business profit, Mukhi hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Tapaswini

texts.en:
Tapaswini is 30 years old and she is married. She has engaged in the farming business for the last five years. She lives in Bolangir district, a rural town in Odisha, India. Her family is a low-income household in the village and the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet. She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true.

With her business profit, Tapaswini hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to build a new toilet

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and inflation in her place of business.

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: A.  Anastasie

texts.fr: Anastasie est une femme mariée âgée de 47 ans résidante à Tokoin. Mère de quatre enfants, Anastasie est une marchande des produits alimentaires qu’elle revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Anastasie s’approvisionne de ses marchandises quatre fois par mois  au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des unités de boîtes de lait concentrés et des cartons de mayonnaises. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Anastasie compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider son mari à prendre en charge les besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Anastasie is a 47 year-old married woman, living in Tokoin. Mother of four children, Anastasie is a trader of food products that she resells by going around to surrounding neighbourhoods. Anastasie supplies herself with goods four times a month at the market and wants this loan to order cans of condensed milk and boxes of mayonnaise. With the profit margin which will result, Anastasie hopes to improve her sales performance and help her husband to take care of the family needs.

loans.use: to buy 24 cans of condensed milk and 12 boxes of mayonnaise.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation and inflation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana se desempeña como secretaria en un consultorio odontológico hace más de 6  años, a la par que trabaja también estudia la carrera de enfermería, y quiere de esa forma mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. 
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Juana has been working as a secretary at a dentist’s office for more than six years. In addition to her job, she is also studying for a degree in Nursing. She wants to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones.

Juana is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the payment of her degree fees. This will allow her to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia Norma pertenece al banco SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, la socia continua dedicándose  a la  producción y venta de lácteos como leche, queso y yogurt, la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente, la socia  continua produciendo  leche, queso y yogurt entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Communal Bank “San Bartolome de Tambo Real”. She continues to produce and sell dairy products such as milk, cheese, and yogurt. Norma is extremely grateful to Kiva for helping her develop her business activity. Therefore, she is committed to completing her loan payments on time. Norma continues to produce milk, cheese, yogurt, and other products. She is a responsible person and is able to help her family move forward by working in this manner.

Norma is requesting a loan in order to buy milk.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Irene operates a vegetable stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 45,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Rositas De Panamericana Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSITAS DE PANAMERICANA” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Primitiva es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa de lana para niños, venta de pelotas, tienda de barrio, venta de hierbas, venta de zapatos. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Primitiva es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa de lana para niños; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, realizo un curso de tejidos y con estos conocimientos más el pequeño capital con el que contaba, decidió emprender este negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “ROSITAS DE PANAMERICANA” communal bank is starting their seventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana regional office. It is made up of eight members lead by a board of directors with Primitiva as President. The business that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied. Amongst them are: the sale of children's wool clothing, selling balls, a neighborhood store, the sale of herbs and the sale of shoes.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit the micro-entrepreneurs of whom Primitiva is a member. She indicated that she became part of Pro Mujer, joining on the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. At present she has a business selling woolen clothing for children. She says that she started the business a number of years ago. She took a course in knitting and with this knowledge and the small amount of capital she had and decided to start her business.

The loan that she is now taking out will be used to augment her capital (buying wool wholesale) that she will acquire at the vendors in the city of El Alto and later after making them she will sell them in her commercial space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to economically support her family as she has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she liked the health services and training that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity.

Sarah has been operating a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Riziki has operated a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers, for the past three years. Her major challenge is transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze is a married woman with six children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to improve her living standards.

With the KES 35,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

Eunice operates a vegetable stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation in her place of operation.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, gracias a su trabajo es como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 62-years old and lives in her own home with her family. She has worked for several years making and selling tortillas. Her business is located in her home and she has a lot of customers. Thanks to her work, she manages to resolve some household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy pounds of corn and lime to be able to continue making tortillas. This way she will have a better income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pounds of corn and lime.

loans.name: Kenia Jacqueline

texts.es: Kenia de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con hermana, ella posee un comedor ubicado cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada por es razon posee muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como ha podido salir adelante con su familia, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de materia prima como arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Kenia is 41-years old and lives in her own home with her sister. She owns a diner located near her home in a busy area. For this reason, she has a lot of customers. With what she gets from her sales, she has been able to support her family. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc., to change her menu and have a little more economic income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Apu Curi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “APU CURI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teresa ella es casada y tiene 50 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere que sus hijos que terminen de estudiar, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant grande. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras, arroz y carne.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de chanchos, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Apu Curi" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Urcos, belonging to the Quispicanchis province and department of Cuzco.

One of the members is Teresa. She is married, 50-years old and has 4 children. She works in her restaurant business. She is an entrepreneurial woman who, through this business, wants her children to finish studying. Her dream is to have a big restaurant.

She is asking for the loan to buy chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat. She is attached to the group photo as her photo was taken after the meeting because she had permission for work reasons. The members that are attached to the group photo had their photo taken after the meeting because they had permission for work reasons. The other members work in businesses selling pigs, selling animals, running a grocery store, and having a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat.

loans.name: Afua

texts.fr: Afua est une femme mariée de 48 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Mère de deux enfants, Afua est une revendeuse des céréales. Afua s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile pour atteindre ses objectifs. Pour commander des bols de maïs et de sorghos, Afua nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire en vue de bien vendre puis de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants en payant les frais scolaire dès la rentrée à venir.
texts.en: Afua is a 48 year-old married woman who lives in Tokoin. Mother of two children, Afua is a trader of cereals. Afua gets her supplies twice a month at the market and resells them at the front window of her home in order to meet her goals. To order bowls of corn and sorghum, Afua needs these funds to pay for her supplies and make a good profit margin with a view to sell well and also to be able to meet the needs of her children by paying for their school fees at the start of the upcoming school year.

loans.use: to buy 20 bowls of corn and 16 bowls of sorghum.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Francisco de 30 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia al lado de su compañera de vida, un hijo de 2 años y al lado de su madre de 67 años de edad. Francisco posee un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa para dama y caballero, negocio que maneja desde hace algún tiempo. Lo que le permite que para este tiempo ya posea un buen número de clientes y lo que le permite que con este negocio pueda mantener la economía del hogar, pero Francisco desea poder mejorar su calidad de vida y por lo que quiere aumentar las ventas de sus productos para poder aumentar las ganancias y para ello es necesario hacer una inversión y comprar más productos, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria. Por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: camisas, pantalones, blusas, lencería y todo tipo de ropa para dama y caballero. De esta manera aumentar la mercancía y así aumentar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Francisco is 30 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner, 2 year old son, and his 67 year old mother. Francisco has had a small business selling clothing for men and women for some time. This has enabled him to have a good number of customers and pay the household expenses.

Francisco wants to improve his quality of life and thus wants to increase the sales of his products so he can increase his income. It is necessary to make an investment and purchase more products, but he does not have the necessary financial liquidity. Therefore, he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in shirts, pants, blouses, lingerie, and all types of clothing for women and men. In this way he can increase his merchandise, and thus increase his income.

loans.use: to invest in shirts, pants, blouses, lingerie, and all kinds of clothes for men and women.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beer, sodas, wine, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel estudia la carrera de medicina con el anhelo de poder ser un profesional útil a la sociedad, y también para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de sus conocimientos, se es fuerza mucho y pone todo de si para poder cumplir con sus metas. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en cubrir sus gastos de titulación y agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Angel is studying for a degree in Medicine with the goal of becoming a useful professional in society. In addition, he wants to help his family as a result of his knowledge. Angel does his best and puts forth everything he can to accomplish his goals. He says that his previous loan was used to pay his degree fees, which was a great help.

Today he is requesting another loan so that he can invest in the payment of his degree expenses. Angel appreciates this new opportunity he has received.

loans.use: to pay his degree expenses.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema  is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that  has neither electricity not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Helma

texts.en:
Here's Helma. 

Previously, she availed a loan worth PHP 25,000. It was a big help for her in her business journey. Through the granted loan, she was able to buy enough resources and raw materials needed in her tailoring business like needles, cloth, threads and other items. With that, she found a way to increase her sales. 

To further widen her inventory, she humbly requests you to allow her to acquire again a loan worth PHP 35,000, which she will use for the same purpose. She would like to obtain additional materials needed for making clothes. She hopes you can give her another chance this time to prove that her dream (to someday have a better living and attract even more customers) is worth working hard for. 

She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week, where she can share stories of her life and business and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional sewing tools and accessories like fabric, needles, thread, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
As a married mother of 10 children, Rona works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling fruits. Rona is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Rona has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Bijon

texts.en: Bijon is a wonderful woman. She is a hardworking woman with a kind heart. Bijon is a married parent of five children. She cares well for her children. Bijon lives with her family in a village so she has been busy with animal husbandry. Bijon mainly feeds cows. She sells milk and milk products in a local market and she has repeat clients. Bijon has worked hard for more than 15 years and she has great experience in this field. Bijon is going to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni to buy cows for producing more milk. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase her working capital

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL.
La socia  es la señora María Cleofe, la socia continúa con su negocio de ganadería, la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para arreglar su establo.
texts.en:
Sra. María Cleofe is a member of the Communal Bank “San Bartolome de Tambo Real”. She continues to manage her livestock business. María Cleofe is extremely grateful to Kiva for helping her develop her business activity. Therefore, she promises to complete her loan payments on time. María Cleofe is a responsible person who wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to repair her stable.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to her stable.

loans.name: Djaharatou

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, Djaharatou est une femme âgée de 37 ans résidant à Tokoin. Djaharatou est une marchande  de produits d’alimentations générales qui s’approvisionne de ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché et le revend dans une boutique qu’elle a louée. Djaharatou sollicite ce prêt pour commander des cartons de lait en sachet et des lots de crèmes de beauté en vue d’avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de ses enfants et à subvenir aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées par sa famille.
texts.en: Married and mother of four children, Djaharatou is a 37 year-old woman living in Tokoin. Djaharatou is a seller of grocery products who stocks up on her goods twice a month at the market and resells them in a shop that she has rented. Djaharatou asks for this loan to order boxes of milk sachets and 55 batches of beauty cream with a view to have a large stock and maximize her profit in order to assist her husband in the education of her children and to meet the daily burdens faced by her family.

loans.use: to buy 5 boxes of milk sachets and 55 batches of beauty cream.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en: Domingo has been helping his wife work their own farm to make a living. He has repaid successfully his previous loan used for organic fertilization of his farm. His budget with his previous loan was not enough to cover the entire farm. So he took a new loan recently to buy additional organic fertilizer for the farm. He is hopeful of gaining more income from his farm because he has invested more capital in order to improve his farm.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizer for the rice field.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes that she can sell.

loans.name: Ruth Raquel

texts.es:
Ruth Raquel con 28 años de edad, de estado civil madre soltera, vive en casa familiar,vive junto a su menor hija, en el distrito de Zaña, provincia Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. Ruth Raquel cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Ruth Raquel se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir para colegios, institutos y público en general.Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de telas para capital de trabajo y otros gastos. De esta manera satisfaciendo las necesidades de los habitantes de la zona. Así mismo ampliar su cartera, contando con usuarios nuevos e ingresos adicionales para su familia.

Ruth Raquel cuenta con experiencia crediticia con casas comerciales.
texts.en:
Ruth Raquel is 28 years old and a single mother. She lives in her family home; she lives with her youngest daughter in the district of Zaña in Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Department, in the country of Peru. Ruth Raquel has very good personal and professional references among the people who live in the area. The residents of this area work mostly in farming, commerce, and livestock.

Ruth Raquel sews uniforms for schools, institutions, and the general public. She is requesting this loan to buy fabrics for working capital and other expenses. This will allow her to meet the needs of the people who live in the area. This will also expand her client list with new people and generate additional income for her family.

Ruth Raquel has credit history with trading houses.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for capital and supplies and other expenses.

loans.name: Erlina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Erlina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Erlina is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Erlina has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Adidja

texts.fr: Adidja est une femme mariée âgée de 35 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Mère de trois enfants, Adidja prépare du riz qu’elle revend à  la devanture de son domicile. Adidja s’approvisionne du nécessaire deux fois par mois  au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des bols de riz et des tas de condiments.  Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne vente, Adidja compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider ses enfants à avoir un épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Adidja is a 35 year-old married woman who lives in Tokoin. Mother of three children, Adidja prepares rice that she re-sells at the front window of her home. Adidja gets her necessary supplies twice a month at the market and wants this loan to order bowls of rice and heaps of condiments. With the profit margin that will result from a good sale, Adidja hopes to improve her sales performance, to help her children grow up well and have a good school education.

loans.use: to buy 40 bowls of rice and 2 heaps of condiments.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es de la ciudad de San Pedro, es estudiante de la carrera de ingeniería agrónoma, por medio de  sus estudios quiere abrirse camino y ser alguien en la vida.
Está contento ya que este préstamo que pide le será de ayuda para la elaboración de su tesis. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar su vida a través de sus estudios.
texts.en:
Juan is from the city of San Pedro and is studying for a degree in Agricultural Engineering. Through his studies, he wants to be able to open doors and make something out of his life.

Juan is pleased with this loan that he will receive since it will help him with the composition of his thesis. He appreciates this opportunity he has received so that he can improve his life through his studies.

loans.use: to pay his thesis expenses.

loans.name: Ana Myra

texts.en:
Ana Myra is 42 years old and married with six children who are all enrolled in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ana Myra has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

Ana Myra has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is 41 years old and married with five children.

Feliciana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Feliciana has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Feliciana aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Estrellieta

texts.en:
Estrellieta is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, biscuits, candies, etc. 

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Estrellieta dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, biscuits, and candies

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 43 years old with three children, two of whom are in school, Gemma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods to sell like canned goods, milk, chips, eggs, etc.

Gemma has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell like canned goods, milk, chips, and eggs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Teresita is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell to customers.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 29 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 46 years old and married with eight children. With three children currently in school, Aida works very hard to provide for them.

Aida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell to her customers.

Aida has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, vinegar, shampoo, candies, etc. 

In the future, Aida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Vorng's Group

texts.en: Vorng’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. Vorng makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Seng's Group

texts.en: Seng’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. Seng makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her  family.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.en:
Jose is 53 years old and lives in the municipality of San Pelayo. He has 6 children, 4 girls and 2 boys and he loves his big family and feels very proud of each and every one of them. Raising them hasn’t been easy but he fights hard so he can give them a good life. This boosted him to start his own business; he’s going to raise pigs.

He’s ready to work hard so he can obtain good profits from his business about to start, because he expects that it can last in time having which with he can support his family. He’s asking for a loan so he can start his business and build a pigsty and buy feed for sustaining his pigs.

Jose’s biggest dream is make his family happy, let his children grow up in an excellent environment and as good people. He also expects he can improve his house so they live better. You can be part of this beautiful story about to begin, a loan will help him a lot.

loans.use: start his business and build a pigsty and for sustaining his pigs
